loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy vegetables, cereals and sodas

loans.name: Ena Luz

texts.es: Ena Luz S. A.  llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla desde hace 17 años, cuando quedó viuda con sus tres hijos  y decidió buscarles un mejor horizonte, inicialmente trabajó como empleada del servicio doméstico durante dos años, época en la cual perfeccionó su forma de preparar comidas,  por eso al dejar esta actividad y unirse a su cónyuge se dedicó a ella; en un principio vendió sopas en porciones y hoy tiene como actividad principal la venta de almuerzos diarios a 35 operarios de la construcción, a la cual ha agregado la venta de deditos de queso, y  de bebidas frías especialmente de cervezas, actividad que realiza los fines de semana en los cuales vende  numero no menor de 30 canastas, también ofrece servicios de telefonía celular, actividades que le representa ingresos adicionales; en su negocio la apoya su nuera, a quien paga diariamente y sostiene un empleo directo. Ena Luz ahora madre de 5 hijos  en las edades de 6 a 21 años, tres de ellos viviendo en otra población con sus abuelos, sigue  soñando con que todos logren ser exitosos y puedan estudiar y ser profesionales de bien; así mismo Ena dirige todos sus esfuerzos para que esto ocurra mediante el arduo trabajo diario y apoyada por su cónyuge que trabaja como celador de una constructora. Este es el primer financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con él comprará productos no perecederos como arroz, aceite y granos y también cervezas al por mayor,  inversión que augura sea exitosa, no solo por la experiencia de la microempresaria en estas actividades,  sino también porque se acerca la temporada mas alegre, divertida de la Ciudad: El carnaval de Barranquilla donde “todo lo que se ofrece se vende” especialmente los productos que prepara Ena para verbenas y fiesta autóctonas que realizan las familias en sus comunidades.
texts.en:
Ena Luz S. A. arrived in the city of Barranquilla 17 years ago  She had become a widow with three children and decided to seek a better life.  Initially she worked as a domestic worker for two years, during which time she perfected her way of preparing meals.  She therefore stopped this activity and joined with her current spouse who was devoted to her.  At first she sold servings of soup, and today's main activity is the sale of lunches on a daily basis to 35 construction workers.  She has added to this the sale of cheese fingers and cold drinks, especially beer, on the weekends, when she sells at least 30 cases.  She also offers cell phone services, an activity that provides additional income.  Her daughter supports her in this business, she is paid daily and is directly employed by the business.

Ena Luz is now the mother of 5 children aged between 6 to 21 years.  Three of them live in another town with their grandparents.  She dreams of them all achieving success and being able to study and become professionals.  Ena therefore directs all her efforts to make this happen through daily hard work, and she is supported in this by her husband who works as a janitor at a construction firm. 

This is the first funding she has received from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy non-perishable products such as rice, oil, grain and beer at wholesale.  This is an investment that promises to be successful, not only because of the experience of the entrepreneur in these activities but also because the season is about to become more cheerful with fun in the city from The Carnival of Barranquilla, where "everything is for sale", especially those products Ena prepares for festivals and for the local celebrations that take place with families in their communities.

loans.use: to buy non-perishable products such as rice, oil, grains and also beer at wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tables, chairs, and beverages.

loans.name: Maka

texts.en:
Maka P. and her husband live in the village of Meskheti, Tskaltubo Region. They have two boys – 18 and 17 years old. Maka’s mother-in-law lives with them as well. She is retired. 

Maka is 38 years old. She has been engaged in agricultural activities for 20 years. The main source of the family income is agriculture. They have three milk cows and produce cheese, which is sold in a grocery shop. Also the family owns a plot of land with an area of 1 ha, where cucumbers and greens are grown. 

With the requested amount, Maka plans to cultivate that plot, sowing greens and cucumbers. Maka hopes that after proper cultivation she will have a good harvest and her family’s income will increase. Part of the increased income will be reinvested in the business and the other part will be used to cover her sons’ study fees.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and fertilizers for farming.

loans.name: Lucía Del Socorro

texts.es:
La sonrisa de Lucía del Socorro V. J. demuestra la felicidad que le impone a la vida y  aunque para ella no ha sido fácil por ser madre cabeza de familia de 3 hijos, su dedicación, esfuerzo y ganas de salir adelante le han permitido trabajar fuertemente para mejorar su calidad vida y la de su familia. 

Lucía lucha incansablemente y desde hace muchos años conoció la ley del rebusque; chance, licor y mercancía al por mayor, fueron algunas de las labores que esta emprendedora inició con el propósito de salir adelante con su familia. 

Después Lucía se hizo a una cacharrería en la que trabaja desde las 12:00 del día hasta las 12:00 de la noche y aunque su jornada es larga, Lucía está convencida de que sólo así se cumplirá su sueño, tener una gran cacharrería que no sea reconocida sólo en el barrio sino también en la ciudad y así ofrecerle un buen futuro a su familia. 

Actualmente esta emprendedora requiere de un préstamo para comprar surtido y comprar celulares que le permitan incrmentar la venta de minutos que le generarán mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Lucía del Socorro V. J.'s smile shows the happiness she puts into life, although for her it hasn't been easy to be a mother and head of household in a family with 3 children. Her striving, dedication, and eagerness to get ahead have allowed her to work hard to improve her and her family's quality of life.  

Lucía struggles tirelessly and many years ago she got to know the temporary employment, lottery, liquor and wholesale merchandise law. This enterprising woman started various jobs with the purpose of getting ahead with her family.    

Later, Lucía opened a hardware store where she works from 12:00 p.m. to 12:00 a.m. Although her day is long, Lucía is convinced that this is the only way she can accomplish her dream of having a hardware store known not only in the neighborhood, but in the city as well. In this way, she will offer a good future to her family. 

At present, this enterprising woman needs a loan to buy a variety of products and to buy cell phones that will allow her to increase the sale of minutes that will bring in more income.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products for her hardware store and to buy cellphones to sell minutes.

loans.name: Mollecato Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MOLLECATO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Augusta; ella es viuda y tiene 49 años y tiene 6 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de compra y venta de maíz,trigo,arveja y papa y también se dedica a la crianza de animales y tiene un terreno donde siembra papa y maíz, los animales y las verduras lo vende en el mercado de Urcos desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de maíz,trigo,arveja y papa y también de crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales y para comprar fertilizantes para la tierra de cultivo.


Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de crianza de animales, venta de tejas, compra y venta de granos secos y negocio de venta de comida.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "MOLLECATO," which is located in the district of Urcos, belonging to the province and department of Cusco Quispicanchis.

The featured member is Augusta, 49 years old, who is a widow and has 6 children.  She works in the business of buying and selling corn, wheat, pea and potatoes and is also devoted to raising animals.  She has land where she plants potatoes and corn.  She sells animals and vegetables in the market Urcos from 7:00 am to 4:00 pm.   Through this business, she raises her children.  Augusta wants to expand and improve the business of selling corn, wheat, peas and potatoes and animal husbandry.  She is requesting a loan to buy animals and to buy fertilizer for farmland.

The other partners are in the business of raising animals, selling tiles, purchasing and selling dried beans and selling food.

Augusta thanks those who are part of this dream through this loan and agrees to comply with the payment of her dues on time.

loans.use: to buy animals and fertilizer for farmland.

loans.name: Reid

texts.en: Reid sells millet, maize and maize flour. She is 36 years old and married with three children. All of the children go to school. Reid borrowed a loan to stock more millet, maize and maize flour to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits.

loans.use: to buy more millet, maize and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a married woman with five children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 2 years, she has operated a fish selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge because of the high cost of transporting charcoal to her place of sale. Patricia dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 Patricia wants to purchase utensils for cooking fish and bundles of fish. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase utensils for cooking fish and bundles of fish.

loans.name: Fresia

texts.es:
Fresia forma parte del banco comunal “Esperanza para todos” perteneciente a la ciudad de Valparaíso.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente venta de abarrotes, alimento para perros, frutas y verduras en un almacén ubicado en su casa, desde hace un año y medio. Sus clientes son frecuentes y antiguos.
Cuando comenzó a trabajar en negocios, vendía ropa interior le iba muy bien, pero decidió cambiar de rubro al de la venta de abarrotes, en un comienzo compraba poca cantidad de mercadería y los créditos de Fondo esperanza le han ayudado a invertir en mayor cantidad en su negocio. El horario de atención es de 8ºº de la mañana a 11ºº de la noche. Su mercadería la compra en supermercados mayoristas. Con el préstamo compró mercadería y arregló su vehículo.
Fresia vive junto a su marido, él es quien le ayuda en la atención de su negocio y realización de compras, después de sufrir un accidente vascular.
Sus metas son comprar un vehículo nuevo para trasladar su mercadería e incorporar en su negocio la venta de productos de paquetería.
Sus sueños son seguir trabajando, para generar mayores ganancias y poder comprar un terreno para criar diferentes tipos de animales.
Fresia está muy contenta y agradecida de los créditos otorgados por Fondo esperanza, ya que ha podido invertir en su negocio. La relación con las demás socias del grupo del banco comunal, ha sido muy grata, ya que ellos son solidarios y organizados. Las capacitaciones le han servido para organizar su negocio.
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
Fresia is a member of the Communal Bank “Esperanza para Todos” (Hope for All) which is in the city of Valparaíso. She is a merchant who sells groceries, dog food, fruits, and vegetables from a store located in her house. Fresia has been in business for a year and a half. She has long-time customers who shop with her frequently.

When she started her business, Fresia sold undergarments and did very well. However, she decided to switch over to selling groceries. She started out selling small quantities of merchandise and the loans from Fondo Esperanza have helped her invest in larger amounts of inventory. Her work schedule is from 8am to 11pm. Fresia buys her merchandise from the wholesale supermarkets. With this loan, she will buy merchandise and repair her vehicle.

Fresia lives with her husband. After he suffered a heart attack, her husband has helped manage the business and purchase goods. Her goals include buying a new vehicle so that she can transport her merchandise. In addition, she wants to incorporate the sale of packaged goods into her business. Her dreams are to continue working, generate more income, and buy a plot of land so that she can raise all types of animals.

Fresia is pleased with and appreciative of the loans provided by Fondo Esperanza since they have enabled her to invest in her business. Her relationship with the other members of her Communal Bank has been gratifying since they are supportive and organized. The training seminars have helped her with managing her business.

Valparaíso is situated 120 kilometers northwest of Santiago. It is the regional capital and seat of the national legislature. Valparaíso is the main port of Chile and offers a wide variety of beautiful and picturesque places to visit, such as the home of poet Pablo Neruda, winner of the Nobel Prize.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store and to pay for vehicle repairs.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: She is currently in the business of selling fruit on the side of the road. She sells tomato, pineapple, apple and other fruits. She is requesting a loan to expand her small business. She is 31 years old and married . She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan she hopes to be able to easily pay her school fees.

loans.use: to expand her small business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La Sra. Juanita es  una persona  trabajadora  y  muy  responsable,  y  se  dedica  a la venta  de  tamales, actualmente  ella  requiere  hacerle   frente  a los  gastos  de  graduación  de  su    hija  y lamentablemente   no cuenta  con   el capital  suficiente   para  hacerle   frente , es  por  ello  que   necesita   de  nuestro  apoyo  para  realizar  la  compra  de    materia   prima  para   elaborar  tamales  y  venderlos  entre  sus  clientes, agradece el  apoyo   brindado para la realización de su proyecto  ya  que  el estudio  y  educacion es  la  mayor  herencia  que   puede  dejar  a  su  hija.
texts.en: Juanita is a hard working, very responsible person.  She sells tamales.  She wants to be able to take care of her daughter’s graduation expenses but regrettably lacks sufficient funds to do so.  Because of this she needs our help to buy raw materials to make tamales to sell among her customers.  She appreciates the support provided to carry out her project because schooling and education is the best inheritance a parent can leave her daughter.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make tamales.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana, tiene 38 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de León. Es madre de dos hijos, esta casada , su nivel de estudios es básico solo llego hasta tercer grado de primaria. Ella es comerciante se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, también vende ropa. A la edad de 19 años inicio vendiendo frutas y verduras de manera ambulante lo hizo con capital propio, 6 años después comenzó a vender ropa de manera ambulante así poco a poco y fruto de su esfuerzo y lucha diaria ha subsistido ella y su familia.  
Solicito el préstamo para comprar frutas, verduras y ropa para vender. Con esta inversión espera abastecer su inventario de frutas y ropa, tener variedad de producto que ofrecer y mejorar sus ventas. En sus planes futuros quiere poner una tienda de ropa y calzado, comprar una moto para movilizarse. Su próxima meta es comprar un carretón metálico para su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana, 38, lives in the city of Leon.  She is married and is the mother of 2 children.  She has only a 3rd grade education.  She is a trader who sells fruits and vegetables, and also clothing.  She started selling fruits and vegetables on the street when she was 19, and she started that business with her own capital.  Six years later she started selling clothing as well, and gradually, as a result of her efforts and her daily struggle, she and her family have had enough to live on.

She requests a loan to buy fruits, vegetables and clothing to sell. With this investment she hopes to build up her inventory of fruit and clothing, and have a variety of products to sell so that she can increase her sales.  In the future, she plans to have a clothing and shoe store and a motorcycle to get around.  Her next goal is to buy a metal cart for her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables and clothing to sell

loans.name: Muungano Group

texts.en:
S. is in his early 30s and is married with three children; two of them go to school.  He has had a butcher business since 2003. He works from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be his 2nd "Motisha" loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  A "Motisha" loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania  given in the middle of the main loan that motivates borrowers with good credit ratings who pay back their  loans  smoothly. They receive half the amount of the existing loan before their original loan term has ended. He used the previous loan to buy more meat, fresh fish, chicken, household expenses and has paid back his loan successfully. He wants a loan to increase stock of meat in his the butcher shop.  His dream is to one day open another butchery in a different area.
 
He will share this loan with his loan group "Muungano" which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase stock of meat in his  butcher shop..

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Helen has a shop that sells a variety of dried fish. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy dried fish to sell.

Helen has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Helen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell

loans.name: Shomet

texts.en:
Shomet is 33  years old and married with two children. He has been a mixed farmer in Narok for the last ten years, with a monthly income of KES 5,000 (Kenyan shillings).

He was introduced to KADET by a registered client in his abode. He has been a good client and this is his third loan. With the loan he has planned to purchase farm inputs i.e. fertilizers, seeds and chemicals. He intends to use the return from the loan to plough back into farming and in part to repay the loan.

His dreams are to become a famous farmer in the area and to educate his children to a higher level of education. He is an industrious man who struggles to achieve if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Felipe Nolasco

texts.es:
El señor Felipe Nolasco es casado, tiene 58 años de edad, cursó 6 años de educación primaria,tiene 3 hijos que lo apoyan, se dedica a tender una tienda de consumo, inició este negocio con su señor padre y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa que se dedica a los oficios del hogar.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para compra productos para su negocio: aguas gaseosas, jugos, galletas, dulces, fideos, lácteos, etc. Espera en el futuro tener un negocio mas grande.
texts.en:
Felipe Nolasco is married, and he is 58 years old.  He has six years of an elementary school education.  He has three children who help him.  He has a store selling food.  He started this business thanks to God.  He has ten years of experience so far.  He has his wife’s support; she does the household chores.

He is requesting a loan to buy products for his business.  He will buy carbonated waters, juices, cookies, sweets, noodles, and dairy products, etc.  He hopes to have a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy products for his store, such as carbonated waters, juices, cookies, sweets, noodles, and dairy products.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 27 years old, married, and they do not have children yet. He has operated an auto spare parts shop for the last four years, with a monthly profit of about KES 40,000.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a registered client of KADET LTD, and he is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD, with which he plans to buy a welding machine.

He will plow the anticipated profits back into his business for it to grow. In future he plans to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Thắng

texts.en:
Thắng is a 46 year-old female living in the town of Yen Phong distict - Bac Ninh province.  She is married and has 3 adult -age children.  To make a living,Thắng owns & operates a furniture making business.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from making & selling cabinets & wardrobe furniture to local businesses and community members. Thắng has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, Thắng joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Thắng has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase machinery to expand the business.  Thắng is now requesting a new loan of 8.736.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings.  The loan will be the 6th loan she has taken from SEDA.  Thắng plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to save as a reserve for future emergencies.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Thắng là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yen Phong distict - Bac Ninh province.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống, Thắng Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán tủ kéo & tủ áo quần cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Thắng thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Thắng kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2007, Thắng đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Thắng đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua máy móc để mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.736.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua nguyên liệu thô bổ sung để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm.  Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  Thắng dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  tiết kiệm cho những trường hợp khẩn cấp sau này.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Ela

texts.es: Ela, de 31 años, es una mujer buena y amable. Vive con su pareja, con quien tiene un hijo de 7 años en su casa propia.  El trabajo de Ela consiste en el alquiler de mototaxi, lleva trabajando en este negocio ya por dos años y lo hace con la ayuda de su conviviente quien maneja una unidad y el otro mototaxi lo maneja un chofer, quien paga el alquiler de dicho vehículo. Empezó a realizar esta actividad a raíz que tuvo necesidades de poder tener mayor ingreso en su hogar. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene un ingresos adicional al de su pareja y gracias a ello puede solventar los gastos del hogar. Este será el primer crédito con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Además es conciente de la responsabilidad que asume y hará todo lo posible para poder pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo. Con el monto solicitado, comprará piezas, repuestos y pagará al mecánico para hacer la refacción total de sus dos vehículos.
texts.en:
31-year-old Ela is a good and kind woman.  She lives with her partner and 7-year-old son in her own home.  Ela's work is renting out a motorcycle taxi.  She has been in this business for two years.  She works with her partner, who drives one of the vehicles.  The other vehicle is driven by a driver who pays to hire it.  Ela started out in this business because she needed to have more income for her household.  What she likes about her work is that it makes her extra income in addition to that of her partner and, thanks to it, she is able to cover her household expenses.

This will be Ela's first loan from MFP and she hopes to receive your cooperation so that she can continue reaching her goals.  She is aware of the responsibility that this implies and will do everything she can to make her loan repayments on time.  She will use the sum she has requested to buy spare parts and to pay the mechanic who will totally refurbish her two vehicles.

loans.use: to pay a mechanic to fix her two vehicles, and to buy spare parts

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is married to a footballer and has two children. She sells provisions and food items at Kwahinkrom. She has been running this business for two years. Gladys uses her income to support her husband in providing for the family. She will use this loan to purchase more provisions and items for resale. Gladys will use her new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions and items for resale.

loans.name: Retina

texts.es:
Retiña, de 27 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de alegre y sociable, es conviviente con Miguel, fruto de esa unión tiene una hija de 10 años de edad, instalados cómodamente en su casa propia.
El negocio que realiza Retiña es el comercio de diversos productos como ropa, gaseosas y golosinas. Los cuales compra en la ciudad de Pucallpa, para luego enviarlos por el laderas del rió, al caserío, en donde está instalado su pareja que se dedica a lavado de oro, pero ahí mismo tiene instalado una bodega, donde venden todos los productos que le envía Retiña. Tiene 3 años dedicándose a esta actividad, y gracias a ello tiene solvencia económica, que le permite arreglar su casa, viajar a los caseríos, y ahorrar un capital, pues tiene planes de abrir una tienda de venta de golosinas en alguna zona comercial céntrica de la ciudad. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en el crédito anterior. Además de sentirse cómoda con su banco comunal, ya que considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables y solidarias. Con  el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías como gaseosas y ropa, así como también productos para la campaña navideña como panteones, arbolitos artificiales de navidad y otros.
texts.en:
Retiña, who is 27 years old, is a hardworking woman, as well as being cheerful and sociable. She lives with Miguel, and they have a 10 year old daughter together. They all live comfortably in their own home.

Retiña runs a business selling various products such as clothes, fizzy drinks and sweets. She buys these in the city of Pucallpa. She then sends them along the banks of the river to the village where her partner is based, who works washing gold. There they have a storeroom set up, where they sell the products that Retiña sends over. They have dedicated themselves to this for three years, thanks to which they are economically solvent. This enables them to keep their house in good repair, to travel to the villages and to save some money, since they have plans to open a sweet shop in a commercial area of the city center. 

This will be Retiña's second loan with the MFP institution, and she is hoping for a small loan so she can fulfill her goals. She is committed to meeting the repayments, as she was with the previous loan. Furthermore, she feels comfortable with her communal bank, since she considers its members to be responsable and united. She will invest the requested amount of 1000 nuevos soles in buying merchandise, such as fizzy drinks and clothes, as well as products for the Christmas period such as panettone bread and artificial Christmas trees, amongst other things.

loans.use: to buy clothes, fizzy drinks, panettone bread and artificial Christmas trees.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”REYNITA DE BELEN DE CCORAO;  El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Ccorao en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Teresa;  La socia tiene 56 años de edad, La socia es casada, La socia tiene 5 hijos; los cuales son independientes todos ellos; La socia trabaja comprando y vendiendo animales menores, la socia compra cuyes al por mayor, los cría y los vende entre sus clientes, la socia desea el préstamo para invertir en la compra de cuyes al por mayory menor, la socia comprara 200 cuyes para empezar de nuevo ya que desea incrementar nuevamente su negocio y ella compra y los vende por esta razón la socia desea nuevamente comprar la cantidad de cuyes mencionados para que se procreen y maduren los que comprara y los vende y así es cada 2 o 4 meses.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Introducing Teresa, a member of ”REYNITA DE BELEN DE CCORA, a Communal Bank located in the Ccorao district, Cala province and Cusco department.
Teresa is 56 years old, she is married and she has 5 children, who are all economically independent. She engages in buying and selling small animals. She buys “cuyes” (“cuy” is Quechua for Guinea pig) at wholesale prices, she breeds them and then she sells them to her customers. She is requesting a loan to invest it in the wholesale purchase of cuyes, and she will start by buying 200 cuyes. She would like to increase her business, in which she buys and sells cuyes that procreate and mature every two to four months. 
She is grateful for this loans and she commits to complying with repaying her dues in accordance with her repayment schedule.

loans.use: To invest it in the wholesale purchase of 200 cuyes.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen integrante del Banco comunal “Caminando Hacia el Futuro” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talca.
Se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente vende lencería desde hace 20 años, además incorporó a sus ventas el detergente.
Carmen ofrece sus productos por catalogo y se dedica a la venta puerta a puerta, ya que acude a los domicilios de sus clientes.
Su horario es flexible y lo distribuye generalmente durante las tardes, ya que las mañanas las destina principalmente para la realización de sus actividades domesticas. Los días que trabaja son de lunes a sábado.
Su mercadería la compra en diferentes distribuidoras en la ciudad de Santiago y cuando no puede viajar recurre a las encomiendas.
Con el crédito comprará mercadería para surtir su negocio. 
Quiere aprovechar la época de navidad, ya que es una muy buena temporada para ofrecer sus productos. 
Una de sus metas a largo plazo es instalarse con una distribuidora de lencería, comenta que necesita capital y mucha perseverancia, para concretar sus proyectos. 
Carmen vive junto a su marido y sus tres hijas de 22, 18 y 10 años de edad, su hija mayor estudia en la Universidad, Su hijas del medio acaba de rendir la prueba de selección universitaria y su hija menor estudia en la enseñanza básica. Por ende uno de sus sueños a nivel personal, es que sus hijas se realicen profesionalmente. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, para invertir en su negocio. Además está muy cómoda con el grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte, ya que son organizados, comprometidos y solidarios. Por otro lado las capacitaciones le han servido para organizar la contabilidad de su negocio.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
Carmen, a member of the “Walking Towards the Future” cooperative bank, is from the city of Talca.

She has dedicated herself to commerce, more specifically, to selling lingerie, for the past 20 years.  In addition, she incorporated detergent sales into her business.  Carmen offers her products by catalog and sells door-to-door at her customers’ homes.  Her schedule is flexible; she generally distributes her goods in the afternoons, since in the morning she takes care of her household tasks.  She works Mondays to Saturdays.

She buys her merchandise from different distributors in the city of Santiago and, when she can’t travel, she relies on deliveries.  She wants to take advantage of the holiday season, as it is a very good time to offer her products.  One of her long-term goals is to set herself up with a lingerie distributor.  She comments that she needs capital and a great deal of perseverance in order to make her projects a reality.

Carmen lives with her husband and three daughters ages 22, 18 and 10.  Her oldest daughter is studying at the university, her middle daughter just finished taking her college entrance exams, and her youngest is in school.  One of her personal dreams is to see her daughters become successful professionally.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza to invest in her business.  In addition, she is very comfortable with the group that conforms the cooperative bank where she is a member, as they are committed and supportive.  On the other hand, the trainings offered have served her well in organizing her business.  

Talca belongs to the Maule region, which is in the central part of the country.  It constitutes the administrative, economic and cultural center of the region, being the most important city in the Chilean Central Valley.  With regards to Talca, there is a curious reference in Chile, the phrase “Talca, Paris and London”.  Among the legends in this respect, some say it is a derivation of a quote from an Englishman, “Talca seems like London”, given the abundance of fog that frequently covers the city during wintertime, very similar to the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: buy merchandise to supply her business.

loans.name: Muzaffar

texts.ru: Музаффар умный и добрый юноша. Ему 25 лет. С помощью отца он открыл свой магазин и последние два года он занимается купле- продажей продуктов питания. Отец помогает по бизнесу. Вот теперь он хочет помогать отцу в ремонте дома. С этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 6000 Сомони для покупки стройматериалов. Он надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарен вам за вашу доброту.
texts.en: Muzaffar is smart and kind young man.  He is 25 years old.  He opened his own store with his father's help and has been involved in buying and selling food products for two years.  His father helps him with the business.  Now, Muzaffar wants to help his father with house repairs.  This is why he is requesting a loan in the sum of 6000 Somoni to purchase construction materials.  He relies on your help and thanks you in advance for your kindness.

loans.use: to repair his house

loans.name: Rodelrick

texts.en:
Rodelrick is married, has 2 children, and he is 31 years old and residing at San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines.

He is operating a raising crops venture, planting & harvesting rice for sale in the local community to earn a living. He has been 5 years in this business. Each month, he earns about 10,000 PHP doing this type of business.

He requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2011, Rodelrick joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. In the future, he wants to save profits as a reserve for future emergencies and to purchase another farm land.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

location.town: San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Las Margaritas Group

texts.es: Este grupo está integrado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es  Rosa mujer de 44 años de edad, casada, con un hijo de 17 años, su negocio es la elaboración de mechas de lampazo  desde hace 3 años, tiene 3 trabajadoras que le ayudan en la elaboración del producto. Es cliente de la institución desde hace 1 año y medio. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como hilos y telas. Jessica mujer de 21 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de ropa usada y  Margarita mujer de 66 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de tortillas y gaseosas.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three entrepreneurial members. One of them is Rosa, a 44 year old woman, married with a 17 year old son. 

She has a mop head making business which she started 3 years ago. She has three workers that help her with making the product. 

She has been a member of the group for a year and a half. 

She is requesting a loan to buy raw materials such as threads and fabrics. 

Jessica, a 21 year old woman sells used clothing. Margarita, a 66 year old woman, sells tortillas and sodas.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as threads and fabrics at wholesale.

loans.name: Nabonswende De Kaligri Group

texts.fr:
Mme TENE SALAMATA est la représentante du groupe NABONSWENDE DE KALIGRI. Elle se porte très bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 35 ans et le moins âgé a 04 ans. 02 vont à l’école. Elle a 04 personnes en charge.
Madame est vendeuse de céréales depuis 35 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché de son village. Ses clients sont les habitants de son quartier.
Elle  veut s’acheter 01 sac de mil et  03 sacs d’haricots.
Mme TENE SALAMATA veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour réinvestir dans son activité. Elle ambitionne être une grande productrice de boisson locale.
texts.en:
Tene Salamata is the Nabonswende De Kaligri group representative. She is doing very well. She is married and the mother of 4 children, the eldest of whom is 35 years old and the youngest, 4. Two of her children attend school. She is also responsible for 4 people.

Tene Salamata has been selling cereals for 35 years. She gets her supplies at her village market. Her customers are the inhabitants of her district. She would like to buy 1 bag of millet and 3 bags of beans. Tene Salamata would like to reinvest her profits in her business. She aims to become a large producer of the local beverage.

loans.use: to buy 1 bag of millet and 3 bags of beans.

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en: Philomina U. is a young woman of 32 years. She is married with three (3) children, a LAPO client for over 6 years; she had proved her worth of experience in her line of business. She needs the money ($500) to keep her business booming.

loans.use: To buy more of kitchen utensil & clothes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She would like to purchase a hybrid dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To Expand His Farming Business

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is a motivated young entrepreneur from Melitopol, Ukraine. With help from her parents, she started a small business about two years ago selling women’s shoes and clothing from a small space at one of the busy markets in Melitopol. She is serious and goal-oriented when it comes to business. Though she has been self-employed for a relatively short period of time, her business has done well. She currently makes around $1,400 per month. Anna has requested a loan of $1,000 that will help her increase her available inventory and continue building her business.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Siti Jumasih

texts.id:
Since Siti Jumasih living quarters is near the Gilimanuk harbor, Siti chose to be a Carry-on sales person. Siti sells light food and drinks in that harbor. With a capital of Rp1000,000 (about US$110) Siti could profit Rp40,000(about $4.50) from her work that started at 17:00 and ended at 02:00AM in the morning. From that work, Siti helps her husband who is a salesman, and help her child who is in 2nd grade. Siti also has to pay for electricity and water for about Rp60,000($5.50)/mo. Siti lives in a semi-permanent hut that was self built, the building is from woven bamboo sheets, and sand floor (no tiles). Loan from DINARI will be used to increase her capital to offer more goods, and the hope that her income might increase.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Karena lokasi tempat tinggal sangat dekat dengan pelabuhan Gilimanuk maka Siti memiih untuk menjadi seorang pedagang asongan. Siti menjual berbagai makanan kecil dan minuman yang bertempat di pelabuhan. Dengan modal Rp. 1.000.000,- siti bisa memperoleh keuntungan Rp 40.000 tetapi pekerjaan ini baru dimulai jam 17.00 wita sampai jam 02.00 Wita dini hari.Dari hasil tersebut Siti bisa membantu suaminya yang bekerja sebagai pedagang dan juga ikut menyekolahkan anaknya yang baru kelas 2 SD .Siti juga harus membayar listrik dan air PDAM sebesar Rp. 60.000,- perbulan.Siti tinggal di sebuah rumah semi permanen yang dibangun sendiri dan sangat sederhana dengan bangunan yang terbuat dari “gedeg” dan lantainya tanah. Pinjaman dari DINARI digunakan untuk menambah modal usaha dan membeli dagangan untuk dijual, dengan harapan penghasilannya akan meningkat.

loans.use:
To buy light food and drinks and other passenger's need at the harbor

Membeli makanan, minuman ringan dan kebutuhan para penumpang yang ada di pelabuhan.

loans.name: Hazariah

texts.en: Hazariah is a 35-year old married father of 2 living children. He has spent one and a half years running his small grocery stall in Rongo market Kenya. His hard work, perseverance, good reputation coupled with a well-established clientele base ensures that his business will continue to grow despite stiff competition. Hazariah requires US $600 to purchase an additional stock of of vegetables and supplement it with charcoal selling to generate more income

loans.use: Buy additional stock of grocerry and supplement with charcoal selling to generate more income

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
The image of an African woman carrying a load on her head has become a somewhat stereotypical symbol of the burdens borne by women in Africa. But it truly does represent the strength and resilience of our sisters on the hot continent, whose determination to create opportunities where there are none, and to provide for themselves and their families is inspiring.

Asia is one such hawker who roams the streets (where there are streets!) and compounds of her neighbours in the rural town of Tumbi, approximately 30km outside Dar es Salaam. She sells all kinds of things, from fruit and vegetables to soap, toothpaste and phone credit. Asia requires a loan of $525 to purchase additional stock, which she will undoubtedly manage to fit in her huge basin, and more incredibly, manage to carry on her head! She is married to husband and Raphael with whom she has two children, Fredrick, 16 and Kheri, 13.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback arrangement as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, and they are therefore termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client, extending a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for resale.

loans.name: Sukmanah

texts.en: Sukmanah is a 43-year-old woman who sells fruits at her food stall, earning US$8 a day. Her husband, S., does not work anymore, so the family depend on her earnings. She is a member of MBK and is requesting a loan of US$150 to add to her working capital and expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of business

loans.name: Natig

texts.en: Natig S. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 36 years old, married and has two children. He owns and operates a small café in Beylagan city bazaar. He has six years of experience in this business. His customers are people who work in the city bazaar. He is one of the best clients of Normicro. He applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan in the amount of $900, which he plans to use to expand his business and increase his number of customers.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Le Thi M., 57 years old, has spent hard years with her husband, trying to raise their three children.  Now, all of Mrs. M.'s children have a job.  Thus, they have the opportunities to help their parents.  As an independent, hardingworking woman, Mrs. M., however, does not want to depend on her children.  Being a TYM FUND member for four years, she has used every loan to invest on pig breeding.  Her work is in good shape, and it makes her very happy.  This time she intends to borrow 400USD to buy pigs.  Her monthly income is about 230USD.  She is now able to help her children if they are in financial needs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị Mười, 57 tuổi đã cùng chồng trải qua những năm tháng vất vả nuôi 3 con ăn học. Giờ đây các con chị đã có công ăn việc làm ổn định và có điều kiện phụ giúp cho bố mẹ nhưng với bản tính của 1 người phụ nữ  chăm chỉ, chị Mười không muốn phụ thuộc vào con cái. Tham gia vào Quỹ được 4 năm, vòng vồn nào chị cũng vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Việc chăn nuôi của chị rất thuận lợi, công việc làm chị cảm thấy vui hơn. Vòng vốn này chị 400USD mua lợn về vỗ béo. Thu nhập bình quân một tháng 230USD, chị Mười vẫn có thể hỗ trợ các con khi gặp khó khăn.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in merchandise to continue supply his store

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is 42 years old and is a married woman with 4 children, ages 20, 15, 8, and 5 years old. Mwanisha sells clothes. She started in 2005. Every day, she works from 7.30am to 5.30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

In the past, Mwanaisha has taken out and successfully repaid a loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Lat

texts.en:
Mrs. Lat H. is 30 and lives in Anlong Tnot Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a Khmer cake seller and a farmer in the local village. Her husband, Mr. Ny In, is a subsistence farmer. Mrs. Lat H. and her husband have three children, two of whom are enrolled in school while the youngest is too young to work or study.

Mrs. Lat H. faces a problem with her farming because she does not have enough animals to hep plow her rice field. Thus, Mrs. Lat H. is requesting a loan to buy another cow to plow the field.

loans.use: To buy another cow to plow the field.

loans.name: Taunese

texts.en: Taunese A., 25, is married with one child. Her husband helps out with the business doing the elei. She has 3 years of experience in the clothing and elei materials business. She sells to the village and general public 5 days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~$166 USD). SPBD loans are Taunese’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Taunese's earnings will be used to start her own elei business and help out with the family's expenses.

loans.use: Taunese would like to start her own elei business.

loans.name: Moza

texts.en:
Moza is 36 years old, widowed, and has 3 children, 13, 12 and 8 years old. She earns income selling charcoal and firewood. Every day, she works from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about US$18.

In the past, Moza has taken out a successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for another loan to buy more charcoal for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Girasol Group

texts.en:
The Girasol ("Sunflower") group bank is maD. up of 14 partners who meet in the Los Mangales neighborhood in the center of the city of Montero. Most of the group members have small businesses that they run out of their homes in order to support their families. For example, the group's president, Sra. Nelva S., is a teacher, but she also sells dry goods from her home as a second source of income.

The group members are involved in a wiD. variety of businesses. To illustrate, Reinaldo and Alexander operate motorcycle taxis; Maria Manuela is the radio operator for a taxi company; Clementina and Lizeth sell Herbalife products; MatilD., Nelva, Pabla, Fernando and Gaby all sell food (e.g., prepared meals, bread, hamburgers and dry goods); Pabla is a domestic employee; and Elia sells straw mats.

Sra. S. says that group loans are an important source of economic support for people who cannot access individual loans at other institutions because those types of loans require guarantees. Two male members of the group, who operate motorcycle taxis, agree and say that they are grateful for AgroCapital's support.

Translated and elaborated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

EL BANCO COMUNAL GIRASOL conformado por 14 socios, este grupo se reúne por la zona central D. la ciudad D. Montero en el barrio los mangales, la mayoría D. sus socios tienen pequeños negocios en sus hogares como apoyo para la familia, como el caso D. la Sra presidenta Nelva S. que tiene una venta D. abarrotes en su hogar como negocio alternativo pues ella es profesora e indica que estos créditos son un apoyo económico para los sectores que no tiene acceso fácilmente a los créditos por las garantías que exigen otras entidades, D. l misma manera los socios varones que trabajan con moto taxis indican que están agradecidos por el apoyo que les brinda AGROCAPITAL.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise/materials for businesses

loans.name: Doremi

texts.es: Doremi es propietaria de un motocarro, al mismo tiempo se dedica  a la venta de ropa, la cual distribuye por diferentes lugares, dejándola al crédito y al contado, ella tiene una pequeña de casi un año, y su esposo Christian, quien es policía, la apoya en lo que puede, y está de acuerdo con los propósitos de negocio de su cónyuge.En  el futuro desea que su hija sea profesional, es por eso que trabaja para  brindar todo lo necesario a su hija.Doremi requiere de una suma de dinero, el cual invertirá en el mantenimiento y arreglo de su motocarro y para incrementar la cantidad de prendas que vende, además de alquilar un local para la venta de estas.
texts.en:
Doremi is the owner of a motorcar and she also sells clothing which she distributes to different places, leaving it on credit and cash. She has a daughter who is almost one year old, her husband is named Christain and he is a policeman. He helps her with what he can and is in agreement with his wife’s business plans. In the future she wishes that her daughter become a professional, and this is why Doremi works to provide everything necessary for her daughter. Doremi needs a sum of money which will be invested in the maintenance and repair of her motorcar and to increase the quantity of clothing items in addition to rent a locale to sell clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair her motorcar and increase the quantity of clothing items to sell

loans.name: Yvette

texts.fr: Née le 25 Août 1965 à ABOMEY au centre du BENIN, dame Q. Yvette de nationalité béninoise et d'ethnie Fon est mariée à Monsieur CHADARE Marius, transitaire au Port Autonome de Cotonou. Elle a trois enfants à charge tous scolarisés : Charles, Noël et Célestine. Elle expose ses produits dans une baraque aménagée à la devanture de son domicile. Elle offre à ses clients de la farine de manioc, du sucre, du savon, des biscuits et du lait. Éprouvant d'énormes difficultés pour faire face aux nombreuses charges qu'elle a sous sa responsabilité et compte tenu du faible bénéfice qu'elle réalise sur ses divers articles, elle ambitionne se lancer dans la commercialisation de l'igname, du manioc et de la patate. Elle vient donc solliciter ce crédit pour saisir cette nouvelle opportunité qui s'offre à elle pendant cette période de récolte de ces différents produits.
texts.en:
Born on August 25, 1965 in Abomey in Central Benin, Mrs. Yvette Q. is a citizen of Benin, from the Fon ethnic group. She's married to Mr. Maris CHADARE, a freight agent in the Autonomous Port in Cotonou. She has three school-attending children to support : Charles, Noël and Célestine. She displays her products in a little stand in front of her house. She sells tapioca, sugar, soap, biscuits and milk. As she's experiencing huge difficulties in providing for the numerous expenses under her responsibility, and due to the small profit she makes out of the sale of these various items, she ambitions to start selling yam, cassava and potatoes. She's thus seeking this loan to seize the opportunity she's being offered since it is now the harvesting season of these products.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 sacks of yam, 2 sacks of potatoes, and one sack of cassava

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en: Matilda F. is the mother of two children who are currently in school. She is a 32-year-old trader. She trades in lace materials. Lace material is very useful in room and office decorations.  Because she lacks adequate working capital, Matilda can buy only a small amount of material, which she sells through hawking. She believes the loan will enable her to grow her business by purchasing lace materials and textiles in bulk. She hopes to use part of her profit to provide her children with quality educations. Matilda belongs to the community group called Saints Trust group. The group members guarantee a loan through repayment pledges and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase lace materials and textiles in bulk

loans.name: Serapio

texts.en:
“My goals at the moment are to maintain our stable life, support the education of my adopted son, and to maintain our good health. I learned not to depend on my children’s income and to work harder for myself and for my adopted son who serves as my motivation to dream and continue with my life,” said Serapio, a widower from Barangay Binarzang Quirino, Isabela. 

Serapio is 53 years old and a resident of a peaceful and progressive community. He was left with three responsible children: Jimmylyn– 27 years old, is a college undergraduate and now working as a domestic helper in Hong Kong; Marilou– 24 years old, is a college graduate and also a domestic helper, and Servillano– 22 years old, is a high school graduate and now working as a security guard in Manila. He also has an adopted son, a 7-year-old named Julius who is already an elementary student.  

He is engaged in a hog raising business and is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000.00 to buy additional hogs in order to double his income within three to four months since he currently has only one hog in his pigpen.  

Serapio still believes in the saying: “try and try until you succeed” and, despite his age, still brings out his best in work to succeed in his endeavors.

loans.use: Buy additional hogs

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is a member of the Nueva Vida (“New Life”) Village Bank. Dolores is 54 years old and is married with seven children. Dolores has a stand at the Nery Garcia Market where she works seven days a week selling fruit, both in bulk and by the kilo. She buys the fruit directly from farmers. Dolores needs a loan of 3500 soles to buy bananas.  Dolores dreams of having her own working capital and of continuing to work. 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow
Dolores es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Vida. 
Dolores es casada, tiene 54 años y 7 hijos, Dolores tiene un puesto en el mercado Nery García y venD. frutas al por mayor y menor, los cuales compra D. los productores, actividad que realiza todos los días. 
Dolores necesita un préstamo D. 3500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. plátano. 
Los sueños D. Dolores son tener capital propio y seguir trabajando.

loans.use: Buy bananas

loans.name: Lin

texts.en: Mrs. Lin S. is 48 years old and she now lives in Kor Kar village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. In this plantation, she can earn less income than is required to provide a better life for her family. Thus, Mrs. Lin S. decided to request a loan to add to her savings to build a house for her family. She is a widow with seven children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To add her saving to build the house for her family living.

loans.name: Kusi Ayllu Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Kusi Ayllu que significa Familia Alegre en quechua, pertenece al Proyecto Wari I, las socias son del distrito D. Vilcashuaman, se ubica a 3400 m.s.n.m. la comunidad cuenta con un aproximado D. 700 habitantes, la comunidad se dedica a la venta D. animales, abarrotes, también a la agricultura, ganadería, siendo los cultivos primordiales el maíz, papa, trigo, cebada.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como es el caso D. Graciela que es casada, tiene  6 hijos, Graciela venD. abarrotes en su casa, además venD. loceria, en el banco comunal esta aprendiendo a ahorrar, el préstamo que obtendrá será invertido en la compra tazas, platos, Graciela sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales, y esta ahorrando para comprar una casa en la ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Por otro lado Berta es casada, tiene 5 hijos, Berta se dedica a la venta D. comida en las diferentes ferias, con el préstamo que obtendrá comprara arroz, azúcar, fideo por sacos, los sueños D. Berta son mejorar su negocio y tener una restaurante.
Mientras que Celestina es casada, tiene 4 hijos, Celestina se dedica a la venta D. carnes en un kiosco del mercado vecinal, los animales los compra D. las comunidades y los beneficia ella misma. Celestina en su Banco Comunal aprendió a ahorrar, Celestina con el préstamo que obtendrá comprara animales, los sueños D. Celestina son que sus hijos sean profesionales y que su negocio sea granD..
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Kusi Ayllu, which means Happy Family in Quechua, belongs to Project Wari I, the members are from Vilcashuaman District, which is located 3400 meters above sea level. The community has approximately 700 inhabitants and the community is engaged in the sale of animals, groceries, also agriculture, livestock, the primary crops being corn, potato, wheat and barley. The members have various businesses, as is the case with Graciela, who is married and has 6 children. Graciela sells groceries at home,she also sells chinaware. In the communal bank she is learning to save, the loan that she will obtain will be invested in purchasing cups and dishes. Graciela dreams of her children becoming professionals, and she is saving to buy a house in the city of Ayacucho. On the other hand Berta is married and has 5 children, Berta sells food at various markets, with the loan she will buy rice, sugar and bags of noodles. Berta's dreams are to improve her business and have a restaurant. Meanwhile, Celestina is married and has 4 children. Celestina sells meat in a kiosk in the neighborhood market, the neighborhood convenience store market, the purchase of animal communities and benefit them. Celestina learned to save at the community bank and the loan will be used to purchase animals. Celestina dreams that her children become professionals and that her business is great.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, milk, candy, dishes, cups, wheat, corn, animals.

loans.name: Julia Del Carmen

texts.es: La Señora Julia del Carmen M. Cáceres tiene la edad de 44 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Julia tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Doña Julia es una pulpería. Hace más de diez años que tiene este negocio. Doña Julia inicio con fondos propios pero no eran los suficientes y decidió buscara ayuda con Fundación León 2000. Los propósitos que Doña Julia tiene para su negocio son de invertir cada día en nuevos productos porque sus clientes solicitan nuevos productos. El financiamiento es utilizado para capital de trabajo con esto podrá comprar granos básicos, golosinas, carnes y a la mismo tiempo en ropa para niños. Doña Julia tiene los sueños de que sus hijos reciban una educación superior para que el día de mañana sean grandes profesionales. La cantidad que Doña Julia solicita es de C$ 5.500 córdobas.
texts.en:
Julia del Carmen M. Cáceres is 44 years old and married. She has 3 children, all of whom are in school. Julia’s business is a pulpería (convenience store), and she has had this business for more than ten years. Julia started her business with her own money, but it was not enough and so she decided to seek help from Kiva partner Fundación León 2000. Her plan for her business is to invest in new products each day, since her customers are regularly asking for new products. The loan will be used as working capital so that she can purchase staple grains, candies, and meats, along with children's clothing. Julia’s dream is for her children to receive a higher education so that they will grow up to be successful professionals. The amount Julia is requesting is C$ 5.500 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Myangantsetseg

texts.en:
Myangantsetseg B. lives with her mother and younger sister in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her mother works in a small barber shop and her sister is a student at a local high school. Myangantsetseg graduated with a bachelor’s degree in law from a local university three years ago. Although she wanted to be a lawyer, she was not able to find a job after graduating.

Myangantsetseg decided to start a small business by herself. In 2006, she rented a small retail stall in a local market and started selling various pants for women and men. She frequently travels to Ereen China, a border town where many goods are purchased, and buys cheap pants for women and men. In addition to her business, she just started an evening masters program in MAU at a local university. She pays the program tuition from her profit.

Myangantsetseg requests a loan to purchase more pants from Ereen, China to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: To purchase pants from Ereen, China.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita es una mujer de 54 años, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Hugo de 43 años y sus 2 hijas; Soledad de 18 y Ana de 13. La vida de Margarita ha sido muy difícil, siempre ha trabajado mucho para llevar el dinero a su hogar, actualmente se encuentra en el negocio de la venta de golosinas, actividad que le es muy rentable gracias a la cantidad de clientes que tiene, puesto que ella es una vendedora muy alegre y trata muy bien a las personas que se acercan a comprar una golosina. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta a quienes siempre hace reír mucho, pero lo que menos le gusta es que tiene que permanecer todo el día en su puesto aguantando el sol ardiente que la acompaña. Lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y espera  tener en el futuro una tienda donde pueda atender a sus clientes con mayor tranquilidad. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo, en su banco comunal siempre está al tanto de todos los acuerdos a los que lleguen su grupo. Con los quinientos nuevos soles que solicita comprará más golosinas para incrementar su mercadería.
texts.en:
Margarita, 54, lives in her own house with her family: her husband, Hugo is 43; daughter, Soledad is 18; and daughter Ana, is 13. Margarita’s life has been very difficult. She has always worked a lot to bring money home. She sells sweets; a profitable activity for her, thanks to her numerous customers. She is a happy sales person, and she treats the people who come to buy a sweet very well. What she likes best about her work is talking with her neighboring vendors; she always makes them laugh a lot. What she likes least is staying all day at her stall and enduring the burning sun. She has been doing this for 5 years, and she hopes in the future to have a store where she can take care of her customers with more tranquility. This is her third loan with MFP. She knows that she has to make her payments on time, and she is prepared to do so. In her community bank she is always well informed about the agreements made in her group. With the loan she will buy more sweets to increase her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Malakhat

texts.en:
Malakhat G. is a 40-year-old married woman with two sons. She sells home furniture in her own furniture store. She has 15 years of experience.

She decided to open her business when it becamse clear that her husband's income wasn’t enough to satisfy their basic family needs. Malakaht borrowed money from her friends and started selling furniture. Two years ago, she was able to build her own store with the savings she had.

Now Malakhat is concerned about the higher education of her two sons and wants to do everything possible in order to save money for their university careers so that they may attain university degrees. With this goal in mind, she has applied for a $1,500 USD loan in order to increase number of items she sells in her store.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Portacia

texts.en:
Portacia B. is from the village of Duanguincan, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old, widowed, and has three adult children. Portacia owns and operates a general store where she sells food and daily-use products. Portacia has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Portacia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Portacia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. She used this previous loan to purchase additional inventory. Portacia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP that she will use as additional capital to purchase more inventory. This loan will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support the immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is married and the father of two children who are in school. He is thirty-seven years old. He lives at Suhum in the eastern region of Ghana with his family. He operates a corn mill machine where people come to grind their corn, peeled cassava, and sometimes fresh tomatoes. He happens to be the only person who is in this business in the community. Daniel has been in this business for the past year. He complains that the number of people who come to grind their products are more than what the machine can grind. This has slowed his profits drastically, therefore, he wants the loan to buy an additional corn milling machine and its parts, so that he can meet the demands of his customers before competition emerges in the community. He believes this will make him more resourceful in taking care of the home as a father. He belongs to the village bank called ‘Yehowa nemewhefo’.

loans.use: To buy a corn milling machine and parts to meets the demand of his customers.

loans.name: Kuku's Group

texts.en: This group’s leader, Kuku, has five children and one of her daughters still goes to college. Her neighbor sells bags at a market. She gave Kuku some bags and Kuku sold them. Afterwards she started her own business. Her husband works as a bus driver on the Bishkek – Tokmok route. He purchases packages and thread for her and brings them home. Kuku needs a loan to purchase chickens. She has already prepared a roost for them. She is planning to increase their number and in future sell eggs, hens and chickens. After saving enough money she wants to raise horses since it is more profitable. Her dream is to travel all around Europe and Asia with her husband. Kanymkul, Aigul and Maratbek are Kuku’s loan partners. Kanymkul is forty seven. Every day she turns in five liters of milk for five soms per litre and also sews items of traditional clothing. She needs a loan to purchase some chickens in order to sell eggs. With the money earned she wants to prepare her daughter for the new academic year. Aigul is married and has three children. She sells milk and runs her own shop next to her house. She needs a loan to buy a new fridge for selling meat and chickens. In future she plans to buy ten cows and build a big back-court. Maratbek is married and is the father of five children. He works as a shepherd in the village and looks after his farm. He needs a loan to purchase chickens and, with the money earned, he wants to buy new school clothes for his kids. He says: “Even though I am an ordinary country man, I want to give my children a good education so that they live totally different lives from mine.” ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase chickens

loans.name: Pueblo Nuevo Group

texts.es:
el grupo Pueblo Nuevo son unas personas muy unidas y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, estas son  las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:
MARTHA DE JESUS S. P. cuenta con un negocio de venta de ropa nueva, la cual distribuye de manera ambulante. Doña Martha tiene 4 años de estar al frente de este tipo de negocio ya que cuenta con muy buena clientela por la calidad de mercaderia que compra y vende.- La Sra P. es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos los que los cursan Educacion Primaria, tiene 28 años de edad, gracias a este negocio ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos actualmente ella esta solicitando el credito para surtir un poco mas su negocio.
JUANA LORENA P. confecciona ropa para dama, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace varios años, cuenta con una buena clientela por el buen trabajo que ella desempeña en la elaboracion de prendas. Doña Lorena es madre soltera, tiene 1 hija la que esta cursando el 5to año de educacion Primaria. Ella se siente muy feliz porque gracias a este tipo de actividad ella ha podido  sacar adelante su hija
MIRIAN LIDIANA M. S. su actividad principal es la venta de Pan de casa el que distribuye de manera ambulante en las diferentes pulperias de esta ciudad de Danlí, ella compra las bolsas de pan y le da un 15% de utilidad pòr bolsa, esta actividad la realiza los dias Martes y Virenes de la semana ya que es un producto de muy buena calidad y apetecido por el publico.
Doña Mirian es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos en el cual uno de ellos ya se graduo de Perito Mercantil y el otro esta cursando la secundaria, gracias a los buenos ingresos de capital que genera su actividad ha podido salir adelante.
texts.en:
The Pueblo Nuevo group is made up of three women who are very close and want to get ahead in life. The different activities they are involved in are as follows: MARTHA DE JESUS S. P. has a business selling new clothing, and distributes her products as a street vendor. Martha has had this business for 4 years and now has a good clientele that appreciates the quality of the merchandise that she buys and sells. Martha is a single mother with 2 children, both of whom are in primary school. She is 27 years old, and is grateful that her business allows her to support her children. She would like to use this loan to restock her business. JUANA LORENA P. makes women’s clothing for a living. She has been involved in this activity for several years, and has a good clientele that appreciates the excellent work she does in making garments. Juana is a single mother with one daughter, who is currently in her 5th year of primary school. Juana is very happy that her work allows her to support her daughter. MIRIAN LIDIANA M. S.’s main economic activity is selling bread, which she distributes to various local stores in the city of Danlí. She purchases bags of bread and is able to get a 15% return for each bag she sells. She is involved in this activity on Tuesdays and Fridays of every week. The bread she sells is very good quality and is exactly what her customers want. Mirian is a single mother who has 2 sons. One of her sons has already graduated from school and is now a qualified accountant, while her other son is currently in secondary school. Mirian is grateful for the income that her business generates, which has made it possible for her to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing sewing accessories, silk, men’s jeans, brassieres, blouses, and children’s shirts; and purchasing bread

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en: K. Zuhro lives in Kostakoz town in the Sugd region. Her husband works far away from home. Together they have two children of school age and Zuhro has to spend a lot of money on their education considering that her husband doesn’t earn enough money. Zuhro is responsible for caring for two cows. Now she wants to borrow $1000 USD to buy more young cattle to raise. She hopes in that way to earn more and to be able co cover all the expenses of her dearest children. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition.
