Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase calves to expand her business

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es: Eusebia tiene 47 años, es soltera  y vive en la casa de sus padres, quienes son su mayor tesoro y a quienes desea apoyar con los diversos gastos que tienen en la famita. Dedicarse a la entrega de periódicos es una de las tareas más difíciles en la ciudad, ya que las personas desde muy tempranas horas salen a las calles con tal de mantenerse informadas de los últimos acontecimientos y ella en lo posible distribuye los periódicos a sus clientes de manera oportuna. Para lograr su record de ventas de estos diarios se levanta de madrugada para dirigirse a las agencias periodísticas donde solicita cantidades de ejemplares para luego distribuirlas en las tiendas y puestos en los mercados. Su rutina es distribuir por las mañanas y en las tardes realiza las cobranzas, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace veinte años, tiempo que logró ganar experiencia y tener un gran número de clientes, quienes están acostumbrados con la visita de Eusebia. Su meta próxima es la instalación de un puesto en el mercado de su localidad para ofrecer productos comestibles como un negocio adicional al que ya está acostumbrada. Ella necesita ayuda para tener mayores ingresos con el fin de darles seguridad a sus ancianos padres. Este sería su séptimo préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y demostró ser una persona bien cumplida con sus cuotas. A Eusebia le gusta el entusiasmo que tiene su equipo de trabajo, ya que es una de las características que le agrada de banco comunal, el cual está conformado por dieciséis socias. Los 2200 soles que solicita los invertirá en la compra de más periódicos con el fin de aumentar clientela dentro de su localidad.
texts.en:
Eusebia, 47, is single and lives in her parents’ house. They are her greatest treasure, and she wishes to help them with the various family expenses. She delivers newspapers, which is one of the most difficult jobs in the city. People are on the streets very early wanting to stay informed of the latest events. She distributes the papers to her customers at the optimal time whenever possible. To achieve her sales record of these papers, she gets up at dawn to go the newspaper agencies to get papers to distribute to stores and stalls in the markets. Her routine is to distribute in the mornings and collect in the afternoons. She has been doing this for 20 years. In that time she has gained experience, and she has a great number of customers who are used to visits from Eusebia. Her next goal is to set up a stall in the regional market to sell food products as an additional business, which she is used to. She needs help to have greater income in order to give her elderly parents security. This is her seventh loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She has shown herself to be a person who does well in making her payments. Eusebia likes the enthusiasm her work team has. It is one of the characteristics of the community bank, which has 16 members, that pleases her. The 2,200 PEN that she is asking for is to buy more newspapers in order to increase customers in her region.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Caracol Group

texts.es: El grupo “Caracol” esta representado por la señora Gladis y conformado por 14 miembros los cuales can cursando su primer ciclo, en general los socios del grupo se dedican a actividades comerciales entre las que se pueden mencionar a la venta D. pan, gelatina, ropa, comida, empanadas y a actividades como la costura, albañilería, enfermería y al servicio D. transporte público. La competencia dentro D. sus rubros es alta, pese a eso saben sacar adelante la actividad económica a la que se dedican. El crédito esta destinado al crecimiento D. sus negocios con la compra D. mercaderías, insumos y herramientas para mejorar más sus ingresos que les permitirá darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias van cursando su primer ciclo dentro D. la institución pero están contentos D. que se les brinD. un apoyo económico que ayudada a generar mejores ingresos y a mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia
texts.en:
The “Caracol” group is represented by Gladis and consists of fourteen members, who are in their first loan cycle. Most of the members have businesses, including, to name a few, sales of bread, gelatin, clothing, food, and empanadas; and activities, including sewing, bricklaying, nursing, and public transportation. Even though competition in their fields is high, they know how to move their businesses ahead. They’ll use the loan to grow their businesses by purchasing merchandise, supplies, and tools, so they can increase their incomes and proviD. their families a better standard of living. With respect to their experience with loans, the members are in their first loan cycle with the organization, but they are satisfied that it will proviD. economic support to help them generate more income and improve their families’ quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Abike

texts.en: Abike is 51 years old and she is married with 2 children. She sells prayer items like bibles,candles,incence,olive oil,etc. She has been in this business for long. She hopes for the loan amount of N160,000 to purchase more prayer items to sell. she says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more prayer items

loans.name: Lusviminda

texts.en:
Lusviminda D. is from the village of Santiago, Iligan City. She is 53 years old. Lusviminda is married and has three school-aged children.

To make a living, Lusviminda operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for this business is from selling scrap metal and other used products in the local community. Lusviminda has been engaged in her business for over eight years and she earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Lusviminda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lusviminda is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn B. has been managing a village store for almost a year now. She buys her goods from Cauayan City once a week, to lessen the transportation expenses. Her business is a good source of income for her family as it is where they get their daily allowances. She hopes that her business will become more competent with the help of the loan she is requesting. She hopes that KIVA lenders will grant her PHP 5,000 to use as additional revolving capital for her business. She plans to buy additional commodities such as biscuits, canned goods and other products that her customers may need. 

Evelyn is the kind of a businesswoman who is very optimistic. She always takes everything positively, especially when it comes to her store. She anticipates that her retail store will expand with the help of KIVA lenders, that’s why she really prays that her loan request will be granted. Evelyn is already married. She and her husband have already been blessed with a child who is presently studying. She wishes to give her child everything that she needs, thus she works diligently on developing her business.

loans.use: additional revolving capital for her general store.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan S. is a 26-year-old farmer and mother. She is blessed with a lovely son. Her husband, Mai Sophal, is 28 and works in the farming business. Chan S. inherited from her grandmother the farmland where she and her husband grow different kinds of crops.

This family’s living conditions are not so good because a ladder of their existing house is too old and has broken. Because of this problem, Chan S. is looking for a loan in order to repair an old ladder of her house.

loans.use: Tto repair an old ladder of her house

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie M. lives in Silanga Tangub City. She is 48 years old, married and has four school-aged children. She makes a living by raising fish for sale. She has been in this business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2007, Virgie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid five previous loans from GDMPC, and has applied for a new loan to repair a vehicle she uses in her work. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle used in her business

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en: Narantuya is a 41-year-old widow who lives with her mother and her three children in a house in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. All of her children attend a local secondary school while Narantuya operates a grocery retail business. She began her business in 2003 after working for several years as a nurse. Her nursing salary was too low to support her family so she began her own business and she currently has a working capital of 2,000,000 tugrugs (~1400 USD), with monthly earnings between 300,000 and 450,000 tugrugs (~210-316 USD). In addition to her grocery business, she also sells coal and firewood in order to increase her earnings. Narantuya says, “All I want is to be able to afford my children’s education.” She is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase a large amount of groceries for her shop.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for resale

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa is thirty-six years old. She is a married mother of six children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercially dominated community. Adwoa works hard to help her husband to provide for the family. She is a trader. She trades in second hand clothes. Adwoa sells by hawking in her community. She also treks to nearby towns to sell, especially on their market days. She purchases bales of textiles from nearby towns. Adwoa has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy second hand clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “AHORRO ES PROGRESO - SAYLLA”, Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Saylla, ubicado a 30 minutos en bus local de la ciudad del Cusco. Saylla es lugar de los restaurantes más famosos al aire libre, aquí se pude venir cualquier día de la semana a disfrutar del paisaje mientras se saborea de un deliciosos plato típico de Perú y en especial de a ciudad del Cusco, el chicharrón, (elaborado a base de carne de cerdo son trozos de 3 a 4 acompañadas con papas doradas y choclo dulce o salado con una ensalada de cebolla y hierba buena tipo menta).

Nuestra socia es la Sra. MERCEDES, tiene 25 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos de 13, 11, 7 meses de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista,  La socia tiene un restaurante chicharronería y vende el tradicional chicharrón entre otros y bebidas frías y calientes, la socia también cría animales menores como son los cuyes y aves de corral como las gallinas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes y gallinas para el negocio y para la venta.

 La socia agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member, Mercedes, 25, belongs to the “AHORRO ES PROGRESO - SAYLLA” communal bank. She lives in Saylla, which is a 30 minute bus ride from Cusco. Saylla is famous for its outdoor restaurants; one can come here any day of the week to enjoy the scenery while eating delicious, traditional, Peruvian dishes, especially from Cusco, like chicharrón (made from 3 or 4 chunks of pork, served with fried potatoes, sweet or savory corn, onion and spearmint salad). Mercedes lives with her life partner and has three children, who are 13, 11, and 7 months of age. She is both a housewife and a retail merchant. She has an eatery where she serves the traditional chicharrón, among other dishes, as well as cold and hot beverages. She also raises small farm animals, like guinea pigs, and baryard fowl, like chickens. She needs funding to buy guinea pigs and chickens to raise and sell. She is grateful for and appreciative of the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Marta Yolanda

texts.es: Marta Yolanda M. D. Q. D. 67 años D. edad, resiD. en Ciudad Arce, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad, lugar en el cual habita junto a su esposo, un hijo y dos nietos, estos últimos se encuentran al cuidado D. ella, debido a que sus padres residen en el extranjero. Marta se dedica a la venta D. medicinas populares y a la elaboración y comercialización D. manteles, productos los cuales ofrece D. manera ambulante por todas las colonias y cantones D. Ciudad Arce. A pesar D. su avanzada edad, Marta trabaja muy duro caminando grandes kilómetros, con el fin D. poder vender todo su producto y D. esta manera obtener mejores ganancias cada día. A pesar que es un trabajo muy pesado y bastante riesgoso, ella sabe sacar lo positivo D. la situación, incluso cuenta con clientes los cuales la esperan para comprarle medicinas y manteles, debido a que Marta ofrece muy buenos precios. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar tela para la elaboración D. los manteles, así mismo comprar mayor cantidad D. medicinas. Marta es una persona muy humilD., quien es conocida en su lugar D. vivienda por ser muy responsable y buena vecina, así mismo por tener el deseo D. esforzarse por su familia, D. modo que pueda brindarles todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Marta Yolanda M. D. Q. is 67 years old and lives in Arce city, located in La Libertad department. She lives there together with her husband, one son and 2 grandchildren, who are in her care owing to the fact that their parents live overseas. Marta works selling popular medicines and making and selling table cloths, products which she sells door to door in all the districts in Arce. Regardless of her advanced age, Marta works very hard and walks many many kilometres, with the goal of being able to sell all her products and in this way obtain better earnings every day. Apart from the fact that it is very hard work and quite risky, Marta looks on the situation positively, including having clients who wait for her to buy their medicines and table clothes, owing to the fact that she offers very good prices. She is seeking a loan with which she can buy thread to make the table cloths and purchase a larger quantity of medicines. Marta is a very humble person who is known in the area where she lives as being very responsible and a good neighbour. She herself wishes to work hard for her family, to give them everything that is necessary.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase threads and medicines

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Norly

texts.en:
Norly N., 53, makes sure that her family has enough food. She has managed her own variety store for some time and has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment history with previous loans, she was able to borrow several times in CCT’s Cooperative  She uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her variety store.     

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 8,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital allowing her to  replenish her variety store’s inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education. She wants to see them settled down and have their own families. She also wants to have her own house and to migrate someday to live out her years in another land.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying groceries necessary to replenish selling items in her variety store’s inventory.

loans.name: Sreytouch

texts.en: Mrs. Sreytouch S. is 33 years old and she lives in Phnum Lonteah village, in Takeo province. She owns a general store in the local village. Her husband, Mr. Chhoun Koa, is farmer who owns 1.5-hectare of land to cultivate rice for supporting his family’s living. However hard they try to work, they can earn little income. Thus, Mrs. Sreytouch S. decided to seek a loan to buy a cow for breeding. With rest of the loan she would like to buy more groceries to re-sell. She is a mother of a child who is enrolled in the local public school. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es:
Angélica María M. Ríos, quien  Labora como Aseador en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua. Unan, ella tiene seis hijos a su cargo,  y  dos se encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado nueve crédito con CEPRODEL durante nueve  años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por  CEPRDEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de materiales de  construcción como: zinc, perlines y pintura para una parte del techo de su casa ya que el que tiene se encuentra en mal estado. 
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Angélica María M. Ríos works as a cleaning lady for the National Autonomous University of Nicaragua. With her husband, she has 6 children in her care, 2 of whom are school-aged. She is married, and has taken 9 loans with CEPRODEL over 9 years. Over this period of time she has invested the loans in improving the home where she lives, thanks to the financings granted by CEPRODEL. The loan requested will be used to buy construction materials such as: corrugated metal sheets for roofing, support beams and paint, to repair a part of the roof of her home that is in bad condition. She does all of this with the objective of having better security and providing better living conditions for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to improve and expand her home

loans.name: Ndèye Tening

texts.en:
Ndèye Tening F. is 41 years old, married and the mother of nine children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NIANING SANTHIE for two years and has always paid back her loans on time.

Ndèye Tening F. sells fabrics, jewelry and objects of art. She will use this loan to increase the stock of products in her shop.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and jewelry for sale

loans.name: Nelida's Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento VICTORIA esta compuesta por ocho integrantes, siete mujeres y un varon son personas responsables que se conocen y se garantizan entre ellos, tiene su mesa directiva que esta compuesta por:

La Sra. Nelida  tiene como actividad una tienda D. barrio que esta muy bien administrada ya que cuenta con muchos productos ella vive en la zona D. Chuquiaguillo frente a un colegio D. la zona, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar, ella tambien se dedica al tejido D. mantas y bordado D. manteles, es muy trabajadora y responsable por su buena direccion fue elejida como presidenta del Banco D. Emprendimiento, con el dinero del credito comprara mercaderia como dulces, galletas , refrescos, etc. para surtir su tienda. 

La señora Monica  es la secretaria D. Actas del banco su  actividad es su principal fuente D. ingreso para ella y su familia es la costura D. polleras y bordado D. mantas, le va muy bien en esta actividad en especial para las fiestas D. la zona donD. tiene muchos pedidos D. sus productos con el dinero del credito comprara telas por cantidad para la costura D. polleras, esta casada y tiene un hijito pequeño su esposo se dedica al transporte D. carga D. arena.

El Sr. Sebastian es casado con la Sra. Ana  tienen un hijo pequeño, es el tesorero del banco, el es condutor D. minibus y tambien se dedica al comercio D. frasadas que trae D. iquique, y su esposa es la que se encarga D. vender estos productos. Con el dinero del credito comprara mercaderia por mayor.

Estas tres personas son representantes del banco D. emprendimiento VICTORIA  es su primer ciclo con nuestra entidad y estan dispuestos a ser garantia solidaria. Estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Victoria Entrepreneurial Village Bank is maD. up of 8 members, 7 women and 1 man, who are very responsible people who know each other very well and guarantee each other's loans. They have a board of directors maD. up of: Nelida who runs a small neighborhood store which she manages very well and sells a large variety of products. She lives in the Chuquiaguillo area across from the local school. She has 2 school-aged children. She also works weaving blankets and stitching tablecloths; she works very hard and is very responsible. Due to her trustworthy nature, she was elected group president. She will use the money to buy inventory like candy, cookies, drinks, etc to stock her store. Monica is the group secretary who primarily works sewing skirts and blankets to support her family. Her work has gone very well, especially during local holidays when she has many orders for her goods. She will use the money to buy fabric in larger quantities to sew her skirts. She is married with one small son; her husband works in the sand freight transportation. Sebastian is married to Ana with whom he has one small son. He is the group treasurer and works as a minibus driver. He also sells blankets that he gets from Iquique; he brings them and his wife sells them. He will use the money to buy his inventory wholesale. These three are group representatives and the group is in its first cycle; they are willing to jointly guarantee each other's loans. They are very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the support they are receiving through these loans.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy inventory

loans.name: Raul Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Raul y su esposa la Sra. Sofia llevan muchos años de casados, ellos vieven en zona del 5to  anillo, "la Colorada", de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, cuentan con casa propia en la cual vive con dos de sus hijos que aun son jovenes por que los demas ya tienen su familia aparte, esta pareja llego a nuestra oficina por referencia de un vecino de que realiza los servicios de colocacion de equipos de gas para vehiculos. 

Don Raul tiene un vehiculo propio del cual tiene un chofer que lo trabaja haciendo servicios de transporte urbano el cual le da renta diaria a su propietario. Doña Sofia tiene una tiendita de barrio en la cual vende lo basico de la canasta familiar, como ser alimentos, detergentes, golosinas; y tambien cuenta con una cabina de llamadas telefonicas de la cual tambien perciben otro ingreso, el prestamo en solcitado sera destinado para la compra de un  equipo de gas para su vehiculo, "estamos muy agradecidos con su institucion ya que depositaron su confianza en nosotros" dijeron.
texts.en:
Raul and his wife Sofia have been married for many years, they live in “La Colorada”, in the 5th and 6th ring area of Santa Cruz, and they own the house they live in. Their two youngest children live with them, while the older ones have they own families. This couple was introduced to our institution by a neighbor, a mechanic installing liquified petroleum gas systems for vehicles. Raul earns some money by renting his own car to a third party that works as a taxi driver. Sofia runs a little shop in the neighborhood, where she sells the basic family goods, such as food, detergents and sweets, and there is also a phone booth she earns some extra money from. The loan they are asking for will be used to buy a LPG system for their car; they said they were very grateful to our institution because we are putting our faith in them.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a liquified petroleum gas system for his car

loans.name: Pureza

texts.en:
Pureza M. is from the town of Purok 11, Poblacion, Valencia City. She is 51 years-old and married with four adult children. To make a living, Pureza owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Pureza has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Pureza joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pureza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to  purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital. Pureza is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Pureza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Tasleem Zahra's Group

texts.en:
Tasleem Zahra lives with her husband in Multan. Her husband operates a bicycle shop. Tasleem does embroidery work to help her husband to meet family expenses. She is also a very good housewife who takes care of her home very well. 

Her husband wants to expand his business and wants to buy bicycle spare parts and new bicycles as well. Tasleem has applied for a loan for her husband who with the help of loan assistance will be able to offer the latest and branded bicycle parts and bicycles to his clients. 

Tasleem hopes that this investment will make her husband’s business to grow and also increase their household income.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts & bicycles

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 29-year-old married man from Lebanon. He and his wife have one child. He has owned a barber shop since 2004 and has 14 years of experience as a barber. He coordinates his efforts with those of his wife, who works as a beautician. They pool their resources to cover their family expenses. 

He has recently bought a laser machine, which he is paying off in installments. He is known in his local region for his good reputation  and has many clients. He has also received many new customers since the acquisition of the new laser machine.

He is presently asking to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. in order to perform renovations on his barber shop. In addition, he would like to complete paying off the cost of the laser machine.

loans.use: To perform renovations on his barber shop and to pay off the cost of his new laser machine

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mabel U. is 40 and married with five children, who range in age from 3 to 20. She plants and harvests bananas for sale. Mabel has three years of experience in this business. Mabel needs a loan of 1,000 Samoan tala to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or about $125 per week) to improve/expand the business. In 2009, Mabel joined SPBD. This is her second loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Mabel's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD. http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Talentos En Acción Group

texts.es: Siendo mujeres muy esforzadas y trabajadoras con sueños muy grandes en la vida no dejan de pensar cada dia en la superación de sus negocios. Evelyn M. quien es la presidente del grupo tiene un negocio de plasticos y fantasia y su meta es el crecimientode mercadería, también doña María desea surtir mas servilletas tipicas en diversidad de colores, y por supueto poder atender a sus clientes en guipiles en direfetes tamaños, colores, y maria rosaura continuar atendiendo a sus clientes con productos de catalagolo en variedad.
texts.en:
Being hard-working and industrious women with very big dreams in life, they never stop thinking about improving their businesses, Evelyn M., who is the president of the group, has a business of plastic and fantasy and it is her goal to increase merchandise. Doña Maria wishes to supply more typical napkins in a diversity of colors and, of course, be able to serve her customers with "guipiles" in different sizes, colors, and Maria Rosaura wishes to continue to serve her customers with a variety of products from catalog.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in business.

loans.name: Kafunjo United Women's, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
Hard-working B. Ruth, married with seven children of her own to take care of, knows that she has her responsibility cut out for her. This reality has looked her in the face for the past 6 years as she goes about her trivial retail shop business selling general merchandise, especially for home use, that she does alongside her banana sales from Ibanda town. 

With her monthly earnings amounting to 160,000 Ugandan shillings, she has faced long odds in providing for all her family’s needs and principally catering for her children’s welfare as her husband seems not to be so productive. 

Ruth wants to improve on the status quo of her family with the acquisition of this loan as she wants to give this business an improved lease on life in terms of expansion. Restocking her shop with a vision of making it a wholesale business will make her earn more sales revenue and be able to pay up the education bills for her orphaned grandchildren.

loans.use: restocking with more sugar, wheat flour and maize flour

loans.name: Track Investors Group

texts.en:
Ibrahim C. is the leader of this group of youths who call their group "Track Investors”. Unlike their peers in the township of Magburaka, these guys choose to engage themselves in productive businesses in order to make a living. 

Their leader, Ibrahim C. is 28 years old. Born in Magburaka town, he is a husband and the father of one child. Ibrahim has been a businessman for five years now. He sells mobile phones, top-up cards for all four mobile networks in the country, and ice cream. With his share of this loan, Ibrahim will buy mobile phone accessories and top-up cards to add to his business.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone accessories and top-up cards

loans.name: Jyparkul's Group

texts.en: Jyparkul O. is the leader of the group. She is 32 and not married. Together with her brother, she breeds and fattens cattle for their further resale. She started this kind of business three years ago, having been in blank despair of that fact that she couldn’t find a job. But during the years of working diligently, she has managed to pay partially for her brother’s studies in university. Jyparkul needs a loan in order to obtain a refrigerator. In the future, she wants to achieve more successful results. Aijan T. is the treasurer of the group. She is 24 and married. Her spouse is a medical worker; he earns money by working as a bone-setter at a salary of 8,000 soms. The couple has a daughter; she is a toddler. Today, Aijan keeps house and brings up the baby. The family by now has managed to obtain furniture. They need a loan in order to buy building materials for a household room. Aijan, with her husband, dreams of opening a big workshop. Turatbek K., 53, is married. His wife has a profession of a garage security guard at a salary of 1500 soms per month. The couple is raising a son, who is a schoolboy. Turatbek supports his family and enriches its funds by fishing and cattle breeding. Two years ago, after having obtained two sheep, he started this kind of business. By now, he has managed to buy a laundry machine. The loan's purpose is to buy two sheep for stock increasing. In the future, he wants to be able to afford a refrigerator. Mahabat O., 32, is married. Her husband works as a refueling operator; by doing this, he makes some money (5000 soms). The couple has two children. Their family gets their main income from cattle breeding. This started two years ago after they purchased three calves. So by now, out of the profits, they have managed to do house repairs. The loan's purpose is to install new gates. The family is planning to pay off the loan from earnings out of the resale of cattle. In the nearer future, Mahabat wants to equip the house and buy furniture. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Adamia

texts.en:
Adamia C. is a married woman who lives in Campo, Brgy. Inauawan, Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by selling food, running  a general store and raising pigs. Her husband Danilo, who is 48 years old, works as a delivery truck driver and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have seven children between seven and 23. 

Adamia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Adamia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, thus raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 7th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 to use for the maintenance of her general store and as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for the education of her children and their daily needs. Adamia C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Fund Operations

loans.name: Mun

texts.en: Mun N., 39, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kandal Province, Cambodia, an area known for fertile farmland for growing vegetables. N. decorates fabrics at home, earning an income of about USD 2.50 per day. Her husband is a fisherman, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. The family has to spend USD 35 on food, USD 10 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 15 on other necessary expenses every month.  N. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase more supplements to decorate fabrics. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more supplements to decorate fabrics to sell

loans.name: Alibek

texts.en:
Alibek S. is a 27-year-old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Bayan-Ulgiy province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife stopped working due to bad health and stays at home watching their two young daughters. 

Alibek currently operates a taxi service in his town. He started driving a taxi in 2006 and has since gained much experience as a driver. His daily revenue from taxi service is between 8,000 and 12,000 MNT and 50 percent of this is considered net profit. He has used all his earnings to stabilize his family's financial situation and improve their quality of life. His business is the only source of his family's income and it is still insufficient for household consumption.

 For the future, he hopes to continue his business' stable operation and save money in order to buy a new car. Alibek is a modest and hardworking man and is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase auto parts for his car as well as to buy 2 tons of coal and meat for the winter.

loans.use: To purchase auto parts for his car

loans.name: Alexinah

texts.en:
Alexinah has been in her farming business for 8 years producing and selling mainly tea, maize, beans and milk.  She requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo to be able to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  She plans to use the proceeds to improve the living standards of her 4 children and pay their school fees.  All of her children are still in school.

Her greatest challenge remains unpredictable weather conditions, especially heavy rains which destroy beans.

Alexina's additional income is generated from her three pump stations where she makes a good income. She plans to purchase a truck to transport her produce to more profitable markets.  She is also focused on repayment of the loan to enable her to acquire more and improve her farming significantly.

loans.use: Purchasing and insuring a dairy cow

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
Noralyn T. is from the village of Dalirig, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 36 years old. Noralyn is married and has 3 infant children. To make a living, Noralyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. Noralyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Noralyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Noralyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Noralyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to buy and sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing and school fees.

She operates a clothes-selling business in a shop, selling to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she operates a beauty salon which contributes to her other source of income. Jane faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation and competition in her business. She hopes to open a cosmetics shop in the future.

With the 80,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase a bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of clothes for resale

loans.name: Togtoh

texts.en:
Togtoh S., age 57, lives with his wife and three children in his own apartment in the Selenge province. His oldest daughter helps him with the business while his middle daughter is currently unemployed and his youngest son attends university in Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. His wife is a trader between two border cities of Russian and Mongolia. 

Togtoh operates a grocery business in his town with help of his oldest daughter. Depending on sales, Togtoh procures food two times a month and in each procurement, he purchases grocery products worth between 3,000,000 and 4,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT). 

He has been engaged in this business since 1995 and has built a stable operation. After many years of owning this business, he has not only gained a lot of experience as a businessman but also established a large customer base. His business earnings have enabled him to buy two cars, a garage and an apartment for his family and business. 

For the future, he plans to expand his business by selling clothing items based on his wife's business. His working capital has decreased due to the devaluation of Russian currency, the ruble. He also wants to purchase a car and therefore he is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan in order to increase his working capital for his grocery trading business.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie P. is from the village of Antipolo, Dipolog City. She is 45 years old. Elsie is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Elsie  sells ground pork and beef products known as "longganisa." Elsie has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP average a month.

In 2006, Elsie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Elsie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to expand her sales of ground pork and beef products. 

Elsie is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Elsie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: 
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for food production

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es:
Sandra D. 32, resiD. en Moncagua departamento D. San Miguel, vive con su hija D. 4 años D. edad, se dedica a vender lociones y cosméticos, el negocio fue fundado por iniciativa propia desD. hace 10 años, trabaja todos los días D. 7:00am a 4:00pm, por el momento necesita solicitar un préstamo para comprar cosméticos y lociones para la venta.
Esta inversión la hará con el propósito D. ampliar la variedad en productos para ofrecer a los clientes y tener la oportunidad D. aumentar sus ventas adquiriendo mejores ingresos para el sustento del hogar.
Su aspiración  es mantenerse activa en el negocio, proveer para su hogar todo lo necesario y ayudar a su hija para que crezca sanamente y se forme académicamente.
texts.en:
Sandra, 32, lives with her 4 year-old daughter in Moncagua in the department of San Miguel.  She has a business selling lotions and cosmetics.  She founded this business by her own initiative 10 years ago.  She works every day from 7am to 4pm.  At this time she needs to request a loan to buy cosmetics and lotions to sell.

She will make this investment with the goal of expanding the range of products that she has to offer her customers, so that she can increase her sales, thereby earning a higher income to support her household.

Her goal is to remain active in the business, providing everything needed for her home and helping her daughter so that she can grow up healthy and have a good education.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and lotions to sell

loans.name: Naima

texts.en:
Naima is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a natural juice making business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbours. Naima faces the major challenge of seasonalitywith her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Ksh 10,000 loan, she wants to purchase mangoes and bananas for making juice to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase mangoes and bananas for making juice to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane M. O. is 66 years old, widowed and has six grown up children. Her business is located in busy Kakamega town. Kakamega is the region of Kenya known for production of sugar canes and is usually known as the sugar belt region. She sells cereals to local people. She has been in this business for the last four years now. She says that her business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraint. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy maize, beans and green grams [lentils] to grow the business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to expand her business and in future to be able to supply wholesale. She describes herself as polite, patient and ambitious.

loans.use: To buy maize, beans and green grams [lentils]

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pineapples and to pay labor

loans.name: Rokhaya

texts.fr:
Madame ROKHAYA T. est une femme de 53 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants. Elle fait partie des promotrice du Banc Villageois (WANGO) Elle fait partie des membres du Comité de Gestion où elle occupe le poste d'assistante depuis 1996.

Elle fait du petit commerce. Elle vend des produits divers tels du riz, de l'huile, du mil, de l'arachide, du poisson séché, du poisson fumé etc.. Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans le domaine d'activité pour l'avoir exercé depuis plus d'une quinzaine d'année.

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de se procurer de la marchandise cité ci-dessus

Avec les bénéfices réalisés à partir de son petit commerce elle va soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. ROKHAYA T. is 53 years old, married, and the mother of ten children. She's a promoter of the WANGO Banc Villageois. She's a member of the managing committee, where she's been an assistant since 1996.

She's a retailer, who sells various products such as rice, oil, millet, peanuts, dried fish, smoked fish, etc. She has a good experience in this sector, due to the fact that she's been running this business for more than fifteen years.

Her new loan will enable her to buy the products listed above. With the profits of her business, she will support her husband in providing for the children.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, millet, peanuts, dried fish, smoked fish, etc

loans.name: Koba

texts.en:
Koba T. is 27 years old. He comes from the village of Kumistavi, Tskaltubo District. He lives with his family – his parents, grandfather and brother. Koba’s parents and grandfather are retired. 

The primary source of income for Koba’s family comes from agricultural activities. In particular, the family has two cows, whose milk is used for cheese production. The cheese is sold on the local market. They also own seven beehives and get 100 liters of honey annually. Also the family has a vineyard and is engaged in wine production. The wine is sold in the village, among the villagers. 

With the requested loan, Koba plans to start up a small bakery, where different types of bakery products will be made and sold in the village. Koba has worked in a bakery as a hired employee and he has sufficient experience in this business. According to his estimations, his bakery will be profitable and he will be able to support his family better. Part of the increased income will be spent on family well-being and another part will be used for expansion of the bee-keeping business; additional beehives and bee-colonies will be purchased.

loans.use: to purchase materials for start-up of a small bakery.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz es una mujer muy trabajadora cuenta con 32 años de edad, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa desde hace 10 años, primero empezó rentando un local a su cuñada pero después se le hacia muy cara la renta y tubo que dejar de rentar y mejor opto por poner el negocio en su casa. Dice que ella solicito un préstamo a la financiera para surtir su tienda y comprara cloro, chiles enlatados, sopas, aceite, jabón, huevo, frijoles, refrescos, dulces, leche etc. doña Bety como es conocida por sus conocidos surte sus productos en diferentes tiendas de la población de Zitacuaro donde le den buenos precios para así después ella ganarle algo a la hora de venderlos. Doña Beatriz esta casada con el señor Juan Carlos el cual es guarachero y tiene dos niños de nombres Cecilia la cual estudia la primaria y Carlos de 2 años de edad. Doña Bety esta agradecida por el préstamo por que así va a tener mas surtido su negocio, la meta que tiene es comprar mas anaqueles para acomodar sus productos y mas adelante comprar un refrigerador para meter carnes frías.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a very hardworking 32-year-old woman. She has had a grocery store in her house for 10 years. She first began renting a store from her sister-in-law, but the rent became very expensive and she had to step renting and opted instead to put the business in her home. She says that she asked for a loan to supply her store and buy bleach, canned chili peppers, soups, oil, soap, eggs, beans, sodas, candies, milk, etc. Bety, as she is known by her friends, goes to different stores in Zitacuaro to source her products where they give her good prices so that she can make a profit when she sells them. 

Beatriz is married to Juan Carolos, who is a Guaracha musician, and has two children - Cecilia, who is in primary school, and Carlos, who is 2. Bety is thankful for the loan because this way she will be able to have more stock in her store. Her goal is to buy more shelves to accommodate her products and later to buy a refrigerator to stock cold meats.

loans.use: to buy items to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, vive con dos hijos: Wilber de 15 años y Yulisa de 13 años de edad, doña María se dedica a la venta de verduras, su horario es de 6:00am hasta las 2:00pm, los días de comercio domingo y miércoles, los demás días de la semana vende riguas y tamales de elote, tiene 29 años de estar en este negocio y lo aprendió de su familia.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para comprar verduras,  y de esta manera surtirlo de productos frescos  como papas, repollo, pipianes, güisquiles, y más que son demandados por los clientes.
Ella quiere trabajar arduamente con el apoyo del préstamo, pagar puntualmente y con esta ayuda ir mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María lives in Corinto, in the department of Morazán. She lives with her two children, Wilber, who is 15 years old, and Yulisa, 13 years old. María sells vegetables. Her schedule is from 6:00am to 2:00pm on market days, Sunday and Wednesday. The other days of the week, she sells corn pancakes and fresh corn tamales. She has been in this business for 29 years and learned it from her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy vegetables so that she can stock her business with fresh products such as potatoes, cabbage, squashes, chayote squashes, and other items that are in demand from customers.

She wants to work hard with the help of the loan, repay punctually, and improve conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as potatoes, cabbage, squashes, and chayote squashes.

loans.name: Op

texts.en: Op is 27 years old.  She is married but does not yet have any children.  She lives in Kompong Cham Province and currently generates her income by raising piglets in a wooden pen. Her husband is the primary income earner supporting her family.  He works in a garment factory as a garment worker. Op is applying for a loan to purchase additional feed for her pigs and more piglets for breeding, and to repair her old pen.

loans.use: buy pig feed and piglets and repair pig pen

loans.name: Tam-Tamneh Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Tam-Tamneh” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Sento, 39 years old. She was born in the village of Kamabia, near Makeni. Currently, she resides in Makeni, together with her husband and 5 children. Her husband is a teacher and 2 of her children attend secondary school. Sento has been a businesswoman for many years, selling palm oil, rice and other cooking ingredients. With her share of this loan, she is going to expand her business by buying the above mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, rice and other cooking ingredients wholesale.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is 31 years old and lives in Villa M. Tejero, Liloy. She is married with two children. She has a motorcycle repair business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase equipment for her motorcycle repair business. 

Glenda has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her motorcycle repair business.

location.town: Liloy-Villa M Tejero, Liloy Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Kotognogontala  I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à SOGODOGOLA, un des quartiers de la commune de KAI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI,préfecture de Kadiolo, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide  avec NASSARAN 2ème à droite position debout.
Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et la semence pour entretenir : 1hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de LOULOUNI et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 125.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group KOTOGNOGONTALA I are married women who average 40 years of age and four children living for the most part in polygamous families in SOGODOGOLA, a district in the Commune of  KAI, in the sub-prefecture of LOULOUNI, Prefecture of Kadiolo (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the off-season. The group members are on their fourth loan with the institution. The past loans have been properly repaid. 

The crop grown is: peanuts.  Such is the case with NASSARAN, who is standing second from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to pay for plowing and to buy farm inputs and seeds for maintaining one hectare. After the harvest, the produce is sold in villages, at the markets of LOULOUNI and SIKASSO, to a customer base composed of women and men. 

NASSARAN plans on making an average profit of 125,500 francs CFA per planting. The profits will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with day-to-day expenses. 

She would like to keep up this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso in order to make use of a larger arable plot, so she can derive better gains.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, farm inputs, and seeds

loans.name: Carmen Arcelia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Carmen, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 17, 14 y 9 años de edad, los  dos mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo tiene una panadería.

Ella junto  a su esposo tienen  una panadería en la cual además de pan de distintos modelos y sabores también preparan deliciosas tortas, nos cuenta nuestra amiga que su faena empieza desde las 5h00 que comienzan a hornear el pan para que cuando lleguen sus cliente todo esté listo y ellos puedan llevar el pan a sus  hogares, ella además de esto también tienen una mini tienda que también con la ayuda de sus esposo y sus hijos atienden, nos cuenta que llevan más de 17 años con su negocio desde que se caso con su esposo y le ha ido muy bien a pesar de la competencia.

Este crédito es para comprar harina, azúcar, sal, levaduras y otros ingredientes para preparar el pan y además para surtir su tienda. Lleva tres años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ellos pueden comprar al por mayor y les sale más barato todo.
 
Sus metas son ver realizados a sus hijos como profesionales.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'San Esteban' community bank meet in the town of Charapoto.  This town is known for its traditional culture and for the fact that it is located just a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we meet 36 year-old Carmen who is married and has three children aged 17, 14 and 9.  Her two eldest children are in high school and her youngest is in elementary school.  Her husband owns a bakery.

Together with her husband, Carmen owns a bakery in which, as well as making different types and flavors of bread, they also make delicious cakes.  Our friend tells us that her work starts at 5.00am, when they start baking bread so that when their customers arrive everything is ready and they can take their bread home to their families.  In addition to this work, Carmen also has a small store which she serves in with the help of her husband and children.  She tells us that she has in her business for more than 17 years, since she got married, and it is doing very well, in spite of the competition.

Carmen will use this loan to buy flour, sugar, salt, yeast and other ingredients for making her bread and also to stock her store.  She has been a member of her community bank for three years and she likes it because the loans mean that they can buy products wholesale which makes everything work out cheaper.

Carmen's goal is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, salt, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Francisca Haydde

texts.es:
Haydde,de 66 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de León, es madre soltera, tiene 5 hijos ,ella es comerciante se dedica a la venta de refrescos ,tiene 46 años dedicándose a este negocio, aunque ella no fue a la escuela aprendió a leer y escribir , trabaja desde muy pequeña, gracias a sus esfuerzo y arduo trabajo crio a sus hijos y sobrevivido de este negocio. Comenzó a vender refrescos de manera ambulante a los 20 años, después se estableció en el market de la estacion central que es donde vende sus refrescos. 
Requiere el préstamo para comprar frutas, cacao, arroz y otras especias para hacer sus refrescos. Con la inversión espera tener suficiente materia prima con que trabajar y vender sus refrescos. 
En lo futuro quiere poner piso en su local comprar mesas y sillas plásticas para acondicionar mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
Haydde is 66 years old and lives in the city of León.  She is a single mother with 5 children.  She is a merchant who sells soft drinks.  She has been doing this for 46 years and although she never went to school, she learned to read and write.  She has worked since she was very small and thanks to her effort and hard work she raised her children and survived this business. 

She started selling soft drinks in the street at age 20; then the market was established in the central station which is where she sells her drinks now. 

She is requesting a loan to by fruits, cocoa, rice, and other spices to make the soft drinks.  With this investment she hopes to have enough staple materials to work with and sell her soft drinks. 

In the future she wants to put flooring in her place and buy plastic tables and chairs to better equip her business.

loans.use: To buy fruit, cocoa, rice, and other spices to make their soft drinks

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is a married woman with six children; three attend school, while three have graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, Damaris has operated a firewood and charcoal selling business – selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she makes natural fruit juice for sale which contributes another source of income. She faces the major challenges of high transportation costs and also seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With this 80,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en:
Eddie is 54 years old and lives in Tangub City. He is married with 3 children. 

Eddie has a used-clothing business and earns approximately PHP 20,000 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase more used clothing for his business. Eddie has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing for his business

location.town: Tangub-Isidro D. Tan, Tangub City, Mindanao

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
Encarnacion is a 58-year-old married woman living in an area known for the farming of bananas and corn. She is thankful because through her business she is able to sustain the financial needs of her family. Though she has not been blessed with children, still she's grateful because she has an adopted child.

For 32 years, Encarnacion has been raising and selling pigs. She feeds them nutritionally balanced feeds mixed with corn until they reach optimum growth. She is able to earn about 1,200 Philippines pesos (P) per head, and she uses her obtained income to cover household expenses.

She asked for the loan amount of P20,000 to buy feeds. Once the pigs are fattened up, she sells them to local markets with the goal in mind of obtaining a better price in order to have increased income. Through this goal, she could save and maintain her hog-raising business.

loans.use: to buy feed stock for her hog-raising business.

loans.name: Joie Du Christ Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JOIE DU CHRIST est formé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Adjobignon Colette, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Adjobignon Colette est âgée de 33 ans et est mariée à un agent commercial du nom de Oscar. Le couple a quatre enfants à charge, tous à leur charge. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Adjobignon Colette vit ensemble avec sa famille. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Adjobignon Colette a arrêté très tôt l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et assurer ses différentes charges, Adjobignon Colette vend de la friperie dans un marché du Bénin. Adjobignon Colette achète ses produits au Bénin. Adjobignon Colette exerce cette activité depuis dix huit ans. C’est la deuxième fois que Adjobignon Colette et les autres membres du groupe JOIE DU CHRIST sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur servira à renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The "Joie du Christ" group is made of three people who live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The group's representative, Adjobignon Colette, has her hand raised in the photo. She is 33 years old and is married to a commercial agent called Oscar. They have 4 children are responsible for all of them. Some of the children have received education.

Adjobignon Colette lives with her family. Together, the couple take care of the various household expenses. Adjobignon Colette left school at an early age. To take care of her needs and to meet her expenses, she sells second-hand clothing at a market in Benin. She purchases the clothing in Benin, and has been involved in this activity for 8 years. This is the second time that Adjobignon Colette and the other members of "Joie du Christ" have asked for a loan from ALIDé. The loan will help them increase their business in order to better meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Virgen De Juquila Group

texts.es: Ingresaron al grupo Virgen de Juquila la señora Rosalinda va a comprar un anaquel y medicamento para surtir su farmacia, la señora Yesenia va a comprar telas por metro, hilos, agujas, resorte, botones, forros, etc. para surtir su taller de costura, las demás integrantes siguen en su actividad de alfareria. La señora Ernestina tiene 40 años de edad , ella es casada tiene 2 hijas le ayudan a trabajar a elaborar los ollas y los platos de barro, ella solicito su crédito para comprar barro, barro blanco y leña, ella inicio su negocio hace 5 años sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar la alfarería, este negocio es importante porque tiene trabajo y es en su casa no descuida a sus hijas, ella se siente orgullosa de saber  elaborar las ollas y los platos de barro, a ella le gusta cuando vende y tiene dinero, las ganancias las vuelve a invertir en los materiales para seguir trabajando, ella está feliz y contenta con este préstamo que va a recibir va a comprar el barro, barro blanco y leña para tener materiales almacenados e ir trabajando, sus sueños y esperanzas son seguir trabajando,que crezca su negocio y toda la familia este bien. Los integrantes del grupo le dan las gracias a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad por sus préstamos, muchas gracias con su ayuda salimos adelante con los negocio y vivir mejor con la familia.
texts.en:
Rosalinda, who will buy shelving and medicines to stock her pharmacy, and Yesenia, who will buy fabric by the meter, thread, needles, elastic, buttons, lining, etc. to stock her sewing shop, joined the “Virgen de Juquila” group.  The other members continue with their pottery activities.

Ernestina, 40, is married and has two daughters who help her make clay pots and dishes.  She requested the loan to buy clay, white clay and firewood.  She started her business five years ago; her parents taught her how to make pottery.  This business is important because she has work and it’s home-based so she can watch her daughters.  She feels proud to know how to make clay pots and dishes.  She likes it when she makes sales and has money.  She reinvests profits in materials so that she can continue to work.  She’s happy and content with this loan she’s going to get that she’ll use to buy clay, white clay and firewood in order to have supplies on hand to continue working.  Her dreams and hopes are to continue working, that the business continues to grow and that the entire family is well.  

The group members thank Kiva and Fundación Realidad for the loans; thanks to the loans they can make progress in business and live better with their families.

loans.use: to buy clay, white clay and firewood.

loans.name: Tashingaira Group

texts.en:
Bennegina is a 44-year-old widow. She has three children aged 24, 22 and 17.  Only one child is attending school. She has no other dependents and no additional source of income.

Bennegina buys and sells clothes, which she has been doing for the past 16 years.  With this loan, she will buy more clothes. The family outlook will improve as she will be able to buy food for the children.

In the next 5 years, Bennegina wishes to open more flea markets in town.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a diesel generator for his shop.

loans.name: Flavio

texts.es:
El señor Flavio tiene 58 años de edad, es casado con tres hijos.

Él es agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos como maíz, también es jornalero y a su vez ganadero cuenta con seis semovientes de crianza (vacas), esta actividad la realiza junto con su esposa, quienes tienen más de veinte años de dedicarse ha esta actividad. La familia de Flavio se dedica a la crianza de ganado, él manifiesta que la actividad es patrimonio familiar.

 Flavio posee seis vacas y un terreno donde se alimentan, esta es  alquilada para el pasto de las vacas. Antes de dedicarse a la crianza de ganado, trabajaba la agricultura y a prestar sus servicios como jornal, estas actividades no le eran muy rentables, por eso se dedico a la crianza y comercio de ganado.

El ganado lo compra en los tiangues (lugar donde se comercializa animales) aledaños a la zona que se encuentra a una distancia de dos kilómetros del cantón a la ciudad, cuando los compra en los tiangues, los semovientes son trasladados por la calle arriándolos.

El préstamo será invertido en la compra de dos vacas y materiales de construcción, para continuar la construcción de su vivienda, como 15 bolsas de cemento, 10 quintales de hierro, 1 camionada de arena y 300 ladrillos. Al comprar dos vacas lecheras, la producción de leche será mayor y podrá producir más lácteos para la venta. De esta manera, satisfacera la demanda existente de lácteos y recibirá mejores ingresos, lo que le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida.

Flavio espera continuar con la construcción de ladrillo de su casa, ya que la que tiene es de lámina y tabla de madera y seguir con la crianza de ganado y aumentarlo.
texts.en:
Señor Flavio is 58 years old, married and with 3 children. He is a farmer who grows basic grains such as corn. He also works as a day labourer and breeds livestock (cows); he has 6 cows for breeding. He carries out this activiity together with his wife who has more than 20 years of experience in this work. The Flavio family raises cattle and he says that it is a family business.

Flavio has 6 cows and a plot of land where they feed; the land is leased to graze the cows. Before breeding livestock, he was a farmer and worked as a labourer which wasn't very profitable. This is why he changed to breeding and cattle trade. 

He buys the livestock at 'tiangues' (a place where animals are sold), in an area 2 kms from the canton to the city. When he buys the cows at the flea markets he takes them home herding down the street.

The loan will be invested in buying 2 cows and materials for construction to continue building his house such 15 bags of cement, 10 quintals of iron, 1 truckload of sand & 300 bricks. With buying 2 dairy cows, his milk production will be greater and more milk will be available to sell. In this way, he will satisfy the current demand for milk and receive a better income which will allow him to improve his standard of living.

Flavio hopes to continue building his brick house as the one he currently has is made of laminate and wooden boards. He also hopes to continue breeding livestock and expand this business.

loans.use: to buy 2 cows and materials for construction such 15 bags of cement, 10 quintals of iron, 1 truckload of sand & 300 bricks.

loans.name: Julius Ngethe

texts.en:
Julius is a 27-year-old married man. He has a child who is eight months old. He describes himself as hardworking. 
Julius operates a transport business providing motorcycle services. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in Nakuru. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the traffic police and climate change. He will use his loan of 60,000 KES to buy a motorbike. His goal is to add more stock to his wife's tailoring business within five years.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Epipahnie

texts.en: Epipahnie is 36 years old and has two children aged 7 and 9. Both kids are in school. She sells cassava in a store she has run for twelve years. Epipahnie would like a loan to increase her inventory of cassava. Any profits will be used to make savings for her future. She dreams to have a big and prosperous store.

loans.use: to buy more cassava for sale.

loans.name: Karen Isabel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Desarrollo De Mujeres.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Karen, tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una hija de 8 años la misma que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es empleado privado.

Ella es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja tres días de la semana en sus recorridos, deja sus productos a crédito ya que es así como puede vender mucho mas dando ciertas ventajas de pagos y cobrando cada quince días.  Lleva  un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende es la ropa de mujer.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo ya que están muy cerca las fiestas de Navidad y Año Nuevo y sus productos tienen mucha salida en esta época del año. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal, es la secretaria del grupo  y le gusta porque los créditos son fáciles de hacer.

Su sueño es tener un bazar.
texts.en:
The members of the “Desarrollo de Mujeres” communal bank meet every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo known since colonial times as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

We met Karen, 29, here.  She’s married and has an 8-year-old daughter who is attending school.  Her husband is a private employee.

She is a housewife who in order to earn her own resources sells clothes via catalogue door to door.  She goes out on her rounds three days a week.  She sells on credit since that’s how she can sell much more by offering a few payment advantages and she collects payment every two weeks.  She’s been in this business for a year and does very well.  What she sells the most is women’s clothes.

This loan is to buy all types of clothes because the Christmas and New Year festivities are near and her products sell much during that time of the year.  She’s been in the communal bank since the beginning.  She’s the group’s Secretary and she likes it because the loans are easy to make.  Her dream is to have a clothing store.

loans.use: to buy all types of clothing.

loans.name: Enma Patricia

texts.es:
Enma es una mujer luchadora, trabajadora y responsable por sus hijos, es viuda, vive con sus hijos en San Gabriel Provincia del Carchi, en el Norte de Ecuador.
