Enma trabaja sola en la crianza de cerdos, en el negocio le va bien es por eso que quiere ampliar su negocio con más número de cerdos pero para eso tuvo la necesidad de realizar un crédito a Fodemi para invertir en la compra de cemento, ripio, madera, tablas para la construcción de un nuevo corral para que alcancen más animales y que sus ingresos mejoren al igual que su calidad de vida gracias a su inversión.

Su sueño es poder tener un criadero de cerdos y poder distribuir a empresas grandes.
texts.en:
Enma is a determined, hard-working woman who is responsible for her children. She is a widow and lives with her children in San Gabriel, Carchi Province, in northern Ecuador.

Enma works alone raising pigs. Her business is going well, and for this reason she wants to expand it, with a larger number of pigs. For this, however, she needed to request a loan from Fodemi to invest in buying cement, gravel, wood, and boards to construct a new pen so she will have space for more animals. Thanks to this investment, her income will increase, along with her quality of life. 

Her dream is to have a farm where she raises pigs and distributes them to large companies.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cement, boards, wood, etc. to build a larger pen.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 38 years old, married, and has 5 children. With all the children in school, she works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store.

She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.
 
Eva has a tailoring shop that makes and sells school uniforms, sport uniforms and office uniforms. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed for the tailoring shop.

Eva is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Eva hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for the tailoring shop.

loans.name: Duo Perlas Cristalinas Group

texts.es: Duo perlas Cristalinas. Mayra de 31 años de edad es casada y tiene un hijo ella se dedica a vender granizadas frente a una escuela desde hace varios años tambien tiene una tienda de productos de consumo diario nos cuenta que con el credito anterior pudo durtir mas su negocio es por eso que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos para elavorar granizadas y compra de productos comestibles para su tienda.

loans.use: Compra de productos comestibles y productos para elavorar granizadas.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Nicolas vive en la cálida ciudad de Aguaytia, ciudad en la cual podemos apreciar paisajes hermosos, ya que se encuentra en la selva peruana, asimismo hay muchos platillos típicos muy deliciosos y sobre todo sus pobladores son personas muy amables y hospitalarias.  Nicolas es una persona muy carismática y es así como pudo conquistar a su esposa con la cual tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 10 años, Nicolas ama a sus pequeños y por ello se esfuerza cada día para brindarles una vida digna y sobre todo para que sean personas de bien. Desde joven Nicolas aprendió a trabajar y más aun porque sus padres tenían pocos recursos económicos y debido a ello solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero logro estudiar un curso de ebanistería y Carpintería y gracias a ello logro iniciar su negocio de taller de fabricación, refacción y venta de muebles de madera, asimismo también confecciona instrumentos musicales entre otros; el se levanta desde muy temprano para aperturar su negocio y trabaja hasta 10 horas al día. Nicolas cree que está saliendo adelante en su negocio porque es amable con los clientes y siempre tiene diseños bonitos y con buenos acabados.

Nicolas está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales para realizar mejoras en su vivienda y por ello comprara calaminas, clavos, entre otros, de esta manera podrá tener una vivienda más segura y le dará una mejor calidad de vida para su familia, así el seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos y tener el taller más grande de su ciudad”.
texts.en:
Nicolas lives in the warm city of Aguaytia, a city in which we can appreciate beautiful landscapes in the Peruvian rainforest. Here, too, there are many very delicious typical dishes and, above all, the residents are very nice and hospitable people. Nicolas is a very charismatic person, and that is how he came to capture his wife, with whom he has 2 children, ages 5 and 10. Nicolas loves his little ones and for that reason, he works every day to provide them with a worthy life and, above all, to lead them to become good persons.

From an early age Nicolas learned to work, all the more because his parents had scarce economic resources. For that reason, he could only study to the 5th grade of secondary school. But he managed to complete a course in cabinetmaking and carpentry, thanks to which he was able to launch his business, a shop for woodworking, repair and selling wood furniture. He also makes musical instruments, among other things. Nicolas arises very early in the morning to open his business and works over 10 hours per day. He believes that his business is advancing because he treats his customers well and always offers attractive designs and good finished products. 

Nicolas is very grateful to Kiva investors. Thanks to the help they have offered, he is able to buy materials to make improvements to his home. For that purpose, he now wishes to buy corrugated iron sheets and nails, among other things. In this manner, he will make his home more secure and can offer a better quality of life to his family. Thus, he will continue struggling to make his grand dream become a reality: “To give a good education to his children and to have the largest shop in his city.”

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, and corrugated iron, among other supplies, for home improvement.

loans.name: Kulnara

texts.ru: Кулнара успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав средства по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В обороте есть товар на сумму 52,000 сом (KGS). Бизнес на сегодня приносит в среднем 6,800 сом (KGS) в месяц, этих средств не хватает на достойное содержание семьи и воспитание младших детей. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку товара для расширения ассортимента. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в ремонт дома.

loans.use: To purchase goods in order to increase the assortment and to help bolster her income

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine A. sells drinks in the semi-urban area of Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria, learnt the trade for six (6) months after which she started her business in the year 2004. According to her, if the above amount is given to her, she will be able to expand her business and she is married with three (3) children.

loans.use: To purchase more create of drinks for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She would like to buy four steers

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 24 years old. He would like to enhance his living standard and increase his income. He has a small shop in Kirkuk to repair and maintain washing machines. His poor family didn't send him to school. When he was 7 years old, he worked with his father to help him in the shop. He applied to get $1200 from Al-Aman to develop his small shop and buy new equipment.

His wife is expecting their first child. As he said,"I want to see my children in school."

Note: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, etc.).

loans.use: To develop his shop and buy new equipment

loans.name: Lupita

texts.es:
LUPITA is 22 years old, married, and has one son. Her husband works as a technician for a company called "Empresa de Cable Visión". She has a grocery store in her home and is a member of the group Aries 1. The other member is Julia Álvarez Díaz (who has bread-making business). WIth the loan Lupita will buy merchandise for her store and Julia will buy cooking instruments and primary ingredients for increasing her production of bread.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

LUPITA, tiene 22 años, casada con 1 hijo, su esposo trabaja como técnico en una Empresa de Cable Visión. Ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, forma parte del grupo Aries 1. Las otras integrantes son: Julia Álvarez Díaz (tiene una amasandería). Con el préstamo Lupita comprará mercadería para su tienda y Julia comprará implementos de cocina y materia prima para aumentar la producción de pan

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise for grocery store

loans.name: Ngurah Sastra

texts.id:
There is high demand for pork meat, especially during Hindu feast days. This is a good business opportunity for some Balinese that Mrs. Ngurah Sastra saw. She has been providing ceremonial animals for religious ceremonies. She farms chicken, duck and pig. Currently Mrs. Ngurah Sastra farms 4 growing pigs. The pigs that she farms is local variety that is used only for religious ceremonial use. Different from other farmers. The pigs are sold according to the ceremonial use for good price regardless of weight. Each 3 month old pig can be sold for about $40. So during "good days" for religious ceremony, she can earn up to $15 for each pig per month.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva volunteer

Kebutuhan akan daging babi di Bali sangat banyak khususnya pada saat hari raya atau upacara adat agama Hindu. Ini merupakan peluang usaha yang baik bagi masyarakat Bali. Ibu Ngurah Sastra melihat peluang ini. Ibu Ngurah Sastra selalu menyediakan sarana untuk upacara – upacara agama. Mulai dari ternak ayam, bebek dan babi dipeliharanya . Saat ini Ibu Ngurah Sastra memelihara 4 ekor babi penggemukan. Babi yang dipelihara adalah Babi jenis lokal yang dipelihara hanya untuk keperluan upacara agama. Berbeda dengan peternak babi lainnya. Babi ini dijual sesuai dengan kebutuhan upacara. Babi dijual dengan harga yang baik tanpa melihat beratnya. Satu ekor babi bisa dijual dengan harga Rp. 400.000,- meskipun baru berumur 3 bulan. Jadi pada saat ”hari baik” untuk upacara agama ia bisa mendapat keuntungan dari menjual ternak babi sampai Rp. 150.000,-/ ekornya setiap bulan.

loans.use: Buying more pigs to be grown

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase used clothes for her small business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Re-stocking corn (maize)

loans.name: Hasifa's Group

texts.en: Hasifa is married with four children, two of them twins. Her current business is selling clothes. She wants to start a matooke selling business with the extra profits. Matooke, green bananas, are one of Uganda's most important staple foods.

loans.use: To add to her business inventory

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es:
Rose is 46 years old, married, with a son of 9 years. She resides in the Hialeah neighborhood of Managua, considered one of the poorest neighborhoods and with more need for infrastructure than other parts of Managua. She works as a cook in a restaurant in a market of Managua. She has six years of experience doing this work. Her husband is 42 years old and works in construction. They want to give better living conditions to their small son and to themselves. They have worked at improving their house little by little, but still have a long way to go. The floor of their house is dirt and she needs the loan to tile the floor of the living room and the kitchen.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa tiene 46 años, casada, con un hijo de 9 años. Habita en el barrio Hialeah de Managua, considerado uno de los barrios más pobres y con más necesidad de infraestructura de Managua. Ella trabaja como cocinera de un restaurante en un mercado de Managua, lleva seis años dedicándose a este trabajo. Su esposo tiene 42 años y se dedica a la Construcción. Ellos quieren darles mejor condición de vida a su pequeño hijo y a ellos mismos. Han ido mejorando su casa poco a poco, pero todavía les falta mucho por recorrer. El piso de su casa es de tierra y necesita el préstamo para embaldosar el piso de la sala y la cocina.

loans.use: To buy cement and sand to tile the floor of the kitchen and living room of her house.

loans.name: Las Hermanas De Pantoja, Group 1

texts.en:
Oneyra lives in the suburb of Los Alcarrizos on the outskirts of Santo Domingo. From her home she has a small shop where she sells jewelry, makeup, undergarments and beauty supplies. She is asking for this loan so that she can have adequate capital to expand the products and merchandise that she is able to offer her clients. She knows that if she has a better selection she will be able to attract more clients and beat out her competition better!

Her dream is to move her business forward, keep expanding it, and to make better profits off of it. For her children, she hopes to provide a safe home and healthy environment so that they can grow up to become useful people to their communities. For herself, she hopes that her work ethic and success will provide a good example to both her family and her community.

In her free time she likes to pray that all of her dreams can be realized. On behalf of Oneyra and everyone here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support of her loan.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics, jewelry, and other beauty supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase different supplies for her store

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Eating of meat pie during snacks time is very popular in the Ghanaian working community. This has created a new market for many people, especially women.

Agnes has been operating a baking business for five years. She prepares and sells her pastry in the afternoon to the working community in Koforidua, a brisk town in Ghana. She wants to use her loan to buy more flour, margarine, vegetable oil, sugar, etc., to increase her inventory and to avoid price hikes.

Agnes is a member of the group called “Agyenkwa Nyame” (meaning "Soul Saving God"). Members help each other by guaranteeing for themselves as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more flour, margarine, vegetable oil, sugar, etc., for her bakery

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy has been selling babies’ clothes and lingerie in the local market for almost 20 years. She is married with five children. Four of the children are currently in school.

Babies’ clothes have a high demand from women and this has created a more profitable market for sellers. Lucy wants to use the loan to buy more babies’ products like clothes, pomade, soaps, Pampers, diapers and so on, and also to buy lingerie to increase her inventory and sales.

She is a member of the group called Sons of God. Members agree in principle to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bales of babies’ clothes and lingerie.

loans.name: Suemalo

texts.en: Suemalo F., 47, is married with ten children. Her husband and children work a plantation. She has many years of experience making pancakes, porkcakes, ice cakes, etc. and selling them for her business. She sells to the village and general public 5 days per week. Suemalo has 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~$208 USD). SPBD loans are Suemalo’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her earnings will be used to improve her business and help out with family expenses.

loans.use: Suemalo would like to improve her business status and help to improve her home.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is 25 years old, divorced, and has 3 children. She became a food seller in 2004. Every day, she works from 6 a.m. to 3 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$140.

Leticia now hopes to receive a loan to buy more food items, such as rice, maize flour, vegetables and bananas, for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have similar businesses.

loans.use: Increase of inventory

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mrs. Heng B. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land and grows mango trees in Preak Takeo Village in Kandal Province, Cambodia. Her husband, Mr. Khin Saron, is a cow and poultry breeder. 

Mrs. Heng B. now faces an obstacle because her mango trees have been damaged by insects. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more pesticides to kill all types of insects. She will use the rest of the loan to buy more fertilizers to support her farm. 

Mrs. Heng B. is 56 years old and the mother of seven children, three of whom are married and they live separate from their parents, while another one is a Cambodia government officer. The fifth is employed by a private company and the remaining two attend high school. 

Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Morn

texts.en: Mrs. Morn S. was born in 1968 and lives in Thmor Reap Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a 40-year-old widow with a child enrolled in the local school. She is a traditional healer in the local village. Since her business is going well, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more traditional medicine in order to cure her patients. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan.

loans.use: To buy more traditional medicine in order to cure her patients.

loans.name: Ajara

texts.en: Ajara M. is married and has two children who have completed school. She lives with her family at Obuasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She is 50 years old. She is involved in the sale of clothing and lace materials, and she has been selling through hawking for the past ten years. She is constrained by funds to run the business. She needs the loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality and large quantity of clothing stock to upgrade her inventory. She belongs to the community group called "Ahobrasee" (meaning "humility") Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more lace and clothing materials.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence E. is 42 years old and married with 3 children. She started this business in 2002. She travels to Delta State in Nigeria to purchase local gin (ogogoro) to sell to retailers in Benin City. She is a LAPO client. She needs the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more local ogogoro to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and that they should keep up the good work.

loans.use: To purchase more local gin (ogogoro) to sell

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
“I dream that my simple business today will improve so I can continue to help my husband in supporting our daily needs,” Nida M. of Magsaysay Naguillan, Isabela said. 

She is married to Felimon, a carpenter, and their marriage is blessed with five children: Leni is the eldest, a 36-year-old high school graduate who is now in Hong Kong working as domestic helper, Liza– a 34-year-old high school graduate, Roselene– a 32-year-old who is married and has finished high school, Binsor– a 30-year-old high school graduate who operates a tricycle, and Michael– a 27-year-old, and also a high school graduate. 

Nida is currently engaged in food vending. Every afternoon, she sells different grilled foods such as barbecued pork, hotdogs, etc. She displays her products in front of their house. Nida wants to increase the quantity of the food she sells to earn more income; so she is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 8,000. She will buy meats and other ingredients for her business.

“With such an amount, I hope to add other varieties of food for the hungry stomach. I am very optimistic that I will earn more to support my family's needs,” she said. 

In addition to her food vending business, Nida also serves as a house caretaker owned by her nieces who are abroad. This serves as an extra income to her.

loans.use: Purchase more meat and ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: Eva tiene 31 años de edad, y cerca de 12 años viene conviviendo con su pareja, con quien tuvo dos hermosos hijos y ahora están construyendo su casa de madera. Sus padres se han dedicado a las labores agrícolas, la cual era su única fuente de ingresos económicos, pasaron los años y Eva se enamoro de un agricultor muy trabajador y sobre todo responsable. En el tiempo que están juntos se han propuesto metas de progresar y desarrollarse en el mercado competitivo, vienen dedicándose a la actividad de la compra y venta de frutas y su esposo siembra cítricos y otra veces les compra la fruta a sus vecinos. Comprar de las chacras les es muy conveniente, ya que la inversión es menor, invierten 1000 soles en cítricos y su ganancia es de 600, descontando todos los gastos. Lo que también hace es comprar plátanos verdes y mediante el líquido llamado Etrel maduran los plátanos antes de su tiempo, esta inversión le cuesta 3 soles, y le es muy rentable también. Eva es otra de las clientas muy puntual en sus pagos y sobre todo en su banco comunal es una socia muy activa que participa en todas las actividades que realizan los analistas de crédito y siempre está en las condiciones de brindar apoyo. El dinero que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de una camionada de frutas, para luego enviarlo al mercado de Lima, mientras que la carga de plátanos los va enviar al mercado de su ciudad hasta que se mejore la plaza de Lima en esta fruta.
texts.en:
Eva is 31 years old, and she has lived with her husband for about 12 years. They have two handsome sons and now they are building a wooden house. Her parents did agricultural work for a living, which was their only source of income. The years passed and Eva fell in love with a very hardworking and responsible farmer. In the time they have been together, they have proposed goals to advance and develop in the competitive market. They work in the business of buying and selling fruit. Her husband plants citrus fruits and sometimes he buys fruit from their neighbors. Buying from small farms is convenient for them, since it is less of an investment. They invest 1000 soles in citrus fruits and their earnings are 600 (soles), discounting all expenses. What they also do is buy green plantains and by using a liquid called Etrel, the plantains mature before their time. This investment costs 3 soles, and it is very profitable as well. Eva is another client who is very timely with her payments, and she is also a very active member of her communal bank. She participates in all activities that the loan analysts do, and she is always is ready to lend a hand. She plans to invest the money she's requesting by purchasing a fruit truck that she will later send to the market in Lima. Meanwhile, she is going to send the load of plantains to her city market until conditions for selling this fruit at the main square in Lima improve.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a fruit truck

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa E. is a scrap buyer. Everyday, she goes out on the streets to buy scrap materials like metals, cans, bottles etc. From the garbage that she gets from the households, she earns money to make a living. She started her business in 1996 with a capital of Php 2,000. Now,  her business is growing and established. She has one child and dreams of sending her to school. The business that she has right now is a big help for the family income.

She is requesting a loan of Php 9,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy more scrap and sell it to her clients. The loan will allow Adelfa to earn more profits for her family.

CEVI is supporting Adelfa with her business. She now enjoys credit assistance trainings and insurance services with CEVI.

loans.use: To buy more scrap for resale

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
El señor Wilson vive en casa de sus padres en la calle Arturo Borda de la zona de Alto Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que el realiza es el ensamblaje de computadoras y mantenimiento de computadoras, además de esta actividad Wilson tiene una librería en la zona central.
El crédito que solicita es para la compra de papel Bond y así poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes ya que su la librería está ubicada justo  frente a la facultad de arquitectura.

Es cliente de Impro desde enero de 2008 y por su actividad puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Wilson lives in his parent's house in Alto Sopocachi in the the city of La Paz. He works assembling and repairing computer; he also has a bookstore downtown. The loan that he is requesting is for the purchase of Bond paper to be able to satisfy his clients' demand, since his bookstore is located just across from the university's architecture department. He has been a client of Impro since January 2008 and with his business he is eligible to receive a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Bond paper to sell in his bookstore

loans.name: 15 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Quang Hung commune is located in Thanh Hoa province and is primarily comprised of professional traders and farmers tilling small fields. Each of the four members of Group 15 - Quảng Hưng are borrowing 3.079.800 VND (about $177) to invest in their businesses.

Ms. Hà Thị Huế is the group leader for Group 15 - Quảng Hưng. She is 37 years old and works selling vegetables that she grows in her field. She plans to use her loan to invest in her vegetable-sales business. Her husband is Mr. Lê V. Lựu who is a 41-year-old construction worker. They have two children. Their daughter, Lê Thị Nhạn, is 18 years old and had to quit school after grade 9 to sell clothes and help her parents support the family. Their son, Lê V. Hạ, is 11 and currently studying in grade 5.

Other members of the group: * Ms. N. Thị Đằm is 47 years old and borrows to invest in her vegetable resale business. * Ms. V. Thị Hà is 34 years old and wishes to invest in her carpentry workshop (specializing in wood furniture). * Ms. L. Thị Bình is 47 years old and will put her funds toward her phở breakfast restaurant (phở is a delicious rice-noodle soup dish commonly eaten for breakfast in Viet Nam). -------------------------------------------------- * Thôn 1 xã Quảng Hưng là một thôn nghèo thuộc tỉnh Thanh Hoá, sinh sống chủ yếu bằng nghề buôn bán nhỏ và làm ruộng. Chị Hà Thị Huế năm nay 37 tuổi,làm nghề buôn bán rau và làm ruộng.Chồng chị là Lê V. Lựu,41 tuổi,làm nghề thợ xây. Gia đình chị sinh được 2 người con:con gái đầu là lê Thị Nhạn, 18 tuổi,vì điều kiện kinh tế gia đình quá khó khăn nên Nhạn phải nghỉ học từ năm lớp 9 để đi bán quần áo thuê giúp bố mẹ đỡ vất vả hơn,con trai thứ hai là Lê V. Hạ, năm nay 11 tuổi đang học lớp 5. Chu kỳ này chị vay mức 3.079.800 VNĐ ~177 USD. Nhóm của chị gồm 4 tH.nh viên: * Chị V. Thị Hà năm nay 34 tuổi, chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào xưởng mộc. * Chị L. Thị Bình năm nay 47 tuổi, chị vay vốn để bán H.ng phở ăn sáng. * Chị N. Thị Đằm năm nay 47 tuổi, chị vay vốn để buôn bán rau.

loans.use: Investments in vegetable resale, carpentry, breakfast businesses

loans.name: Leaso

texts.en: Leaso V., 38, is married and has three children.  She has three years experience running a bingo parlor, which is open to the public two days a week. Laeso has three previous loans with SPBD, and expects her weekly net cash flow from her business to be about $145.  SPBD loans are Leaso’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from a traditional bank. She plans to use her loan to buy bingo supplies, a bingo machine and also to fund improvements to her home.

loans.use: To buy another bingo machine and other items for her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 47 años, vive con sus 5 hijos y su esposo en su casa propia. Desde hace 3 años trabaja vendiendo animales, tanto su carne como su lana; dependiendo del tipo de animal trata de sacarle el mayor provecho, para obtener mayores ganancias. Adicionalmente, por las mañanas, vende golosinas durante los momentos de refrigerio en el cafetín de una escuela privada cercana a su casa, esto permite que Elizabeth tenga más ganancias para cubrir los gastos educativos de sus 5 hijos. Ocasionalmente la ayudan sus hijos mayores, ya que su esposo trabaja lejos, sin embargo la misma forma de trabajo ha hecho de que se adecue a las exigencias físicas. Para más adelante desea tener un terreno adecuado para criar a sus animales y ya no en el patio de su casa. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, ella es una de las socias más comprometidas con su banco comunal, es muy dinámica e impulsa la responsabilidad de su grupo, es por ello que asume el cargo de tesorera. El dinero que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de más ovejas de raza, las cuales están valorizadas en 180 soles cada una. También adquirirá más dulces para la venta en su cafetín.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 47, lives with her husband and 5 children in their own home. For 3 years she has been selling livestock, both for meat and for wool; depending on the type of animal, she tries to get the greatest benefit in order to have the best possible earnings. In addition, in the morning she sells candies during snack time in the cafeteria of a private school near her house, which permits Elizabeth to have additional income to cover the educational expenses of her 5 children. Occasionally her older children help her, since her husband works far away; nevertheless, this type of work has been able to cover the financial needs. In the future she would like to have enough land to raise her animals, rather than on the patio of her house. This is her second loan through MFP. She is one of the most engaged members of her communal bank, being very dynamic and driven by responsibility to her group, which is why she has assumed the position of treasurer. The money she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of more purebred sheep, which are valued at 180 soles each. She will also acquire more candies to sell in her cafeteria.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sheep

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es: El Señor José R. tiene 37 años, habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, casado su esposa se desempeña en los labores de la casa. Unos de sus proyectos es terminar la construcción de su vivienda. Don José tiene su negocio de venta de leche agria de forma ambulante por las mañana y en las tarde acarrea en su vehiculo, obteniendo otros ingresos para su hogar esta forma de vida lo tiene desde hace cuatro años. Iniciándolo con fondo de las pocos trabajo de construcción que realizaba. En el transcurso ha tenido dificultades que su vehiculo se le daño el motor y no tenia suficiente fondo para repararlo, hasta que pudo cambiar motor. Con el préstamo en Afodenic lograra legalizar su vehiculo por el cambio del motor y que siga generando mayores utilidades.
texts.en:
José R., 37, lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in the capital of Managua. He is married, and his wife is a housewife. One of his projects is to finish the construction on his house. In the mornings José is a street vendor of sour milk. In the afternoons he uses his vehicle to transport things and get other income for his home. He has been doing these things for four years. He started with funds from the small amount of construction work he had. With the passage of time, he has had difficulties with the vehicle. The engine is damaged, and he did not have enough money to repair it until he could change the engine. With the loan from Afodenic, he will be able to legalize the vehicle by changing the engine. He will then continue to generate greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Legalize his vehicle by changing the engine and be able to make his work easier

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Mrs. Clarita C. is the mother of four children: Denver, Christian, Welbor and Maribel, and they live in Sta. Cruz, San Manuel, Isabela. Her husband, Wilfredo, is a factory worker in Saudi Arabia. Being far away from one another is difficult, but they need to do this in order to provide the needs of their family and support their children’s education.

To help her husband financially and to send her children to school, Clarita decided to have her own business of hog-raising. In line with this desire, she would like to borrow a loan of PHP30,000 for the maintenance of her business and supply of feed.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 40 years old.  She is married and blessed with two children who are in school. Janet is a trader who works very hard to provide food for her children. She enjoys selling cosmetics, a trade which has been her primay source of income for the past two years. She says selling cosmetics is lucrative and her experience in the market has enabled her to gain many loyal customers. She mostly sells her goods through hawking, and she balances that with the manufacturing of palm oil.

Janet believes that with this loan, she will have more resources to purchase a wider variety of cosmetics like pomade, hair cream, and lipstick.  She will also be able to purchase more palm nuts to increase her inventory for palm oil sales. Janet would be grateful for your assistance. She belongs to a village bank called "Yehowa Nemewhefo."

loans.use: Janet wants to use the loan to buy more cosmetic products and palm nuts.

loans.name: Alice Lum

texts.en:
Alice is married with six children. She lives in Azire, Cameroon.  Alice and her entire family live in a house with 4 rooms.  Alice overcomes many challenges in life such as taking care of her children and supporting her husband by paying fees for their children. 

Alice runs a restaurant business frying gateaux (a kind of cake) in front of the family compound with the support of her children. She plans to invest this loan in her business and other farm work. Alice hopes expand this business since she has been operating it for a number of years.

This will be Alice's second loan from GHAPE. She has been a member since 2008.  Her business is very successful due to its location and Alice's reasonable prices.  Thanks to the experience she has, she now serves more customers.
 
Part of her profits from this loan will be used to take care of her ageing mother, as well as to buy necessities for her family and her grandchildren. The other part of the loan will be used to improve her farm. Alice intends to start repayment immediately on the day of collection.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: The improvement of her gateaux-frying business and her farm.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel es una mujer emprendedora y ser maestra de profesión y madre, le permitió educar a sus hijos, buscando brindarles todos los cuidados dentro y fuera de su casa. Su remuneración como profesora no era suficiente para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia, por ello decidió emprender el negocio de la venta de ropa. Actividad que realiza desde hace 10 diez años, tiempo en el cual aprendió a manejar el negocio y a entablar amistad con algunos comerciantes, quienes le proveen de mercadería de buena calidad. Este es un gran beneficio, pues puede ofrecer las prendas de vestir a sus clientes a precios muy cómodos, lo cual marca la diferencia frente otros vendedores y ella. Aunque lo difícil es tener que cobrar semanalmente a las personas que vende al crédito, debido a las distancias que tiene que recorrer y para esta labor se toma todo el día, durante los fines de semana. Ahora Maribel se está proyectando para abrir una tienda en su casa, pues sus clientes conocen su domicilio y la motivaron a instalar un bazar donde ofrezca diversos productos, tanto como ropa y artículos para el hogar, lo cual espera conseguir pronto. Ya son 13 los préstamos con Microfinanzas PRISMA, éstos le permitieron mejorar su calidad de vida. Además es una buena oportunidad, la que brinda su banco comunal, en pro del desarrollo económico y social, personal y de sus compañeras. Los 3000 soles solicitados le permitirán invertir en la compra de vitrinas y exhibidores para su bazar.
texts.en:
Maribel is an enterprising woman, a teacher by profession, and a mother. Her background has allowed her to raise her children with a view to meeting their needs inside and outside her home. Her compensation as a teacher was not sufficient to meet the needs of her family and, because of this, she decided to enter the business of selling clothes.

She has carried out this activity for 10 years, time in which she has learned to manage the business and establish friendship with some dealers who provide her with good quality merchandise. This is a great benefit since she can offer the promise of dressing her customers at very comfortable prices. This marks the difference between other sellers and herself.

The difficulty she faces is having to make weekly collections from people to whom she sells on credit. Due to the distances she has to cover this task takes all day during the weekends.

Now, Maribel is planning to open a shop in her house. Since her customers are acquainted with her home this motivated her to establish a shop where she offers diverse products such as clothing and household articles which she hopes to obtain soon.

She has already had 13 loans with Microfinanzas PRISMA. These have allowed her to improve her quality of life. Furthermore, her community bank has offered a good opportunity for economic, social, and personal development to her and her friends. The 3000 soles she is applying for will permit her to invest in the purchase of showcases and other equipment for exhibiting merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of showcases for exhibiting merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: sale of charcoal

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie G. is from the village of Purok 2, Capucao, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 21 years old, is married, and has one infant child. Rosemarie owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Rosemarie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: 3 De Septiembre Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “3 de Septiembre” esta representado por la señora Kattia y conformado por 12 miembros de los cuales 3 son hombres y 9 mujeres. Este grupo esta integrado por una mayoría de personas que se dedican a la prestación de servicios en empresas privadas, el resto se dedican a la venta de pan, comida y los varones son operadores de maquinaria pesada La competencia dentro de sus rubros es alta, pese a eso saben sacar adelante la actividad económica a la que se dedican. El crédito esta destinado al crecimiento de sus negocios con la compra de mercaderías, insumos y herramientas para mejorar más sus ingresos que les permitirá darles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias van cursando su primer ciclo dentro de la institución pero están contentos de que se les brinde un apoyo económico que ayudada a generar mejores ingresos y a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia
texts.en:
The communal bank “3 de Septiembre” is represented by Señora Kattia and consists of 12 members, 3 of whom are men and 9 of whom are women. The majority of people in this group provide services in private businesses, others sell bread and food, and the men are heavy machine operators. The competition in these areas is strong, and they know that they must continue to move forward in their respective businesses. This loan will be used to purchase merchandise, supplies and tools to assist in the growth of these businesses so that the borrowers can increase their incomes and give their families a better quality of life. As far as credit experience, these members are in their first cycle with the institution, but they are happy that it is providing them economic support that will help them to generate better incomes and a better quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: operating capital

loans.name: Winfred's Group

texts.en: N. Winfred is a 30 year old lady and married with 4 children aged between 9 years and 6 months, as she takes care of her siblings. She is a business lady involved in the sale of second hand clothes and the sale of green bananas from Owino and Nansana markets respectively for 17 years. She employs two people to help with both businesses and hence remains with 80,000/= as profits a week. She has a dream of importing her clothes from Dubai for more quality so that she could become self reliant with the increased savings. For the clothes, at times they are scarce to get and once she gets her loan, she will be able to buy in large quantities for increased stock. She is a determined and hard working lady with a strong drive to succeed.

loans.use: Buying more clothes for increased stock.

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en:
Ferdinand is 39 years old. He was a soldier and he is married to Ma. Luisa A., a full time housewife. They have two kids: Carl Luis Ferdinand who is 7 years old and in grade 1 and Sonia Ysabel who is one year old. They are living harmoniously at Cabaruan, Cauayan City Isabela, one kilometer away from the national highway. His internet cafe is located at Cabatuan Road. 
He has operated an internet cafe for almost seven years. His weekly net income is PHP 2,000.00. His wife also has an electronic load station for cell phones inside his internet cafe. He applied for a loan amount of PHP 25,000.00, for additional capital to be able to make his business productive. As a loving and industrious father to his family, he wants to earn more income in order to support his family, especially financially, for their better future in life.

loans.use: Additional capital for his internet cafe

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is engaged to Alexander M.. This couple are blessed with three children: Melanie-28 years old, a college graduate; Mylene-25 years old, college level; and Michelle-23 years old who is an undergraduate in college.

Nena is a chicken raiser in the village of Quezon, San Isidro. She would like to buy additional chicks to raise to make more income and to improve their way of living. In this regard, she would like to take out a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP 5,000. This amount would be a big help in achieving her goals in life, so she is hoping that this loan amount will be approved.

loans.use: additional capital to buy more chicks to raise

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina C. is from the village of Lupagan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old, is widowed, and has three adult children. Lina owns and operates a business providing rooms to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Lina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 33,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for the renovation of her rooms. Lina is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to complete the renovation of her rooms. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To complete the renovation of her rooms

loans.name: Prosperidad Y Exito Group

texts.es:
La señora Dolivethi tiene un año y cuatro meses formando parte del grupo “PROSPERIDAD Y ÉXITO”  donD. tiene el cargo D. presidenta. La señora vive en la Urb. Rivera D. chillón una zona nueva y prospera, ella nos cuenta que al inicio  era una zona donD. no había muchos negocios es así que es una D. la primeras en poner el negocio D. cabinas D. Internet; pues en aquel lugar no se contaba con ese servicio siendo la única capto muchos clientes posteriormente a pesar que  le salio competencia, ella pudo salir adelante por su empeño, dedicación y su buen trato hizo D. que sus clientes siempre acudan a su negocio, por otro lado también se esta iniciando en el negocio D. minimarket que recién a formado en sociedad. 
Lo que mas le fascina es el rubro D. alimentos ya que  considera que es su especialidad,  ella prepara comidas para eventos y actividades por lo que es conocida en ese rubro y tiene muchos contratos; lo que le gustaría en el futuro es formalizarse y crear una marca y patente. Por parte D. EDAPROSPO ella recibe mucho apoyo y siempre recuerda cuando caminando por el mercado encontró un afiche tirado en el suelo que hablaba sobre los prestamos que EDAPROSPO otorgaba y así deciD. formar su grupo con amigas del barrio, considera que con los prestamos que recibió mejoro su negocio ya que con su ganancia pudo comprar vitrinas y enceres para mejorarlo. Su actual préstamo lo usara para comprar mercadería para su minimarket, sabe que se acerca las fiestas naviD.ñas y habrá mucha venta. 


*En la foto al lado derecho aparecen como invitadas 2 socias pasivas la Sra dolivethy esta D. pie es la cuarta D. la derecha.
texts.en:
For one year and four months, Dolivethi has been a member of the “PROSPERIDAD Y ÉXITO” [Prosperity and Success] group, for which she holds the post of president. She lives in the Rivera neighborhood of Chillón, a new and prosperous area. She tells us that at first there were few businesses in the area, and she was one of the first to open an Internet café. Since that service had not previously existed in the neighborhood, and her business was the only one, she attracted many customers. Later, even though competition arose, she was able to maintain her success through hard work, dedication and excellent service that kept customers coming back to her business. At the same time, she also ventured into the minimarket business and has recently started a company. What fascinates her most is the field of food service, which she considers her specialty. She prepares food for events and activities; she is well-known in this field and receives many contracts. In the future, she would like to formalize this business and create a brand and patent. She receives much support from EDAPROSPO; she will always remember the time when she was walking through the market and found a poster that had been tossed on the ground which talked about the loans offered by EDAPROSPO, and she decided to form her group with friends from the neighborhood. She believes that the loans she has received have helped her improve her business, since with the profits she was able to purchase display cases and equipment to enhance it. She will use the current loan to buy merchandise for her minimarket; she knows that the Christmas holidays are approaching and the sales volume will be high. *In the photo, on the right-hand siD., two passive partners appear as guests; Dolivethy is standing up and is the fourth from the right.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise for her minimarket

loans.name: Akomola

texts.fr:
En 2006, ce monsieur a commencé le commerce en détail des gaz et des accessoires de gaz, il s’approvisionne au mali, au Ghana et au burkina. Il exerce son commerce dans le quartier de hedzranawoé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé.  Son stock de marchandises est en  baisse, il souhaiterait s’approvisionner raison pour laquelle il sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit pour l’achat de 7 brûleurs, 15 bouteilles de gaz, 10 cuisinières et 10 tuyaux.
Etant célibataire, le revenu de son commerce lui permet de subvenir aux charges de sa famille
texts.en:
In 2006 this gentleman started a business selling gas and gas accessories. He gets his supplies from Mali, Ghana and Burkina Faso. He runs his business in the Hedzranawoé district which is the peripheral area of the city of Lomé. His stock of merchandise is decreasing and he is requesting his first loan from WAGES in order to purchase seven gas burners, fifteen bottles of gas, ten gas stoves and 10 pipes. As he is single, the income from his business allows him to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of gas burners, bottles of gas, gas stoves, pipes, etc.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Maria del Rosario A. es una señora  que junto con su esposo hace 8 años iniciaron con un negocio de abarrotes llamado “Granito de Arena”, donde venden de todo como galletas, botanas, refrescos, comida enlatada, algunos artículos para cabello, dulces y más.
Del negocio ellos se mantienen económicamente y con la ayuda de su hijo que los apoya.  Al cargo de ello están 2 nietos que cuidan cuando los papas salen a trabajar.
La señora ahora quiere surtir el negocio para empezar bien el año con mejor mercancía nueva y así obtener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria del Rosario A. is a woman who, together with her husband, started a small grocery store 8 years ago called “Granito de Arena”. There she sells items such as cookies, snacks, soft drinks, canned goods, and some items for the hair, candy, and more. With this business and with help from their son they are able to sustain themselves economically. They also care for 2 of their grandchildren when their parents go to work. Maria now wants to stock her store to begin the new year with new and better merchandise and in this way obtain higher earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Roman

texts.es:
Roman tiene 37 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos en el sector Punto 9 del distrito de Mochumí, ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de gasolina en su domicilio desde hace dos años. Inició esta actividad debido a que los ingresos que percibia trabajando como obrero agrícola no eran suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares. La gasolina es de mucha utilidad en la zona donde vive, sobretodo para el riego de campos de sembrío, ya que la mayor parte de terrenos agrícolas no cuentan con canales de regadío y tienen que regar sus cultivos con agua de pozo extraida por motores.

Adicionalmente trabaja como obrero agrícola. Roman sabe que tiene que esforzarse al máximo todos los dias para sacar adelante a su familia, por ello siempre da todo de sí en las labores que realiza. El se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que planea utilizar en la ampliación de su negocio de venta de gasolina.

Su mas grande anhelo es brindarle a sus hijos la posibilidad de estudiar algun tipo de carrera superior cuando terminen sus estudios secundarios. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Roman, 37, is married and lives with his wife and three children in the Punto 9 sector, Mochumí district, which is 30 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. For the last two years he has sold gasoline from his home. He began this work because the earnings he made from working as a field hand were not enough to meet family expenses. Gasoline is very useful in the area where he lives, above all for irrigation of farmlands, because the great majority of fields do not have irrigation canals and the crops must be watered with water that is extracted from wells by motors. He also works as an agricultural field hand. Roman is aware that he must exhert the greatest effort daily if he is to support his family so he gives his all to the tasks he does. He is asking Edpyme Alternativa for 1500 new soles to be used to enlarge his gasoline-sales business. His greatest wish is to provide his children with the possibility to study some kind of a professional career when they finish secondary school. He has collaborated with our institution in the past and he has shown himself to be responsible and punctual with respect to repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy gasoline.

loans.name: 5 De Agosto Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento 5 D. Agosto, este es su primer Ciclo es un banco nuevo, la mayoria D. sus integrantes se dedica al comercio: vendiendo viveres, productos D. belleza,material escolar,comida, otras tienen kiosko y tienda.

La Sra. ANGELA ocupa la presidencia,esta casada tiene hijos pequeños que se encuentran algunos en la escuela, ella es dueña D. una tienda D. barrio y con el prestamo tiene pensado comprar una heladera para un frial, esto le permitirá diversificar sus productos en su tienda y D. esta manera aumentar su capital y sus ingresos.

El Sr. RAFAEL  tiene a su cargo la Secretaria, el tiene una familia numerosa, y trabaja D. 8 D. la mañana a 8 D. la noche para poder mantener a su familia, su principal actividad es la gastronomia y tambien se dedica a repartir viveres por la zona D. Achachicala, con el prestamo a comprara diferentes productos como: aceite, harina, arroz, azúcar,fideos por cantidad, teniendo así más pedidos y más ingresos para el y su familia.

La Sra. CARMEN Es una socia que esta como tesorera, tiene 2 hijos y cuenta con un kiosko  en un colegio D. la ciudad D. La Paz, con el prestamo comprara diferentes productos, aprovechando que se iniciaran las clases desea surtir su kioko y D. esta manera podra ahorrar para comprarse otro kiosko y asi mejorar su calidad D. vida.

Todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que en muchos casos ellas solas mantienen el hogar, estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.

OJO  En la foto se encuentran once integrantes porque uno D. las personas vino acompañado.
texts.en:
The 5 D. Agosto communal bank is in its first loan cycle; it’s a new bank. Most of its members are merchants. They sell: food items, beauty products, school supplies, prepared meals. Some have a stand and stores. ANGELA is the group president. She’s married and has small children, some of whom are in school. She has a small, neighborhood grocery store and plans to use the funds to buy an ice chest so that she can diversify her inventory and increase her earnings. RAFAEL is the Group secretary. He has a numerous family and works from 8am until 8pm in order to support them. His main activity is cooking and he also delivers food items in the Achachicala neighborhood. He will use the funds to buy various products like: cooking oil, flour, rice, sugar, pasta in quantity, so that he can fill more orders and product higher income for himself and his family. CARMEN is the Group treasurer. She has two children and has a stand in a school in La Paz. She will use the funds to buy various products to stock her stand now that the new school year is about to start. She hopes to save up to buy a second stand so that she can increase her income. All of the members are responsible and hard-working people who, in many cases, are the sole support for their households. They are very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in them when granting the loan. NOTE: There are 11 people in the Photo because one of the people brought someone along.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia G. is from the village of Siloy, Calamba, Misamis Occidental.  She is 41 years old, a widow and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Dionesia owns & tills her own garden and riceland and she also receives a monthly pension of 1,800 Php per month. From her riceland and gardening activity she gain a proceeds of at least 4,000 per harvest.

In 2008, Dionesia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Dionesia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC.  Dionesia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to finance her rice production activity. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Dionesia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general welfare of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For her Rice Production

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites Z., 34, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Albert Z., a mason/carpenter, they are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own food stall and electronic cellular phone loading station for three years now.

Marites has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her food and phone load business.     

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying raw ingredients needed to continue production of her recipes. Some of the loan amount will also be invested in buying cellular phone loads.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education. She also dreams that she will finally have her own house, where she can live up her days with her family.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients and cellular phone loads.

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en: Lorn M. is married and resides with her children in Takeo province, Cambodia. She has two children. She is engaged in a business of producing cow ties to sell to the villagers, earning an income of USD 2.30 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who operates his motorbike to provide transportation services, earning an income of USD 4.60 per day. Their standard of living has been improved since they have had these businesses. M. is requesting a loan of 800 USD to purchase cows in stock for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered Kiva.

loans.use: To buy cows to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more guinea corn to process Kunu to sell.

loans.name: Michael

texts.es:
Michael A.   es un señor de 24 años de edad que vive con su esposa en una comunidad llamada San Ramón de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche, la agricultura principalmente de café, plátano y también se da mucho la cría de cerdos. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. 
Desde hace 2 años don él se dedica a la siembra de papaya, por lo tanto, dice que posee bastante experiencia en el cuidado y mantenimiento de esta clase de cultivo, tiene un pequeño  terreno en el cual ha sembrado papaya anteriormente y le ha dado muy buenos resultados a la hora de distribuirla por lo cual desea expandir su plantación, ya que gracias a este negocio la calidad de vida de su familia ha mejorado considerablemente.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita Michael es un micro crédito de ¢605,000 (seiscientos cinco mil colones), para comprar fertilizantes, semillas y sembrar un hectárea de papaya, además de los  insumos  necesarios para dar el mejor mantenimiento y asistencia posible a su cosecha, así al final podrá ser recompensado y podrá tener una muy buena producción. 
Don Michael  es socio de la Asociación de Productores Agrícolas Ramonenses, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Michael A. is a 24 year old man who lives with his wife in the community of San Ramón de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Cartago Province. It is a small rural community. The residents engage in milk production and farming, primarily growing coffee and bananas. They also dedicate much of their time to raising pigs. The area consists of hilly terrain and much of the land is maintained as a tropical rain forest.

Don Michael has been growing papaya for two years. He says he has sufficient experience in caring for and maintaining this type of crop. Michael has a small plot of land where he grows papaya. His previous crops resulted in good sales, so he wants to expand his farm. Thanks to this business, the quality of life for his family has improved considerably.

Michael is currently requesting a micro-loan of 605,000 CRC in order to buy fertilizers, seeds, and other needed supplies so that he can plant a hectare of papaya and maintain his land to achieve the best results possible. In the end, he hopes to be rewarded with a very good harvest.

Don Michael is a member of the Ramonenses Association of Agricultural Producers, one of 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his second loan and he hopes to continue growing personally and financially. He is an active participant of the credit organization in his community.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farming supplies

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
el señor Dolores A. R. tiene 56 años de edad esta casado con la señora Maria Azucena Rivas quien es ama de casa y se dedica a cuidar la casa, no tienen dependientes, sus hijos ya estan casados, Dolores y Maria  tienen casa propia y tienen cuartos de alquiler, Dolores tambien se dedica al negocio de transportar personas.
esta solicitando el credito para hacerle de nuevo un cambio de llantas y hacerle un mantenimiento al motor, compra de unas piezas que estan malas del vehiculo.
el credito lo utilizara para mejorar su unidad y asi darle un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
This borrower has taken out one or more previous loan(s) with Prisma Honduras, some of which may have fundraised on Kiva.  At the time the information for this loan profile was compiled, the borrower was also interviewed and photographed for the journal update from the previous loan, so you may notice that the picture is the same.
texts.en:
Mr. Dolores A. R., 56, is married to María Azucena Rivas who is a housewife and cares for the home; they have no dependents, their children are already married. Dolores and María own their own home and have rooms that they rent out; Dolores also provides passenger transportation services. He is requesting funds to replace the tires and for engine maintenance; he needs to buy some replacement parts for damaged parts of the vehicle. He will use the funds to improve his vehicle thereby providing better customer service. This borrower has taken out one or more previous loan(s) with Prisma Honduras, some of which may have fundraised on Kiva. At the time the information for this loan profile was compiled, the borrower was also interviewed and photographed for the journal update from the previous loan, so you may notice that the picture is the same.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires and vehicle replacement parts.

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Hue T. T. was born in 1976 and lives in Ha Lam village. She is married with two children who are still young. Her husband is a builder and her family has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 VND.

Hue T. T. not only grows rice but also raises pigs, currently five. She has participated in SEDA since 2009 and has repaid punctually. For this loan, she wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.use: To buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase beer to supply her business, and to make improvements to the location where she tends to her customers.

loans.name: God Is Great Group

texts.en:
Garmai K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God Is Great. She is 28 years old, married and has two children, age 12 and 5. She also cares for one sibling. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support. 

For four years, she has been selling rice in Congo Town Community on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more bags of rice.

She describes herself as a person with great determination. Her goal is to improve her business and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice

loans.name: Chyrill

texts.en: Chyrill A. is from the village of Brgy. Dadap, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 31 years old. Chyrill is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Chyrill raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Chyrill has been engaged in her business for more than seven years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) when she sells a raised pig. In 2010, Chyrill joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chyrill is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by Chyrill from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Damaris Marbeli

texts.es: La señora Damaris Marbeli R. T., tiene la edad de 41 años viven en el Barrio Buenos Aires, de estado civil casada y tanto su  esposo como ella laboran como maestros y con sus ingresos le apoya a los gastos del hogar, tienen 3 hijos los cuales son mayores de edad e independientes, y ayudan económicamente a sus padres en los gastos en que se incurre mensualmente, habitan en un hogar humilde y por el cual solicitan un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción con el objetivo de realizar algunas mejoras a su vivienda, ayudándoles a convivir en un espacio más digno, cómodo, amplio y seguro donde morar y brindándole la satisfacción a  los padres de ofrecerles a sus nietos un mejor espacio donde crecer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Damaris Marbeli R. T. is 41 years old. She lives in the Buenos Aires neighborhood. She is married and she and her husband work as teachers and with their incomes pay their household expenses. They have 3 children who are adult and independent. They help their parents financially with the monthly expenses. They live in a humble home and that it why they are asking for a loan to buy construction materials with the objective of improving their home. It will help them to live in a more worthy, comfortable, spacious, and safe place, giving them a better space for their grandchildren to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To remodel their home

loans.name: Kassim

texts.en:
Kassim is married and has four children who go to school. He established a soft drinks shop in 1990. Kissim also sells, alongside the drinks, articles such as soap, salt, sugar, milk, etc. His shop is located in the Rogbaneh market in Makeni. Kassim established this shop with the aim of getting enough income to support his family.

Kassim has a very good loan repayment history. He needs a loan of 4,000,000 SLL to help him buy more drinks and other articles such as sugar, milk, toothpaste, etc., from Guinea. He intends to use the proceeds from this loan to educate his children to university level and build a house for his family. He thanks you for supporting him.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for his shop

loans.name: Lesvia María

texts.es: La Sra. Lesvia María T. C. ella es Trabajadora del Hotel Barceló Monte limar desempeñándose como ama de llaves tiene  seis años de trabajar para esta empresa, es casada actualmente. Ha tenido  cinco créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo  ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción y  mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales los créditos con Ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Lesvia María T. C. works for the Barceló Hotel in Montelimar, as a housekeeping supervisor. She has worked for this company for six years. She is currently married. She has had five loans with CEPRODEL, and she has used all of them to buy construction materials and improve the house where she lives. The loans from CEPRODEL have benefited her greatly, since they have allowed her to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sand, cement, stone and stone blocks

loans.name: Batjargal

texts.en: Batjargal C., who is 44 years old, lives with his wife and two children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Huvsgul province of Mongolia.   His oldest daughter is a student and his youngest son attends a local secondary school. His wife operates a grocery business, selling a variety of food products at her pavilion in a local market. Batjargal operates a taxi service in his town, an enterprise he began in 2002, and has gained many years of experience.  A very modest, open-minded and hardworking person, he is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to improve the car that he uses as a taxi.

loans.use: To improve his car

loans.name: Lê

texts.en:
T. Lê Thị (20209010006), a 53-year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh, is married and has four grown children. To making a living, T. owns and operates a business venture selling rice products in the local community. Engaged in this business for over 12 years, she earns approximately 3.500.000 VND a month.

In 2008, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 6.048.000 VND from SEDA that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting a new loan of 8.288.000 VND to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be T.'s fourth loan from SEDA, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. T. Lê Thị (20209010006) là 53 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 4 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành. Để kiếm sống, T. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ gạo trong cộng đồng địa phương. T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 12 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND một tháng. Vào 2008, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. T. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua các thành phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán. Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. T. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn T. nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có T. nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. .

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Jowena

texts.en:
Jowena A. is from the village of Jampason, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 29 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Jowena owns & operates a business selling homemade honey products in the local community. Jowena has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jowena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Jovencia

texts.en:
Jovencia D. is a 52-year-old widow who supports her family by operating one business venture: buying & selling Ready to Wear clothing. She lives in Prk. Pag-asa, Brgy. 1, Roxas, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her Ready to Wear business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 40,000.
