Jovencia is now borrowing PHP 26,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP23,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. 

Jovencia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Maribelle

texts.en:
Maribelle D. is 31 years old and married. She supports her family by operating 2 business ventures: a sari-sari (general) store and a tricycle operator business. She lives in Purok Maabi-abihon, Brgy Balintawak, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her sari-sari (general) store and tricycle operator businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6000. Maribelle is now borrowing PHP 20,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 8th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 18000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Maribelle aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more product to sell.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 50 years old, married and the mother of four children between 20 and 10 years old. She has been in mixed farming for 10 years producing and selling her eggs, vegetables and milk to the local market.

Nelly has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry. This is her second loan of a similar amount.She believes this loan can enable her to become the main supplier of eggs and chicken to the local market and generate an income that will make the family stable financially. She is planning to be running a poultry farm of 500 chicken in five years.

Poultry diseases are her greatest business threat.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.es:
La señora M. Fidelia A. V.D.,  tiene 56  años D. edad, viven en la comunidad D. callejas D. la  provincia D. mizque del departamento D. cochabamba,   tiene cinco  hijos, el esposo D. la señora falleció muy joven a causa D. una enfermedad, la señora tuvo que trabajar sola para hacer estudiar y darles D. comer a sus hijos,  ahora la mayoría D. sus hijos son mayores y  casados y solo una es dependiente D. ella. 

Esta época por el desastre natural D. la sequía que hubo en toda la zona  su pequeña parcela D. cebolla no maduro bien, este desastre le hizo fracasar en sus ingresos económicos que ella esperaba. 

La señora M. Fidelia A. V.D.  es una persona  muy querida y respetada en el lugar donD. vive, por lo dedicada a sus hijos  y su trabajo que a veces hasta tiene que trabajar en jornal en la agricultura para ganar algunos pesos y así mantenerse, ella está solicitando el crédito para comprar abonos orgánicos para sus cultivos para aumentar su producción y mejorar sus ingreso económico y  darle una mejor calidad D. vida a su hijo y pueda asistir al colegio  en mejores condiciones.  El crédito ayudara mucho a su hijo y a ella en el duro trabajo que realiza.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fidelia A. Vda. D. Montaño, 56, lives in the community of Callejas, Mizque province, Cochabamba department.  She has five children.  Her husband died very young due to an illness and she had to work alone to proviD. food and education for her children.  Now, most of them are married adults and only one is still dependent on her.

Because of the natural disaster that the drought was throughout the zone, her small onion crop did not mature properly.  This disaster led to complete failure of her expected income.

Fidelia is a very respected and esteemed person where she lives because of her dedication to her children and her work; sometimes she even had to work as an agricultural day laborer to earn a few pesos to support herself.

She is asking for this loan to buy organic manure for her crops to increase production and improve income to proviD. a better quality of life for her son so that he can go to school in better conditions.  The loan will help her son and her with the hard work she does.

loans.use: To buy organic manure.

loans.name: Marcosa

texts.en:
Marcosa C. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Jolomaynon, Dalaguete, Cebu. She earns her living by vegetable farming. Her husband Theodoro, who is 43 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children who are 15 to 25 years old. Marcosa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 7 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marcosa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 22,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 16,000 PHP, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 8th cycle loan, she is borrowing 23,000 PHP, which she intends to use as additional working capital for the vegetable farm so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Marcosa C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the operations of the vegetable farm

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 47-year-old father of three daughters and one son. His daughters are 20, 19, and 16, while his son is 21. Omar has a store in the city of Gaza in Gaza Strip, and he wants to start selling clothes, which will secure the family a good income.

Omar took out a $2,000 loan from FATEN to purchase the needed clothes and start selling them in his store. Omar's son Mahmoud will help him running the store.

Omar appears in the picture here in FATEN's office.

loans.use: To purchase children's clothes to sell in the store

loans.name: Herlinton Manuel

texts.es: Herlinton Manuel tiene 25 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de transporte. Hace más de 2 años que tiene este negocio, el se levanta temprano todos los días desde las 5 de la mañana pues realiza viajes a las diferentes rutas que tienen destino en Managua, Chinandega, Corinto entre otros departamentos Herlinton ha desempeñado un buen trabajo ya que la mayoría de sus clientes están conforme con sus servicios. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de llantas, repuestos entre otros.
texts.en: Herlinton Manuel is 25 years old and his activity is providing transportation services. He has had his business for more than 2 years. He gets up early every day at 5 in the morning to start making trips on the different routes he has to Managua, Chinandega, Corita and other departments. Herlinton has done a good job and most of his clients are satisfied with his services. The reason for his loan is to buy tires, replacement parts, etc.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Shamin

texts.en: Shamin is currently in a business of selling tea. She is 40 years old, a widow, and has 1 child who goes to school. Shamin borrowed a loan to stock more tea to sell. Shamin hopes to build a house with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: To stock more tea to sell.

loans.name: Hotambek

texts.ru: Юсупов Хотамбек проживает в районе Вахш. Возраст, 26 лет. Женат, детей не имеет. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам он занимается животноводством. Разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Уже год как занимается этим видом деятельности. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en: Homatbek Y. lives in Vakhsh district. He is 26. He and his wife do not have children. She is a homemaker. Homatbek raises livestock to sell for a living. He has been in this line of business for one year. Homatbek has applied for a loan to purchase more livestock to increase the size of his herd.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis de 38 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, se dedica a  la venta de refrescos y cosméticos variados, tiene 10 años de estar en el negocio, vive con su esposa y sus hijos.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos y abastecer los dos negocios, adquiriendo para hacer los refrescos y una variedad de cosméticos, su compromiso como vendedor es ofrecer a los clientes buenos productos, con bajos precios y actualizados en la moda, por lo que este préstamo será un gran apoyo para enriquecer su inventario.
Aspira ampliar sus negocios, aumentar sus ventas y mejorar  los ingresos económicos para su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is 38 years old and resides in Jiquilisco in the Department of Usulután. He sells soft drinks and various cosmetics. Luis has been in business for ten years. He lives with his wife and children.

Luis is requesting a loan to purchase products, including soft drinks and a variety of cosmetics, so that he can restock his two businesses. His commitment as a merchant is to offer his customers good products at low prices and in a timely fashion. This loan will be a great help in enhancing his inventory.

He hopes to expand his businesses, increase his sales, and improve the financial earnings for his family.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and soft drinks.

loans.name: Leticia Alexandra

texts.es:
En la parroquia Eloy Alfaro de la ciudad de  Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Mujeres Con Esperanza.  Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y está situado a orillas del Océano Pacifico.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Leticia, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 13 y 10 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es agente vendedor.

Es una mujer muy emprendedora que para tener sus propios ingresos hace un año decidió poner su propio negocio, tiene un pequeño local en la estación de Reinas Del Camino en la ciudad de Manta en el cual vende  desayunos y bocadillos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 4h30 hasta las 8h30. Nos cuenta que a pesar de que lleva poco tiempo ha logrado ganar mucha clientela que le dejan buenos ingresos diarios.

Este crédito es para comprar más productos para preparar los alimentos como leche, pan, huevos, fruta y víveres en general. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brinda la institución a través de los créditos.
 
Sus metas son tener un bazar y una tienda de víveres.
texts.en:
The Banco Comunal Mujeres Con Esperanza meets every two weeks in the parish of Eloy Alfaro in the city of Manta. This city is known for its beautiful beaches. Many domestic and foreign tourists visit these beaches throughout the year. Manta is one of the most important ports in Ecuador and in the Americas. It is located on the Pacific Ocean.

This is where we met Leticia, a 33-year-old married woman. She and her husband have two children together, a 13 year old and a 10 year old. Both children are in school. Her husband works as a salesman.

Leticia is a hardworking woman. One year ago, she decided to start her own business in order to earn her own money. She has a small shop at the Reinas Del Camino resort in the city of Manta where she sells breakfast and sandwiches. She works every day from 4:30 to 8:30. Even though she hasn't been working for very long, she has been able to attract many customers who provide her with a solid daily income.

She will use this loan to buy more products such as milk, bread, eggs, fruit and other groceries, in order to prepare the food. This is her second loan cycle with the Banco Comunal. She is grateful for the loans that she receives from the bank as they have helped her a lot.

Her goal is to one day own a stationary shop and a grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase bread, milk, eggs, fruit and other groceries

loans.name: Gisela

texts.es:
La señora Gisela es comerciante. Su esposo es chofer. El crédito lo necesita para la reparación del sistema de frenos. Esto le ayudara a que su trabajo sea más seguro para  los pasajeros. Es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener  a su familia. 

La señora Gisela es casada, no tiene hijos y vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona de San Martin de la ciudad de La Paz. La cliente esta muy satisfecha con los préstamos que le otorgamos ya que mejoro su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gisela is a merchant, her husband is a driver.  She needs the loan to repair the brakes.  This will help her work be safer for her passengers.  This is her source of income for family support.

Gisela is married but has no children.  She lives in her parents’ house located in La Paz’s San Martin neighborhood.  She is very satisfied with the loans we grant because they improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to service her vehicle.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylvia B. lives in the Kamwokya neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school.

Sylvia has a business selling second-hand shoes. She has been in this business for more than 10 years, and she works six days out of every week. Sylvia    sells her products at the market.

Sylvia has requested  a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand shoes. The main business challenges for Sylvia include transportation and ever-increasing prices fpr shoes.

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a permanent business location and also to sell wholesale. Sylvia  lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and paying utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used shoes

loans.name: Alejandro Ramon

texts.es: Alejandro Ramón tiene 40 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de ganado. Tiene más de 13 años en este negocio, por lo que inicio este medio de vida por la necesidad de sufragar los ingresos diarios de su hogar. El tiene dos hijos menores de edad a su cargo, el es una persona responsable que disfruta de su actividad ya que ha pasado de generación en generación. El motivo de este crédito es para la compra de vacas, chivitos,  toros y más ganado. El sueña con comprar una propiedad para tener más ganado, ya que actualmente no tiene mucho espacio.
texts.en: Alejandro Ramón is 40 years old. He buys and sells cattle. He has been doing this for the past 13 years. He began this business in order to pay for the daily living expenses of his home. He has two young children that are dependent upon him. He is responsible for developing a business that can be passed on from generation to generation. He will use this loan to buy cows, baby goats, bulls and more cattle. His dream is to buy a piece of land where he can have more cattle, as right now he doesn’t have much space.

loans.use: to buy cows, baby goats, bulls and more cattle.

loans.name: Uchi

texts.en:
Uchi is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years she has operated a brooms-selling business. She sells at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is seasonality. During the rainy season it becomes difficult for her to operate. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of brooms for resale. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of brooms for resale.

loans.name: Richard

texts.es:
Richard es un joven que vive en el municipio de Colcaphirua del departamento de Cochabamba, él trabaja como albañil junto a su padre, el hace un año estaba conviviendo y tiene una hijita, pero como el no ganaba mucho como albañil su pareja lo dejo llevándose consigo a su hijita,

Richard siempre a buscado el tratar de superarse por tal motivo  aprendió a confeccionar pantalones y logro comprarse una máquina de coser pero aún le faltan dos, el necesita ese crédito para poderse comprar las máquinas y tener mejores ingresos para poder ofrecerles una mejor vida a su hijita y  pareja,  y así  pedirle que regresen a vivir con él, porque las extraña mucho.
texts.en:
Richard is a young man who lives in the Colcaphirua municipality in the Cochabamba department.  He works with his father as a bricklayer.  He lived with his life partner a year ago, and he has a little daughter.  However, as he did not earn much as a bricklayer, his life partner left and took his daughter with her.

Richard has always looked for a way to prevail.  That is why he learned how to make pants, and he managed to buy a sewing machine.  However, he still needs two.  He needs the loan to be able to buy the machines and to have better income.  Then he will be able to provide a better life for his daughter and life partner.  That way he will ask them to come back and live with him because he misses them so much.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines for his tailoring business.

loans.name: Hermenigilda

texts.en: Hermenigilda is 53 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason. She is married with 9 children. Hermenigilda has worked in the fish industry and sold fish for a living for 30 years. She has requested a loan to purchase different kinds of fish to sell. She has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of fish to sell

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is married with three children between the ages of fourteen and nine years old. He has been a farmer in the Nkubu area of central Kenya for the last eight years. His farm produces bananas, macadamia nuts and coffee which he sells in the local market. The problems he faces are poor markets and bad roads.

John has requested a loan, his second from Juhudi Kilimo, of 70,000 KES. With his loan he will purchase a water tank and irrigation pipes. John says the acquisition of an irrigation system will help him maintain his production even during dry seasons.

John says he is focusing on improving his living standards by building a new house for his family and venturing into the transport business.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank and irrigation pipes.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is a widow. She has three grown children. Valentina runs a small business selling clothing and merchandise in a little store close to the central market in her home town of Melitopol. Valentina has been in this trade for 17 years. She has 40,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her profit amounts to 7,000 Grivnyas a month. Valentina’s business goal is to develop her business further and startup at one more business location.

Valentina is seeking a 8,000 Grivnya loan to purchase assorted merchandise for the current summer season. She is very responsible when it comes to loan repayments. She can be characterized as a hard-working and circumspect individual with clear vision and a determined nature. These personal characteristics help Valentina to succeed in her business endeavors and to repay the current loan without any problems.

loans.use: to purchase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
Ricky is a very young father at the age of 19. He has one child which will surely turn into two children soon. He is worried about how he will provide for the demands of his family. He never dreamed of feeling what his parents experienced just providing for the family's needs and whims. But, because of early marriage, he needs to work in order to support his family. 

Ricky is now a hardworking father who goes into the field and manages his business every day. He cares so much, because this is their main source of income. That's why he is requesting a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos to pay for the cultivation of the land and to purchase fertilizers. This is to embellish and enhance his field into better production. He hopes that ASKI will be of assistance in operating his business, so that he can acquire a higher income to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for the cultivation of the land.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 40 years old, married and has three children. He has been operating a motorbike transport business for over ten years. He was able to start the business with the financial support from Faulu Kenya. He also owns a retail shop which generates extra income for his family. He managed to stop being an employee and to go into business full-time.  
Peter hopes to improve his business and to start a taxi business in the future. He has requested 70,000 Kenya shillings to buy a motorbike and to add stock to his retail shop.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike and to stock his retail shop

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is a married woman with two children who are 21 and 12 years old. She is a farmer working in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She has been growing and selling rice for 10 years. Alona earns about 8,000 PHP per month doing this farming.

Alona has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. Alona hopes for her business to grow. She also wants to be able to sustain her family, especially her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 29 years old and married with 2 children, 1 of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for her family. Janet runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 12,000 from Kiva's partner, NWTF, to purchase more items to sell. Janet has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, sugar, soap and other groceries. Janet would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy items like bread, noodles, snack foods and other groceries for resale

loans.name: Johana Patricia

texts.es: Johana Patricia tiene 38 años, su actividad es la venta de ropa y cosméticos. Hace más de 18 años que tiene experiencia en este medio de vida. La mayoría de sus clientes disfrutan de la buena atención que les brinda a sus clientes. Siempre ha sido una mujer trabajadora y luchadora que disfruta de brindarles a sus clientes lo que ellos le solicitan. Es por este motivo que solicita este crédito para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, ropa interior, cremas, tratamientos, shampoo, entre otros.
texts.en: Johana Patricia is 38 years old, and her business is selling clothing and cosmetics. She has been doing this for over 18 years. The majority of her clients enjoy the close attention she pays to her customers. She has always been a hard-working and tenacious woman who enjoys giving her customers what they ask for. This is her motivation for asking for a loan to buy pants, blouses, skirts, underwear, lotions, beauty treatments, shampoos, and similar items.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, skirts, underwear, lotions, beauty treatments, shampoo, and other items.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Guillermina; ella tiene 48 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, galletas y leches, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar fideos, arroz, azúcar, aceite y galletas.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se  compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Guillermina belongs to the "Kanchary" communal bank located in Cusco district, which is part of the province and department of Cusco.

She is 48, single, and has two children. Along with her daily activities, she has a grocery store. She sells basic household necessities such as rice, sugar, noodles, cookies, and milk. She works from 8:00am to 7:00pm, and through this business, she is helping her children get ahead in life.

She wants to expand the grocery store.  She is applying for the loan to buy noodles, rice, sugar, cooking oil and cookies.  Guillermina is happy to receive the loan and promises to make her instalment payments.

loans.use: To buy noodles, rice, sugar, cooking oil, and cookies for her business.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 41 years old, married   to Samuel, and they have one child who is school-going. She owns a retail shop and sells milk at the same time, for the last three years, and with a monthly profit of KES 10,000.  


She was introduced to KADET LTD by a group of clients registered with KADET LTD, and she is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to buy more milk from farmers to sell.

With the anticipated profits, she will pay school fees for her child. In future she plans to grow her business and  start dairy farming.

loans.use: to buy more milk from farmers to sell.

loans.name: Khanum

texts.en: Khanum is from the village of Erazgavors in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is divorced and has two sons (twenty-five and thirty years old).  Khanum has a high school education and technical training as a sewing specialist.  Because of the limited number of jobs in her specialty, Khanum has been farming for the past five years.  She considers herself a hardworking, honest person.  Khanum would like a loan to purchase two additional cows.  According to her business plan, this investment will increase the family income by twenty-five percent.  With future business profits, Khanum would like to renovate the family home.  She really enjoys living in Erazgavors, especially as her relatives are nearby.

loans.use: to purchase two cows

loans.name: Jessica Maria

texts.es: Jessica es una mujer responsable ella tiene su trabajo que es ser oficinista. El motivo del crédito que solicita es para la compra de materiales de construcción como cemento, baldosas, inodoro, pega entre otros productos. Ella siempre se ha preocupado por brindar a su familia las mejoras necesarias en su vivienda. Sueña con lograr comprar su propia casa, ya que actualmente la casa donde está viviendo es la de su Mama.
texts.en:
Jessica is a responsible woman who has a job as an office worker. 

The purpose of the loan she is asking for is to buy building materials, like cement, floor tiles, a toilet, and glue, among other items. She has always been concerned with providing her family with the necessary improvements for their housing. She dreams of being able to buy her own house, since the house where she is living is actually her mother's.

loans.use: to buy cement, floor tiles, a toilet, and glue, among other items.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en: Eugenie is 36 years old and has seven children aged 1 to 16. Three of the children attend school. She sells foodstuffs in a store she has run for six years. She would like a loan to buy more sorghum, beans, and maize to sell in her store.  Profits will be used to renovate her house. She would like to become a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum, beans, and maize.

loans.name: Siiae

texts.en:
Siiae is a 54-year-old woman living in the town of Samata Uta. She is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Siiae owns and operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Siiae has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 1,000 Samoa Tala (WST) a month from these activities.

In 2010, Siiae joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Siiae has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. Siiae is now requesting a new loan of 1,500 WST, which will be used to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles and threads. This will be the second loan taken out by Siiae from SPBD. Siiae plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

Please note that the dates in the photos taken are wrong because it was a mistake made by our Loan Officers for not resetting the dates and years of the camera. I hope this won't happen again.

loans.use: to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles and threads.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single and has 1 child. 

Jesus has a shop where he sells vegetables like string-beans & eggplants. He has had this business for 3 years. He has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy vegetables to sell.

Jesus is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Jesus hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ana Karina

texts.es:
La Señora. Ana es socia del banco comunal Mi Bankito, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza de su centro histórico el cual cuenta el pasado de esta bella ciudad, esta bañada por 4 ríos los que le dan el nombre de la Santa Ana de los 4 ríos, su gente es amable y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Ana tiene 21 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido una niña de 3 años de edad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Ella labora como auxiliar contable, actividad que la desempeña solo medio día de lunes a viernes y el resto de su tiempo cuida de su hijo. En fechas de temporada se dedica a la venta de peluches esta actividad la realiza hace 2 años.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de peluches.
 
Su meta es tener un local para vender los peluches y aumentar su mercadería.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana is a member of the Communal Bank “Mi Bankito” (My Little Bank). She lives in the city of Cuenca, which is known for the beauty of its historical center. The city is surrounded by four rivers, thus giving it the nickname “Santa Ana of the Four Rivers”. The people are friendly and have maintained the culture and traditions of their ancestors.

Sra. Ana is 21 years old, married, and has a three-year-old daughter. Her husband works as a private employee. They do not own a home, so they live in a rental property.

Ana is an assistant bookkeeper, but she only works half a day Monday through Friday. She spends the rest of the time caring for her child. On special occasions based on the season, she sells plush toys and has been doing this for two years. Ana is receiving her second loan and will invest in the purchase of plush toys.

Her goal is to have a shop where she can sell plush toys and increase her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy plush toys to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 32 years old and married with 2 children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been pig fattening for one year and also earns additional income from frozen products retail.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed for her pigs. Jocelyn is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Samneang

texts.en: Samneang, 26, is married and resides with his wife and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He has been running a business of buying junk materials to sell at the junk shop for over five years and is successful in his career. His wife is employed at the garment factory. Due to low income from his business, Samneang is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a TUK TUK to run a transportation service to generate income. By doing so, his family economic circumstances will be better developed because running TUK TUK can make more profit. In the future, he would like to build a new house and support his children to study until they get a Bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase a TUK TUK to run a transportation service to generate income.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, Julia has operated a clothing sales business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Julia's major challenge is delayed payments by creditors. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

Julia plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Mrs. Juliet O. is a 36 year old woman with five (5) children. She learnt her trade within one year and she finally opened her own business in the year 2002. She resides in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She needs the above loan for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more food items for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She would like to buy 40 local laying chickens

loans.name: Cristina Ana

texts.en:
Cristina is single, 20 years old and along with her mother, works raising pigs. These women are the pillars of their home as the father abandoned them when cristina was still small. They support their home and the education of her three younger brothers. They raise the pigs, and sell them, they also slaughter them and sell their meet in the neighborhood. The loan will be used to purchase food for the animales as they already have around twenty pigs and their care is expensive. She is a member of the group De P. 2.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

CRISTINA ES SOLTERA, TIENE 20 AÑOS. JUNTO CON SU MAMA SE DEDICAN A LA CRIANZA DE PUERCOS, ELLAS SON EL PILAR DE SU HOGAR YA QUE EL PADRE DE FAMILIA LOS ABANDONO CUANDO CRISTINA ERA PEQUEÑA, ELLAS SOSTIENEN EL HOGAR Y EL ESTUDIO DE SUS TRES HERMANITOS. ELLAS CRIAN LOS PUERQUITOS Y LOS VENDEN , TAMBIEN LOS MATAN Y VENDEN LA CARNE EN SU LOCALIDAD. EL PRESTAMO LO INVERTIRAN EN COMPRA DE ALIMENTO PARA ESTOS ANIMALES, YA QUE TIENE APROXIMADAMENTE VEINTE PUERQUITOS EL COSTO DE SU ALIMENTACION ES MUY CARA. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO DE P. 2.

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia P. Y., 36, is a member of a group of women who make and sell traditional handicrafts, including weaving and jewelry. They make the goods in their homes near Sololá and then periodically take the two-hour bus ride to Quetzaltenango to sell to foreigners in the Spanish language schools there. They also give weaving classes in the schools and keep a small consignment operation stocked.

Julia speaks Cakchiquel as her first language, but also speaks Spanish. She is a leader in her community, organizing the women and seeking out effective financing. Her women's group, the "Mujeres Analizadoras", used to get its credit from another organization, but they have switched to Friendship Bridge because they can get a better interest rate. They’re currently in their first loan cycle with Friendship Bridge and will use the credit to buy materials for their work.

A typical item such as a high-quality woven sofa pillowcase that Julia makes will take about 15 days and will bring about 300 Quetzales, or US$40. It’s currently the high season for their sales, because the language students are currently in the schools, so the women are working many hours per day to make their products.

Unlike many of the women in Guatemala, Julia has fifteen years of education, and completed her full high school degree. Over the long term she wants to try to develop new markets, including possible foreign markets, for their handicrafts.

The women are hoping to be able eventually to pool their purchases of thread so they can get a better price with collaborative buying.

loans.use: Buy materials for  weaving and embroidery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more shoes and handbags to sell.

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina started her own small grocery business about a year ago in the village of Teisariv near Stryi, Ukraine. She operates her store from a building on property she and her husband, Andrei, own. Prior to becoming an entrepreneur, Galina worked as a cashier in another store, gaining valuable experience for being out on her own. Her business has done quite well thus far. She maintains about $1500 worth of inventory on hand sells around $3000 worth of groceries in a typical month.

Galina has requested a loan of $700 to make some improvements to her store. She’d like to purchase some shelving material and buy a scale to use for weighing food items. These investments will help Galina as she continues to develop and expand her business. She hopes to use her profits to pay off some bills as well as help her daughter with her college tuition. In the future, she would also like to do some remodeling to her store so that she can increase her retail space. This is Galina’s fifth loan from Nadiya Ukraine. We are happy for another opportunity to assist her in developing a successful business.

loans.use: Purchase shelving and a scale

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel is 40 years old, has three children and makes a living selling clothing of all brands and colors for males and females, children and adults. Thanks to the support of her family, who lives in the city of Lima, she began selling garments being that her siblings sent them to her for her children as presents. She found an excellent source of income in this opportunity, and her immense wishes of self-improvement led her to also dedicate herself to the sale of motorcycle spare parts thanks to the extensive support and knowledge of her loving husband, Wilson. He has always provided advice and support so that she benefits from each of her initiatives and remains happy. To Maribel nothing is impossible, and for that reason she needs capital in the form of a loan to consolidate her small sales space. Let’s make Maribel’s wish come true. With your collaboration and polite support, she will materialize her goals in a very short time.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maribel de 40 años de edad, tiene tres hijos, se dedica a la venta de ropas de todas las marcas y colores para niños y adultos de ambos sexos, gracias al apoyo de su familia que reside en la ciudad de lima, ella empezó a vender ropas puesto que sus hermanos se las enviaban para sus pequeños a manera de obsequios.Ella encontró en esta oportunidad una excelente fuente de ingreso económico y sus inmensos deseos de superación la llevaron también a dedicarse a la venta de repuestos para motocicletas gracias al inmenso apoyo y conocimientos de su querido esposo.Wilson, su esposo, siempre le ha otorgado consejos y apoyo a fin de que cada una de sus iniciativas la mantengan contenta y sea provechosa.Para Maribel no existe nada imposible y por esa razón necesita de un capital dde inversión para consolidar sus pequeños espacios de ventas.Hagamos que se cumpla el deseo de Maribel con tu colaboración y tu gentil apoyo podrá concretar en poco tiempo su propósito.

loans.use: Purchase capital to consolidate her small clothing sales business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Mrs. Agnes E., 40 years old lady, married with 5 children lives in Benin City, sells cooked food and drinks, She is soliciting for the loan of $275 to buy more foodstuff and drinks for sale. She learnt the trade for 3 years & started hers in 2001. She is a dedicated LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more Foodstuff for cooking &Drinks for sale

loans.name: Arubaine Cc Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Kasifa N.. She is in the business of charcoal sales and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Kasifa is 22 years old and is married with a husband who owns a retail shop. She has 2 children aged 1 and 2. Each week, Kasifa makes approximately UGX 80000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land. Kasifa has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 150000 in order to invest it in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Kasifa is joined in her group by Fatuma M., Yuwusi A. and Bayan M.. Fatuma M. has a business selling used clothes and wants to increase her stock. Yuwusi A. operates a business in selling used clothing and wants a loan to expand business. Bayan M. operates a business of clothing sales and wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand charcoal business.

loans.name: Kimombasa South A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Zidina N.. She is currently in the business of selling milk and is requesting a loan to add more capital. Zidina is 47 years old and is a widow. She has 4 children ranging from age 4 to 10 and her children go to school. Each week, Zidina makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a cow. Zidina has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Zidina is joined in her small group by Aidah N., Zidah N., Hadijah N., and Stabuwa N.. Aidah N. has a business selling produce and wants to boost business. Zidah N. is currently operating a restaurant business and wants a loan to purchase food warmers. Hadijah N. operates a business of charcoal sales and wants to purchase in bulk. Stabuwa N. is currently in the business of poultry farming and is requesting a loan to purchase poultry feed.

loans.use: To purchase a fridge for pasteurizing milk

loans.name: Milciades

texts.es:
Milciades is 20 years old, single and has no children. This young entrepreneur started work as an assistant in an auto repair shop, where he worked for five years, and learned all that was needed so that he could become self-employed.

Thanks to his dedication and decision-making, he now has his own small business, run from his home, repairing cars and selling spare parts for cars. The business is getting more and more clients and higher stock levels, which highlights the successful management skills of this entrepreneur.

He plans to use this loan to buy spare parts for motorcycles.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Milciades tiene 20 años de edad, soltero y sin hijos, este joven emprendedor comenzó como ayudante en un taller mecánico de vehículos donde trabajo durante cinco años llegando a aprender todo lo necesario para poder independizarse.

Hoy día gracias a su gran empreño y decisión ya tiene su propia micro empresa, “taller de motos y venta de repuestos para motos”, la misma esta ubicada en su propia casa. El negocio que maneja cada vez tiene más clientela y mayor volumen de inventarios, lo que demuestra la exitosa gestión de este emprendedor

El crédito lo utilizara para compra de repuestos para motocicletas.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for motorcycles

loans.name: Lucia's Udugu Group

texts.en:
Lucia is a married woman with 4 children, ages 26, 22, 20 and 16 years old. Lucia sells clothes. She started in 2004. Every day, she works from 8am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Josephina and Aneth, who have sell fish and other food.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Maria Helena

texts.en:
Maria Helena is 45 years old and originally from Moamba District in the Maputo Province. She is divorced and has three sons: two are working in South Africa and one is living with her in the capital city Maputo and has just concluded high school.

Maria Helena was raised by her grandparents. She studied until 7th grade and stopped due to her family’s difficult financial situation. Maria Helena started to work quite young: at 17 years old she got a job at an agriculture company, where she worked for four years. For some years Maria Helena worked at a small stand in the street selling basic needs products to help support her children. In 1999 she started to go to South Africa to buy products to sell in Mozambique. She first started selling cooking oil, but then changed to plastic bags and chicken paws.

The most productive selling period is between April and October. Her monthly profit is around MTn 4,000, and Maria Helena uses this money to support her family, including her younger son’s education. Maria Helena does not have a store, she delivers the merchandise to her clients' houses or stores.

This will be Maria Helena’s second loan with Hluvuku. The first loan of MTn 10,000 was used to buy merchandise in South Africa and Maria Helena paid it back without difficulties. This MTn 16,000 loan will also be used to increase inventory, more specifically to buy plastic bags and chicken paws.

In the future Maria Helena would like to build a small market where she would be able to sell her products and even diversify the products brought from South Africa.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Choun

texts.en: Choun B., 43, lives in Phum Sleng Village, Siem Reap Province, where she is a farmer and pig breeder, earning around $2 per day. Her husband buys oxen from farmers and resells them for profit. They have five children, two of whom are married; two others are in school and one other works with his parents. Mrs. B. wants all of her children to be well-employed.  To that end, she is sending her one daughter to learn to be a tailor and is requesting a loan to pay for her study fees. She hopes her daughter will have a career for life and earn income to help support the family.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's study fees.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura  is 48 years, She is a married woman who takes care of  6 children. She became a snack  seller in 2004. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Zuhura now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Yim P., 35, is married and lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 2004, she has been selling clothes, CD's, VCD's (videocassettes), and soup from her home to earn a living. She is able to make $6 of profit per day. Her husband is employed as a tractor driver. He typically makes $4 a day. Mrs. Yim would like to borrow from Kiva via Credit, the local partner, US$1000 to add to her clothes inventory and purchase more CD's and VCD's. ( Mrs. Yim P. is pictured with her husband inside her house).

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To add to her clothes inventory and purchase more CD's and VCD's.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine E., 50 years old and married with five children, owns a groceries and beef shop selling both provisions and drinks. With an increase in her volume of customers, she wants to increase her stock and is therefore requesting a loan of $600 to buy more beef to sell. Selling more products will help Catherine increase her profit level, the proceeds of which will help in supporting her children's education. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more beef for sale

loans.name: Badriddin

texts.en: Badriddin lives with his elderly parents and he isn’t married yet. He likes livestock very much. He has 2 cows for fattening for his business, which is how he supports his family. He used his money to buy those cows and now needs to buy forage and hay for them to feed them in the winter season. He asks for 4000 somoni for 12 months.

loans.use: Purchasing forage and hay for cattle.

loans.name: Amen

texts.en: Amen is 38 years old and married with 4 children. She has a salon where she sells weaves and other salon materials. She also makes lovely hairstyles for her customers. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more weaves to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase weaves to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
“I did not lose hope even when I am getting older. I still strive to have better opportunities,” Alice said with a positive view about the future, despite the difficulties in their life. 

Alice is already 46 years old and her husband Tomas C. is 47 years old. They have four children, and the eldest is Angelica, who is 22 years old and did not finish her nursing course due to financial problems, and thus preferred working as saleslady in a certain department store in the municipality to assist her parents. Their second child is Jesusa, who is 20 years old and is already a graduating Information Technology student. She is followed by Gemmalyn, who is 18 years old and only graduated high school and is now working in a drugstore in the same municipality. Timothy is the youngest at 5 years old and is already in grade one. Alice is happy that she has understanding and responsible children and she always prays for their good health and that they are able to pursue their goals in life. She is thankful for the family that she has because they help each other and always understand each other.

To request a loan is the simplest way for Alice C. to raise additional capital for their furniture shop in Alinguigan 3rd Ilagan, Isabela. She helps her husband in running their small furniture shop, which is their only source of income. The loan will be used to purchase the needed materials and additional woods like narra and gemilina for furniture making.

According to Alice, just enjoy life even in midst of difficulties for she believes in the saying that says “poverty is not a hindrance to success”.

loans.use: To purchase wood and other materials for the furniture shop

loans.name: Doi Thi

texts.vi: Chị Dương Thị Dõi, 45 tuổi, có 3 con đang đi học. Hiện chị và gia đình đang sống ở huyện Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Năm 2003 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào dệt chiếu và chăn nuôi. Hiện tại ngoài nguồn thu nhập từ chăn nuôi, dệt chiếu gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu từ công việc làm thuê của chồng với tổng thu nhập 2500 000/ tháng.. Vòng vốn tới chị Dõi muốn vay 9000.000 để mua thêm nguyên vật liệu dệt chiếu, gia tăng sản xuất.
texts.en:
Mrs. Doi Thi D. is a 45 years old woman. She is living in Quang Xuong, Thanh Hoa with her three children, who are still going to school. In 2003, she joined the TYM fund and borrowed money to produce sedge mat and breed animals. Now, income from those businesses reaches 2,500,000 VND per month. Mrs. D. plans to make the next loan of 9,000,000 VND to buy raw material and food for the animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy material to produce sedge mat and food for the animals

loans.name: Augustus

texts.en: Augustus T. is fifty-one years old. He is divorced with three children. Two of his children are working and the last child is currently at the university. Augustus is a dealer in building materials such as cement, nails, roofing sheets, etc. at Madina market. He buys his supplies from importers at Accra Central, at wholesale prices, and sells to his customers at retail prices. He is requesting the loan to enable him to procure increased amounts of goods to accelerate his business. With the loan, he hopes to increase his savings to expand his shop. He would be very grateful for your support. He belongs to the community group called Miracle Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To procure building materials

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es: El señor Carlos C., habita en los altos de Masaya, junto a su esposa y hijos, la esposa es comerciante en el mercado de Masaya desde hace cinco años, para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace veinte años, la mayor dificultad que ha tenido es la falta de financiamiento, inicio con sus propios esfuerzos a establecer cultivos. Don C. en futuro quiere comprar más terreno para poder tener mejores ingresos y poder darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia. Con esta solicitud va invertir en la compra de fertilizante para mejorar el cultivo y obtener una mejor producción
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos C. lives in the highlands of Masaya together with his wife and children. His wife has been a trader in the market of Masaya for five years. To support her with household expenses, he has dedicated himself to agriculture for twenty years. The biggest difficulty he has had is the lack of financing; he began with his own efforts to grow crops. Mr. C. wants to buy more land in the future in order to have better income and to give a better life to his family. With this loan request he will invest in the purchase of fertilizer to improve the crops and have better yield.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers and poisons to improve yield

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Mrs. M. is a resident of Barangay Napilan, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old, married and blessed with six children. Two of her children are studying in college and high school. She has a Sari-Sari Store and started it during her first cycle of loans. She sells to neighboring barangays, or towns.

She is requesting Php14,500 (US$325) to buy additional inventory. Her business helps in supporting her family's daily needs and by sending her children to school.

She is thankful to Paglaum for helping them in their capital needs. Her hope and aspiration for the business is to become a mini-grocery someday. She’s also hoping that, with the help of her business, she can send her children to school and have a better standard of living for the family.

loans.use: Purchase additional items for sari-sari store

loans.name: Lepopea

texts.en:
Lepopea T., 28, is married with no children. She has two years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and to the public two days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (approximately 120 USD).

Lepopea has no previous loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are Lepopea’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy a garden spray and pesticides and also tools used for planting

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es: Cirila tiene 30 años, vive en su casa propia con sus tres hijos, los cuales son el motor de su vida y por quienes trabaja arduamente. Ella es natural de la ciudad del Cuzco, vino a la ciudad de Lima en busca de un mejor porvenir, trabajando en una diversidad de oficios, dedicándose actualmente a la venta de pollo frito con papas, platillo que vende a partir de las 5 de la tarde hasta las 9 o 10 de la noche en un mercado cercano a su casa. Este oficio le resulta muy rentable, ya que tiene una buena clientela, la cual concurre asiduamente a su pequeño puesto, pero aunque parezca fácil no lo es, ya que el preparado de este platillo le demanda su buena cantidad de tiempo para dejarlo apetecible. Cirila espera que con su esfuerzo e inversión en su negocio, éste salga adelante, para en un futuro cercano pueda tener un restaurante, y así brindarles a sus hijos mejores, oportunidades de educación y progreso. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero que solicita comprará un carrito sanguchero con el cual podrá realizar su trabajo con mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Cirila is 30 years old, she lives in her own house with her three childrn who are the motor of her life and for whom she works arduously. She is from the town of Cuzco, and moved to the town of Lima in search of opportunities. She has had different occupations and at the present she is selling fried chicken with potatoes from 5 pm to 9 or 10 pm at a market close to her house. This job is going well as she has many clients who visit her small stand regularly, but even if is seems easy it is not, as it takes time to prepare this dish in order to make it tasty. Cirila hopes that with her effort and investment the business will get ahead so she can have a restaurant in the near future and thus offer better educational opportunities and progress to her children. This is her first loan with MFP and with the money she will buy a mobile food stand to be able to carry out her work more comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mobile food stand.

loans.name: Femmes Commercantes 3 Group

texts.fr: Les 5 femmes membres du groupe sont unies par le bon voisinage depuis longtemps. Elles sont dans un groupe fédéral de toutes les femmes de la commune de Thiès. C'est le groupement qui a été subdivisé en groupe de 5 pour faciliter la gestion. Les groupes sont créés par affinité par les femmes elles-mêmes. Elles mènent diverses activités génératrices de revenus et soutiennent leurs maris dans la prise en charges de leur famille respective. Le groupe s'autofinançait par une tontine interne mais avec le crédit de l'IMCEC il trouve des moyens plus importants et un délai court pour le financement de leurs activités. La plupart d’entre elles ont des étalages au marché central de Thiès commune ou elles vendent légumes, poisson, bijoux, tissus, etc.
texts.en:
The five women of this group have been good neighbors for a long time. They are in a federation of all the women of the town of Thies. This larger group has been subdivided into groups of 5 to facilitate management.

The groups were created based on the affinity of the women themselves. They are engaged in various money-earning activities and help their husbands support their respective families. The group is auto-financed through an internal dues system, but with the loans from IMCEC, they can obtain larger sums and get financing for their businesses with only a brief delay. Most of the women have stands in the central market of the town of Thies where they sell vegetables, fish, jewelry, cloth, etc.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of local produce in the weekly rural markets and fishing zones for resale in the town

loans.name: Criscel

texts.en:
Criscel U., 28 years old and married, lives in the village of Gata, Jimenez, Misamis Occidnetal, where she owns and operates a general store. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products to the local community. Criscel is just starting this business.

In 2007, Criscel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 12,000.00 PHP that was used as working capital and to purchase additional inventory, she is now requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to be used for the same purposes. This will be Criscel’s third loan PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital.

location.town: Tudela-Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Mind

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is fifty-five years old. She is divorced and has given birth to one child, a son, who is currently in the polytechnic. She lives with her son in a rented apartment in a commercial town, called Dwenase, in the Western Region of Ghana. She is a trader. She trades in utensils. She buys her goods (sets of utensils) from Kumasi, at affordable prices, and sells at the market square in her community. Mary also deals in textiles. She hawks and treks to other markets to sell as well. Mary has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and to give her son all the necessary support.

loans.use: To buy utensils.

loans.name: Okeke

texts.en: N. sells food, drinks and groceries. She has been in this business for the past 10 years. N. is 38 years old and married, and has 3 children. N. lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is requesting a loan of N60,000 to purchase more food and drinks to sell. She thanks Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more food and drinks to sell

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita B. is from the village of Sibula. She is 40 years old. Perlita is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Perlita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Perlita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Perlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. Perlita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Perlita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase mineral food and chemical medicine for her cattle.

loans.name: Wakado Okumu Santa Group

texts.en: O. Santa is forty-nine years old and married with ten children, four of whom are going to school. She is looking after four additional dependents who are also in school. She runs a grocery business dealing especially with fish, cassava flour, maize flour and so forth. She is using the loan to resupply her inventory. She is hoping that this loan will result in a big change in her business and in her lifestyle as well. She is a hardworking businesswoman who is representing her group. O. Santa's dream is to prosper in life and to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy fish, cassava flour, maize flour and so on to sell.

loans.name: Quingeo (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Quingeo esta formado por un grupo de 6 socias y un socio que buscan la superación personal  y su bienestar familiar.  Quingeo es un parroquia que se encuentra a una  hora y media a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca,  es un lugar con un paisaje muy hermoso, su vegetación es exuberante, tiene una flora y fauna envidiable, las fiestas más conocidas son las de carnaval por la variedad de actos que realizan como por ejemplo la reina del capulí y muchos más, es uno de los hermosos lugares que tiene la Ciudad de Cuenca.

 De los integrantes  del banco comunal Quingeo todos han migrado de su terruño hacia la ciudad en busca de mejores días para su familia y nos brindan sus historias.

La señora  Manuela  Q. V. es oriunda de la parroquia Quingeo, es socia del banco comunal del  mismo nombre,  migro hace dos años a la ciudad de Cuenca en busca de  un mejor futuro para su familia, vive en el sector de la feria libre,  Manuela tiene 49 años de edad es casada tiene 8 hijos,  de los hijos  mayores no recuerda sus edades pero nos indica que  se encuentran casados y cada uno vive con su familia, aún tiene dos hijos pequeños de 9 y 6 años de edad, ellos viven en la casa que tienen en Quingeo al  cuidado de una hermana mayor, mientras que en la ciudad viven  arrendando con su esposo, él trabaja en un pequeño kiosco que es de su propiedad y le ayuda en los gastos del hogar.

 Manuela vende verduras en el mercado de la feria libre hace dos años, le va muy bien, y mucho más en los días de feria miércoles, sábados y domingos, le entregan la verdura y la revende recorriendo  todo el mercado, está feliz  porque el municipio de Cuenca esta por entregarles un puesto para que trabajen dentro del mercado y no deambulando por ahí.

Este  es su primer crédito y una amiga le integro al grupo para que también se supere económicamente, el préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le entrega lo va ha invertir en la compra del puesto ya que le hace falta y también en comprar más verduras para su negocio

Su meta es de llegar a cultivar todas sus tierras por que por el momento están  abandonadas para abastecer en algo su puesto de verduras en el mercado.

La señora Rosario Del Cisne B.  es otra  socia del banco comunal Quingeo, migro hace 18 años de su pueblo natal Quingeo a la ciudad de Cuenca radicándose en ella, Rosario tiene 31 años de edad, hace poco tiempo contrajo nupcias pero viven juntos ya doce años, fruto de su amor procreo 3 hijos de 9, 7, 2 años de edad, no tienen casa propia y viven arrendando, su esposo es albañil, se apoyan mutuamente, cuando su esposo no encuentra trabajo le ayuda en el negocio.

Rosario se dedica a la venta de verduras, granos, cebolla, etc.  en el mercado de la feria libre. Es comerciante desde que tiene uso de razón, nos cuenta que le va bien gracias a Dios y los días que más vende son los sábados y domingos, pero todos los días sale a vender recorriendo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde y los días feriados sale a vender desde las 4 de la mañana para poder ocupar un puesto en el mercado.

Es su primer crédito, una compañera la invito a ser parte del Bankito y el dinero que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le entrega es para invertir en la compra de su puesto propio en el mercado y también para comprar más granos y ampliar su negocio.

Su sueño es  ahorrar para comprar un carro o un terreno. 

La señora Carmen Rosa D. M. es socia del banco comunal Quingeo, vive por el camino viejo a Baños en la zona urbana de Cuenca. Carmen tiene 22 años de edad, vive en unión libre tiene una niña de 3 años  y se encuentra embarazada de 8 meses y aun no sabe el sexo del hijo que espera,  no tienen casa propia y viven arrendando, tienen una buena relación con su cónyuge, su esposo trabaja en la colocación de estructuras metálicas y se ayudan económicamente para solventar los gastos de su hogar.

Carmen trabaja como camarera en un restaurante por el sector de la feria libre, ya lleva 4 años en esta actividad y le va muy bien por que sus jefes son muy buenos y le tienen un cariño especial acota.

Es su primer préstamo en la fundación, una amiga la invito para que se parte del banco y acceda a los beneficios que la institución  entrega a sus socias.

El préstamo que la fundación le entrega es para cubrir los gastos de su alumbramiento, y su sueño es de llegar a tener su propio  restaurante.
texts.en:
Quingeo Communal Bank is comprised of 6 members as well as member who is using the loan for for personal growth and family health. Quingeo is a parish located an hour and a half outside the Cuenca city, a location with beautiful landscape, lush vegetation, and enviable flora and fauna. Quingeo's most well-known festivals include Carnaval, because of its various events including the Capulí Queen's event and many more. It is one of the most beautiful areas outside of Cuenca city. All of the members of Quingeo Communal Bank migrated to their current location from the city, in search of better days for their families. Manuela Q. V. is a Quingeo parish native, and she is a member of the Communal Bank of the same name. She migrated to the area from Cuenca city two years ago to find a better future for her family. She lives in the open market sector. Manuela is 49 years old, she is married, and has 8 children. She does not remember the ages of her two oldest children, but they are both married and live with their respective families. She also has two young children, 9 and 6 years old, who live with her at home in Quingeo and their older sister takes care of them. The children also live in a rented home with Manuela's husband in the city, because he works in a small kiosk that he owns and with which he helps pay for the expenses they have at home. Manuela has been selling vegetables in the open market for two years now and it has gone very well, especially on Wednesdays, Saturdays, and Sundays when she gets her vegetable deliveries and resells them all around the market. She is happy because Cuenca municipality has helped her obtain a post inside the market so she can work from one place and she no longer has to walk around anymore. This is her first loan and one of her friends introduced her to the group because she too had improved her economic situation through a loan. This loan that FUNDACION ESPOIR is giving Manuela will be invested in the purchase of her market stall and everything else her new stall needs, as well as toward the purchasing of more vegetables for her business. Her goal is to eventually cultivate all of land, because at the moment it has been neglected while she builds up her vegetable stall in the market. Rosario Del Cisne B. is another member of Quingeo Communal Bank, and she migrated from her native Quingeo parish to settle in Cuenca city 18 years ago. Rosario is 31 years old and recently married, but she has been living with her partner for over 12 years now and they have three children who are 9, 7, and 2 years old. They do not have their own home yet so they rent, and her husband is a bricklayer. They each help their family, and when her husband cannot find work, he helps her with her business. Rosario sells vegetables, grains, onions, and more in the open market. She has been selling goods since she was young, and she thanks God that her business has done well. She sells the most on Saturdays and Sundays, but regardless, every day she sells from 6am to 6pm, and days when she does traveling sales to markets farther away, she leaves at 4am so that she can claim a stall in those markets. This is Rosario's first loan, and a friend invited her to be part of the group. With the money FUNDACION ESPOIR is giving her, she will invest in the purchase of her own permanent stall in the market as well as buying more grain and growing her business. Her dream is to save enough money to buy her own car or plot of land. Carmen Rosa D. M. is also a member of Quingeo Communal Bank, and she lives on an old street called Baños in the urban area of Cuenca. Carmen is 22 years old, she lives with her partner, and they have one daughter who is 3 years old. She is currently 8 months pregnant with their second child, but they do not yet know the sex yet. She does not have her own home, so she rents. She has a great relationship with her spouse, who works with scrap metal and helps her pay for all of their household expenses. Carmen works as a server in a restaurant inside the open market; she has been doing this for four years, and it has gone very well for her because she has great bosses who have special affection for her. This is her first loan with FUNDACION ESPOIR; a friend recently invited her to become part of the group and enjoy the benefits that the institution gives their members. The loan that FUNDACION ESPOIR is giving Carmen is going to be used to cover her birth-related expenses, and her dream is to eventually own her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Suzy Marinkovich, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a stall in the market and acquire products needed to grow their businesses

loans.name: Gabriel Alexander

texts.es: Gabriel Alexander F. R. reside en el departamento de Sonsonate. Gabriel tiene 26 años de edad, vive junto a su madre y hermano de 19 años que se encuentra estudiando. Gabriel es un hijo ejemplar, cuida de su madre con su hermano, ambos son el apoyo y sostén de ella, el negocio de Gabriel fue herencia de su padre quien ya ha fallecido, es un taller de estructuras metálicas, el cual ahora está a cargo de Gabriel, el crédito que solcita es para invertir en herramientas y materiales.

loans.use: Compra de materiales para su negocio

loans.name: Francis' Group

texts.en: Tinkagirize Francis, the leader of his lending group in Bushenyi, is a 46-year-old married father of six children, all in secondary and primary schools. Francis, a hard-working and friendly man, has been operating both a bee-keeping and a farming business for 10 years.  Although he likes what he does, he is affected by the expensive materials used in bee-keeping as well as the limited market for the honey made from it. He is now requesting a loan to help buy a piece of land that he will use to increase his farming output. His goal is to spread his business ideas to other parts of the district since he has been helped by the National Agricultural Advisory Services (NAADS). He also hopes to educate his children to the university level.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land for farming.

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.en:
Jaqueline M. is 31 years old and is married with three children aged 1, 4 and 7. Jaqueline and her family live in Rwaza district in the Northern Province of Rwanda.

Jaqueline has a small shop selling a wide variety of products, such as: rice, sugar, biscuits, water, cooking oil, juice, cosmetics products, candy and bread, to name a few. Since she has been in business since 2006, this is her third year of successful operation. The hours of her shop are from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. every day.

Jaqueline is requesting her fourth loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders in order to expand her business through purchasing some other attractive products. This will help her to serve more customers and, hopefully, earn more profit in the process. Also, the shop inventory purchasing requires credit and capital which these loans have provided her.

It is worth noting that Jaqueline has paid back all previous loans on time and in full. The loans are allowing her to grow her business slowly and put aside money so that she will be able to pay school fees for her children as they grow older.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Melonie

texts.en:
Melonie gives her best to become a responsible mother to her three children. She strives hard to reach her goal, when it comes to business.  She sells vegetables, fruits, and other foods with the use of her motorcycle. She goes to different villages to sell. Her daily net income is PHP 200, but her income is not sufficient to maintain her business. She is requesting a loan, in the amount of PHP 10,000, to purchase more commodities to sell. 
She was married to Francisco, but their marriage lasted for only eight years. They were blessed with three children: Melody, 14, second year high school; Angelica, 12, grade six level, and Francesca, eight years old, grade three level. She lives, with her children at the village of Ramona, Angadanan, Isabela. Melonie says that she can raise her children alone and face any trial that comes to her life.

loans.use: To purchase more commodities to sell.

loans.name: Suhbaatar

texts.en:
B. Sukhbaatar is 42 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters in Khovd province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. His two older daughters currently attend a local secondary school and his youngest is too young to go to school. 

Sukhbaatar operates a meat and livestock trading business at the local town market with the help of his wife. He started his business in 1997 and has built a successful operation over the years. His business has provided financial security for his family and has enabled him to purchase a car. Sukhbaatar hopes to continue his success in the future and grow his business further. He is requesting a 1,800,000 tugrugs (~1266 USD) loan to purchase meat to sell in his business.
