About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All&sectors[]=All&regions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: to purchase meat

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr: Résidente du quartier d’adidogomé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé, cette femme est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Pour aider son époux dans les charges de la famille, elle a   entamée la vente en détail des ustensiles de cuisine. Elle s’approvisionne en marchandises en Europe. Elle voudrait gonfler son stock pour augmenter son chiffre d’affaire raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 30 plats, 10 couteaux de cuisine, 25 cuillères, 25 fourchettes, 10 tasses et divers autres ustensiles.
texts.en:
Resident of the Adidogomé district, a suburb of the city of Lomé, this woman is married and the mother of 4 children. In order to help her husband with the household expenses, she began selling kitchen utensils. She buys her goods in Europe. She wishes to increase her stocks and for that reason she is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase 30 serving platters, 10 kitchen knives, 25 spoons, 25 forks, 10 cups and various other utensils.

Translated from French by caroline Mrejen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Retail of kitchen utensils

loans.name: Mrs. Ouen Chea Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ouen C. is a group leader of five group members who all live in Preak Char village in Kandal province. She is a widow with 4 children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory and two attend the local school.

Mrs. Ouen C. is a famer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. In this farming, she now has a problem because her field is infertile so Mrs. Ouen C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support her field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support the field.

loans.name: Amélia

texts.fr: Amélia est une femme de 54 ans, elle est veuve et a 6 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de WALIDANE depuis 5 ans. Elle fait de la couture, elle possède d'une machine à coudre à main à domicile et confectionne sur mesures et sur commande, cette activité lui procure des ressources qui lui permettent de prendre en charge ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Amélia is a 54-year-old woman who is a widow with six children to support.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de WALIDANE for five years.  She is a seamstress and has a manual sewing machine that she uses to make clothes for custom orders at her home.  This business  brings in the resources that enable her to support her children and to provide for her personal needs. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her working capital

loans.name: Halimatou

texts.fr: Halimatou B. est veuve, elle est âgée de 61 ans. Depuis 6 ans et demi elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NEMATABA dont elle est la présidente. Elle a une bonne expérience avec le crédit pour l'avoir consenti à plus de 12 fois. Elle développe un commerce d'arachide et ses bénéfices lui permettent de se prendre en charge.
texts.en:
Halimatou B. is a widow, she is 61 years old. For 6 ½ years she has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" of NEMATABA which she chairs. She has good experience with loans for having approved more than 12. She is developing a peanut trade and her profits enable her to be self-sufficient.

Translated from French by Caroline Mrejen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her revenu and capital investement.

loans.name: Wenona

texts.en: Wenona B. runs a general store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is 40 years old, married and has two grown-up children. She is from the town of Puelay Villasis, Pangasinan. Wenona has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Wenona joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Wenona is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Shireen Taj

texts.en:
This is Shireen Taj daughter of A. H.. She lives in the 16th district of Kabul, Afghanistan, and is married with five children. Her youngest son is a college student and the others are in school.

Shireen Taj wants to receive a loan for her husband who has a shop in which he repairs generators. He wants to buy the tools which he needs in his business. Also, he would like to progress his business.

Shireen Taj would like to thank all Kiva lenders a lot.

loans.use: To buy tools for her husband's generator-repair business

loans.name: 03.01.0027 Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Ram N. T. is a 57-year-old femaL. living in Hoang Hoa - Thanh Hoa.  Ram is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Hoang Hoa-Thanh Hoa (03.01.0027 Hoang Hoa).

Ram is married and has 9 adult children.  To making a living, Ram provides furniture rentals to local community members.  Ram has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2000, Ram joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ram has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.000.000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women and she is now requesting a new loan of 5.000.000 VND.  This will be her 12th loan through Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Ram plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:
1.  L. T. Tiem is a 42-year-old femaL. requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan to support her business running a general store.
2.  L. T. Lan is a 48-year-old femaL. requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan for raising livestock.
3.  N. T. Gai is a 25-year-old femaL. requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan for raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed for her furniture rental business.

loans.name: Pagando En Fe Y Amor Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento PAGANDO EN FE Y AMOR se encuentra en su quinto ciclo son socias que se conocen muchas se dedican a la misma actividad que es la venta D. cosmeticos por catalogo.
 
La Sra. Ruth  tiene como actividad un agencia D. promotoras D. cosméticos D. diferentes lineas ella vive en plena avenida America D.  Villa Fatima es un lugar comercial y queda frente al mercado D. la misma zona  también hace el pintado y diseño D. uñas, es madre D. dos hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo, con el dinero del credito comprara productos al por mayor ya que algunos D. estos productos se encuentran en promocion.

La señora Elvira es la secretaria D. Actas ella se dedica a vender cosméticos por catalogo D. tres lineas importantes,  quien estudia y a la ves cuida y atienD. las necesidades D. su hijo que es todavia pequeño con el dinero del credito comprara productos al por mayor ya que algunos D. estos productos se encuentran en promocion, uno D. sus deseos es terminar su carrera Universitaria y salir profesional para mejorar asi las condiciones D. vida D. ella y D. su hijito. .

La señora Rosa quien es la tesorera del banco D. emprendimiento ella se dedica a vender comida por las noches y por las tardes ofrece cosméticos por las mañanas se dedica a sus hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, es una persona trabajadora ella sola mantiene su hogar por eso se dedica a distintas actividades siempre buscando una actividad que le brinD. mejores ingresos, el destino del credito es para aumentar su capital.

El banco está conformado por  10 integrantes quienes se garantizan mutuamente ellas estan en su 5to ciclo y  quieren incrementar su capital D. trabajo, todas las socias estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Pagando en Fe y Amor (Paying with Faith and Love) Communal Bank is in the fifth cycle. The members know each other well. Many of them work in the same activity, selling cosmetics by catalog. Ruth has an agency of cosmetic promoters from different lines. She lives on the main street, America D. Villa Fatima. It is a commercial place, which is in front of the market in the same area. She also paints and designs fingernails. She has two school age children. She does have her husband’s support. She will use the money from the loan to buy wholesale products. Some of these products are on promotion. Elvira is the secretary. She sells three important cosmetic lines by catalog. She goes to school, and at the same time takes care of and sees to the needs of her small child. She will use the money from the loan to buy wholesale products. Some of these products are on promotion. One of her wishes is to finish her university career and become a professional. This is to improve living conditions for herself and her small child. Rosa is the treasurer of the communal bank. She sells food in the evenings. In the afternoons she sells cosmetics. In the morning she devotes herself to her school age children. She is a hard-working person who supports her household by herself. That is why she works different jobs always looking for an activity that will bring greater earnings. She will use the loan to increase her capital. The bank is comprised of ten members who mutually guarantee each other. They are in their fifth cycle, and they want to increase their working capital. All of the members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Moises

texts.es:
Moisés Díaz León    es un señor de 41 años de edad el cual vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Después de varios años trabajando como agricultor, Don Moisés instalo una “soda” (un pequeño restaurante de comida criolla) en un local a la par de su casa. Asegura que con su negocio a podido mejorar sus ingresos y  que además se siente feliz de tener su propio negocio ya que ha tenido muy  buena aceptación en su comunidad, sin embargo considera que es tiempo de dar un paso adelante y hacer crecer su negocio. El comenta que el mayor  atractivo de su soda son las tortillas de queso, los cuales son una comida muy típica de Costa Rica. 
Actualmente el necesita un préstamo por ¢605.000(seiscientos cinco mil colones) para comprar más mercadería que pueda vender,  hacer más grande el negocio y brindar un mejor servicio a sus vecinos y turistas que pasen por la zona. El piensa mejorar las condiciones del local, y de esta manera hacerlo más atractivo a los turistas que pasan por la zona.  

Don Moises es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer   préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. Asegura que este crédito ha sido una gran motivación y trabajara fuertemente para seguir teniendo acceso a ellos y convertirse en un microempresario exitoso.
texts.en:
Moisés Díaz León is a 41-year-old man who lives with his wife and 4 children in a community called Santa Fe, which is located in Los Chiles in the Alajuela province of Costa Rica. Santa Fe is known for being a mountainous area and for being very close to the northern border of the country. Its main economic activities are cattle ranching and agriculture; specifically staple grains, sugar cane, and oranges are grown. After several years working as a farmer, Moisés installed a "soda" (a small restaurant serving national dishes) at a space very close to his house. He affirms that his business has been able to increase his income and that he feels happy to have his own business since it has been well received in his community. However, he thinks that it is time to take a step forward and expand the business. Currently he needs a loan for 605,000 colones to buy more goods to sell, make his business bigger, and offer better service to his neighbors and the tourists that pass through the area. He plans to improve the restaurant's condition and in this way make it more attractive to tourists. Moisés is a member of the Manantial de Santa Fe Communal Bank, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and with it he hopes to grow on a personal level and economic level. He maintains that this loan has been a great motivation and he will work hard to continue having access to them and to become a successful micro-entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve the conditions of his restaurant's premises.

loans.name: Lino Jose

texts.es:
El señor Lino Jose G. L.,  tiene 29 años con su esposa habitan en el Reparto Khun, la señora labora como cajera de los Supermercado Palí, él se dedica al comercio desde hace 2 años, anteriormente el Sr. Lino realizaba reparaciones de bicicletas, fue gracias  a los prestamos que pudo comprar mercadería para venderla a sus clientes y de esta manera comenzó una nueva fuente de ingresos, aun no posee los beneficios de trabajar en su propio local, en la actualidad, comenzó con las edificaciones de la nueva tienda.

Es para este propósito principal por la que el solicita el préstamo para la inversión en la compra de un mayor inventario de productos de reparacion de motos y bicicletas y motoneta, así mismo invertirá en la compra de una moto para la facilidad del transporte de la mercadería  y realizar pedidos a las puertas de los hogares de sus clientes. Esto le permitirá mejores comodidades laborales, una mayor rotacion de los productos, traduciendose una mejor estabilidad economica para toda la familia.
texts.en:
Lino Jose G. L., 29, lives with his wife in Reparto Khun; she is employed as a cashier at Palí supermarket. For the last two years he has been a merchant. Prior to this, Lino was a bicycle repairman. It was thanks to loans that he was able to buy merchandise to sell to his customers; this created a new source of income. He still doesn’t have the benefit of working out of his own place but he has started to build a new store. This is the purpose of his loan request. He wants to buy a larger quantity of stock items for bicycle and motorcycle repairs. He will also invest in the purchase of a motorcycle for greater ease in transporting merchandise and to be able to provide in-home services for his customers. This will make his work easier and he will have better product turnover, which will mean better economic stability for the entire family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire a larger inventory of products.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda K. is from the village of Little Tadian. She is 37 years old. Glenda is married and has 4 infant-aged children. To make a living, Glenda owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Glenda has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Glenda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Glenda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and then sell. Glenda is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and then sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Glenda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and then sell

loans.name: Santos Dionisia

texts.es:
Santos es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el caserío La Pilca, una zona rural del distrito de Olmos, el distrito con la extensión territorial mas grande de la región, se caracteriza por tener a la mayor parte de su población concentrada en zonas rurales que distan mucho entre si, la zona pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a mas de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de dos años a la crianza y comercialización de ganado ovino y caprino, ella cría sus animales al aire libre y cuando alcazan un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona que los adquieren para revenderlos en la ciudad de Chiclayo. Este negocio es de mucha importancia para el sostenimiento de la economía familiar, por lo que trata de mantenerlo de la mejor manera posible.

Santos desea adquirir mas animales para venderlos y aumentar sus ventas, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Santos es una mujer hacendosa y bastante responsable, durante el tiempo que lleva viviendo en la zona se ha sabido ganar el respeto y estima de sus vecinos y conocidos. Su mayor anhelo es trabajar para brindarle una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Santos is a 32-year-old mother who lives with her family in the hamlet of La Pilca, a rural area in the Olmos district. Olmos is the largest district in the region, and is characterized by a majority of the population living in rural areas with large distances between them. The area is part of the province of Lambayeque and is 2 hours from the city of Chiclayo. She has spent the last two years raising and selling sheep and goats. She raises them outside and when they have grown enough she offers them for sale to businesspeople from the area for resale in Chiclayo. This business is very important for sustaining her household, so she tries to keep it up as well as possible. Santos wishes to acquire more animals to increase her sales, and to achieve this objective she has seen the need to ask, for the first time, for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Santos is a hard-working woman and quite responsible. During the time she has lived in the area she has won the respect and esteem of her neighbors and others who know her. Her greatest desire is to work to provide an education for her son.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Powell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep and goats to raise and sell

loans.name: Hope To God Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Hope to God” group. They are small-scale-business people based in Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profits, and consequently improve their standard of living.

Also included in the photo is loan officer Edna B. Conteh, pictured on the left handing over the loan.

The leader of this group is Alie K., age thirty-nine. He was born in Yoni, a village in northern Sierra Leone. Now he lives with his wife and seven children in Waterloo, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch.

For more than ten years now, Alie has been selling both food and non-food items like cigarettes, mints, laundry soap, bathing soap, batteries, toothpaste, toothbrushes, etc. With the help of this loan, he will be able to expand his business both in terms of size and quality. He will buy more of the above mentioned items wholesale to add to his current stock.

loans.use: To buy more items like cigarettes, mints, laundry soap, bathing soap, batteries, toothpaste, toothbrushes, etc.

loans.name: Fabian

texts.en:
Fabian M. is from the town of Talibon. He is 70 years old. Fabian is married and has nine adult children. To make a living, Fabian owns & operates a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish in he market. Fabian has been engaged in his business for over 30 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Fabian joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fabian has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Fabian is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to repair his fishing boat. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but savings, insurance, and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair his fishing boat

loans.name: Sithat

texts.en: Mrs. Sithat M. and her husband are silk weavers. They have been married since 2000 and have two sons, both of whom are in school. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  They sell their finished silk products to a middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. Sithat has had two previous loans from Kiva. She is now asking for her third loan in the amount of $200 to purchase more silk.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PROGRESO”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, Provincia del Cusco y Departamento Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Karina ; ella tiene 21 Años de edad y es soltera;  La socia  a estudiado farmacia en la universidad nacional y ahora ella es graduada, La socia  tiene una botica  y está implementándola poco a poco, ella aún no quiere casarse ni pensar en tener hijos sino hasta pasado los 30 años, tiene el sueño de hacer de su botica una cadena de farmacias a futuro.  La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar medicamentos.

La socia agradece y valora esté préstamo el cual le permite realizar sus metas, La socia se compromete a cumplir el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
Karina, 21, is single and is a member of the “PROGRESO” (Progress) communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department. She studied pharmacy in the university and has now graduated. She has a drug store that she is gradually filling with stock and supplies. She doesn’t want to get married yet nor think about having children until she’s over 30 years old. Her dream is to turn her drug store into a chain of drug stores in the future. She is asking for funding to buy medicines.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medicine.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El Señor Juan Carlos Gonzales Terrazas tiene 25 años, vive en Ivirgarzama toda su vida, es soltero y tiene 1 hijo; el actualmente el trabaja como moto taxista  en el sindicato“2 de Agosto”  en el cual esta hace mas de 3 años como socio activo, el servicio que brinda es rentable por la alta cantidad de personas que solicitan este servicio por la facilidad,  rapidez y eficiencia. Vive con la mama de su hijo aunque aun no se casaron. 

Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de una nueva motocicleta, para poder realizar sus trabajos de mototaxista y de esta forma poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá también mejorar sus ingresos consecuente mente así mejorar su calidad de vida, poderles dar mejores condiciones de vida a su pequeño hijo y su mamá. Quienes no tienen culpa alguna de la crisis económica.

El señor Juan Carlos S. L. se apersono a CIDRE a solicitar su préstamo pues tiene la visión de poder mejor su calidad de vida solicitando un crédito para adquirir una motocicleta nueva.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan Carlos S. L. is 25 years old and has lived in Ivirgarzama all his life. He is single and has one child. Juan Carlos currently works as a motorcycle taxi driver for the August 2nd union and has been an active member for more than three years. His business is profitable because of the high quality of customers who request his service since it is convenient, quick, and efficient. He lives with the mother of his child but they are not yet married.

This is the first time Juan Carlos is requesting a loan from CIDRE. He plans to buy a new motorcycle so that he can perform his work and provide better service to his customers. As a result, his income will improve as well as his quality of life. This will provide better living conditions for his young son and his mother. They do not blame anyone for the economic crisis.

Sr. Juan Carlos S. L. applied in person for a loan from CIDRE because he has the vision to improve his quality of life. He is requesting a loan to acquire a new motorcycle.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Kadie

texts.en: This is 38-year-old Kadie. She is married and has two children who are 22 and 19 years old. She has one additional dependent who lives with her: her younger brother. He also helps her run her business. In 1999, Kadie established her business selling kitchenware such as pans, bowls, spoons, etc. Her mother taught her that her business is her career. Many of Kadie’s customers live in rural areas. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, Kadie earns about 2,930,000 SLL every month from her business. Kadie needs a loan of 4,500,000 SLL in order to buy large quantities of products for resale (e.g., drinking cups, sets of bowls, etc.) She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 439,500 SLL. Kadie intends to use the proceeds from this loan to educate her children through school and university. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more kitchenware

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel E., age 57, is from the village of Bago. Rachel and her husband have two school-aged children. To make a living, Rachel makes and sells baked goods in the local community. Rachel has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Rachel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Rachel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Rachel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her baked goods. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Rachel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Dominador

texts.en:
Dominador Y. is from the village of Jampason, Initao, Misamis Oriental. He is 59 years old, widowed and has 8 adult children. Dominador owns & operates a business, fishing and selling fish like milk fish and tamban in the local community. He also repairs household furniture to earn extra income. Dominador has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Dominador joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Dominador is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be his 1st loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Morn's Group

texts.en: This village loan group consists of nine people in Damrei Chhlang village, Kandal province. Mr. Morn M. is 40 years old and the group's president having been selected by it members. He is a mushroom farmer, and also owns a plot of land to cultivate vegetables while his wife, Mrs. Meas Chanthol, 36, works as seamstress in the garment factory. They are able to earn a good profit to support the family but do not have enough money to fix the tiles on their house so M. would like to ask for a loan to add his saving to buy the tiles. The couple has five children: one is mushroom farmer, one stays at home while the others are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy the tiles to fix his house.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma T. is a married woman who lives in Purok Kalubihan, Brgy Bulanon, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: a general store and vegetable vending. Her husband, Jessie T., who is 59 years old, works as a driver to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 5 children who are between 15 to 31 years old.

Norma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1996 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Norma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500, which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for future family needs. Norma T. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

loans.name: Gerivasio

texts.en: Gerivasio is a forty one year old enterprising man, married to a farmer with five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns a semi permanent house and is charged with the responsibility of taking care of the family. He has a great desire  to educate his children. Within five years of beginning farming he has been able to pay school fees for his children. Gerivasio needs a loan  to buy seedlings for planting this season.

loans.use: To buy seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.en:
Jose is thirty-three years old. He lives in the district of Tambogrande in the province of Piura in northern Peru.  It is a semi-tropical zone, primarily populated by farmers and ranchers.  Many residents own small fruit plantations or raise cattle or other animals.  Jose maintains a stable home, sharing it with his partner and their three young children.

Jose and his wife raise animals in corrals near their home.  The raise sheep, hogs, chickens and ducks.  They feed these animals with local products from farmers or products from local corn and rice factories.  The animals are raised and cared for until the reach the appropriate size and weight to be sold in local markets or to neighbors.  Peru has a rich cultural tradition and many special dishes using farm-raised animals.

In addition to raising animals, Jose works as a farm hand earning approximately $9.00 a day.  Between these activities he and his family are able to maintain a relatively consistent income stream and meet their basic needs.

The requested loan will be used to purchase additional feed and animals in order to continue to expand the family’s herd.  Jose hopes to be able to increase the activity of their business, improve their corrals and make better use of their land.  He is proud to be able to earn income independently.  He hopes to be able to improve his family’s lifestyle and provide his children with greater opportunities.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed and animals in order to continue to expand the family’s herd.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn D. is from the village of Nungnungan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 48 years old. Merlyn is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Merlyn owns & operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP whenever she sells one of her raised animals.

In 2009, Merlyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Merlyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

Nuestra amiga Rosa  es socia del Banco Comunal hace ya 9 años, es la actual presidenta del Banco y le gusta porque este es un banco que le ofrece mucha seguridad ya que todas sus compañeras son muy responsables. Ella tiene 38 años, está soltera y vive con su mama.
 
Tiene un pequeño local en el cual vende dulces, helados y golosinas, trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 19h00, los helados y bolos los prepara ella, dice que esto lo aprendió hace muchos años y que los hace en varios sabores y son de mucho agrado de sus clientes. Tiene seis años en este negocio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien, en temporadas playeras tiene muchas ventas ya que en esta temporada llegan muchos turistas.

Este crédito es para comprar dulces, golosinas y productos necesarios para preparar sus deliciosos helados, ya que se viene la temporada playera y vienen muchas personas. Sus sueños son tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
The members of the Crucita Community Bank meet in the Crucita parish of the Portoviejo canton. This location is known for its lovely beaches which surround this beautiful area and are often visited by local and foreign tourists. This area is known as "Crucita the Beautiful".

Our friend Rosa has been a member of the Community Bank for 9 years already. She is currently the Bank's president, and she likes it because this is a bank that offers a lot of security, since all of the members are very responsible. She is 38, single, and lives with her mother.

She has a small store where she sells candies, ice cream and sweets. She works every day from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm. She makes the ice cream and candies herself. She says that she learned this many years ago, and that she makes several flavours which her customers like a lot. She has had this business for six years, and tells us that it is going very well. During the beach season she has many sales, as this is the season when many tourists arrive.

This loan is for buying candies, sweets and the necessary products for preparing her delicious ice creams, since the beach season is coming up and many people are coming. Her dream is to have a larger business.

loans.use: to purchase candies, sweets and products for making ice cream.

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos, se reúne cada quince días  El Banco Comunal Quiroga.

La señora Gloria  es socia fundadora del Banco comunal hace ya 14 años y le gusta porque siempre han estado allí para ayudarla a través de los créditos. Tiene 54 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció y quedo muy sola  pero de esa relación tiene 5 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad y viven en otras ciudades.

Hace varios años aprendió corte y confección y también sabe preparar para la venta deliciosos dulces, nos cuenta que desde que su esposo falleció dejo de coser y solo se dedico a preparar los dulces pero que hace dos meses volvió a dedicarse también a la  costura ya que eran muchas las personas que le llevaban sus costuras pero ella no se sentía muy bien, pero ahora se da cuenta que esto también le sirve de entretenimiento para olvidar un poco su tristeza por su perdida. Nos cuenta que sus dulces también son muy apetecidos por sus clientes y que los prepara con mucha dedicación.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, otros materiales para la costura y para comprar unos pollos para cría. Sus sueños son tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The Quiroga community bank meets every fifteen days in the parish of Quiroga in the city of Calceta, an area where the people are mainly farmers, raising animals and selling their products.

Gloria was a founding member of the community bank fourteen years ago, and since then,  it has always been there to help her.  She is 54 years old.  Her husband died several years ago, and she has been very lonely since then.  She has five children, but they are adults and live in other cities. 

A number of years ago, she learned sewing and tailoring, and she also makes delicious sweets.  She says when her husband died, she stopped sewing and dedicated herself only to making sweets, but that two months ago she resumed sewing because many people were bringing their things to her.    She did not feel very good about it, but now she is thinking that this might serve as entertainment to help her forget the sadness of her loss.  Her clients really love her sweets, and she makes them with a lot of care.

This new loan will be used to buy fabric and other materials for sewing and to buy some chickens to raise.  She hopes to stay healthy.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, zippers, buttons and other materials for sewing and to buy chickens.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 42 years old and married.  He does photography to earn a living.  He was previously employed and went into business on his own so as to earn a better income.  He has been in the business for twelve years.  He has experienced a lot of growth in his business since he joined Faulu Kenya.  He hopes to have a well established business in five years.  He has requested for 50,000kes to buy a digital camera.

loans.use: To buy a digital camera

loans.name: Leonidas Del Carmen

texts.es:
Leonidas es un pequeño comerciante que ha venido creciendo gracias a su tenacidad de esfuerzo para lograr apoyar  a su familia, casado, su esposa labora como recepcionista, logrando dar lo necesario a su familia.
Producto de su trabajo por muchos años a la alcaldía con sus ahorros compro un camión, generándole ganancia, lo que luego compra un taxi, para seguir equilibrando sus gastos. 
Afodenic ha sido el medio para dar el mantenimiento  a sus vehículos pues lleva once créditos de los cuales ha sido de mucho beneficio para el desarrollo de su inversión.
Con este nuevo préstamo dará un mantenimiento total del vehículo en la reparación de amortiguador, espejos delantero, caja de transmisión, suspensión entre otro para seguir dando un buen servicio.
texts.en:
Leónidas is a small merchant who has been growing thanks to his tenacity of effort to support his family.  He’s married and his wife is employed as a Receptionist.  They manage to provide the basics for their family.

His many years work for City Hall made it possible for him to use savings to buy a truck which provided profits he then used to buy a taxi to continue balancing his expenses.

Afodenic has been the means by which he has provided maintenance to his vehicles because he’s had 11 loans that have been of great benefit for the development of his investment.

He will use this new loan to provide total maintenance to the vehicle repairing the shock absorber, front mirror, transmission gear box and suspension, among others to continue providing good service.

loans.use: To repair a shock absorber, front mirror, transmission gear box, suspension and continue providing service.

loans.name: Al-Harrkan Islamic Secondary School In Makeni Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers of the AL-Harrkan Islamic Secondary School in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 6,600,000 in order to meet their immediate financial needs. 

AL-Harrkan Islamic Secondary school was founded in 1979 by the Sierra Leone Muslim Youth Cultural Organisation/AL-Harrkan Mission to provide education to the children of Makeni and beyond. The school is staffed with 15 teachers and has an enrollment of 400 pupils. Irrespective of the many hurdles (such as the lack of sufficient buildings – classrooms, a library, a laboratory and inadequate learning and teaching materials), the school has managed to excel in public examinations and has been very competitive in extra-curricular activities like sport, quiz competitions, etc. 

Mr. Osman Calla K. (pictured on the right) is the man behind the school’s success. Mr. K. is the principle at the school and leader of the group. With 28 years of experience in the teaching profession, Mr. K. is able to inspire his staff into producing the desired result. Born in Makeni city, Mr. K. is married to a teacher and they have six children – two in secondary school, three in college and one working. Mr. K. has requested this loan in order to purchase a piece of land for the future construction of a house and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land and  pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Tem

texts.en:
Tem K., 32, resides in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. K. and her husband produce traditional drums to sell, earning an income of $15 per day. 

Each month, the family has to spend $75 on food and $25 on the other necessary expenses. K. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase materials to produce drums. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy materials to produce drums

loans.name: Maria Catalina

texts.es:
la sra. Maria Catalina O. V. tiene 48 años de edad, vive en el barrio Conaden de la ciudad de choluteca y es una mujer emprendedora que se dedida a la produccion y venta de tortillas, su negocio estsa ubicado en su casa de habitacion, tiene la ayuda de su hija mayor para la elaboracion de sus tortillas.
Maria es madre soltera.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de maiz, leña, cal y agua, ya que ahora los pedidos de sus clientes son mayores y no se da abasto con la produccion que tiene en este momento.
sus tiempos libres los dedica a visitar la iglesia.
texts.en:
Sra.Maria Catalina O. V. is 48 years old. She lives in the Conaden section of the city of Choluteca. She is an enterprising woman engaged in the production and sale of tortillas. Her business is located in her house. Her oldest daughter helps her in the making of her tortillas. Maria is a single mother.

The loan will be used for the purchase of corn, firewood, lime, and water since orders from her customers have increased and she isn’t able to fill them with the production that she currently has. Maria dedicates her free time to visiting the church.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, lime, and water.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward would like a loan to purchase spare parts for resale in his retail shop that he has owned for 5 years. He is charged with the responsibility of taking care of his five children and two other dependants as his wife is not employed and they live in Kyenjojo, Uganda. Edward dreams of building a permanent residential house and growing his business to start selling motorcycles and bicycles, although he has challenges of limited capital and high fuel prices that have raised transport fares.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for resale

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “VIRGEN DE GUADALUPE - CUSCO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente a la Provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Alvaro, el socio tiene 30 años de edad;  el socio es conviviente, el socio tiene 3 hijos de 11, 8, 3 años de edad; el socio es taxista el tiene su unidad de transporte, el socio brinda el servicio de taxi, el socio desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de llantas, combustible y para de ello desea invertir en mejorar su vivienda. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de llantas y mejorar su vivienda con el otro monto que reste.

El socio esta agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Virgen de Guadalupe - Cusco". It is located in the district of Huanchac, belonging to the province of Cusco, and the department of Cusco. 

His name is Alvaro. He is 30 years old, married common-law, and he has 3 children, aged, 11, 8, and 3. He is a taxi driver and he has his own car. He provides taxi services. He wants this loan to invest in the purchase of new tires, and fuel, and to invest in home improvements.

He is thankful and he wants to say that he will comply with his loan payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of new tires and to carry out some home improvements.

loans.name: Anthony A.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you the teachers of the Khulafai Rashideen Primary School in Mile Ninety-One, a small town in northern Sierra Leone. Khulafai Rashideen Primary School was founded in 1999 by the Islamic Jamat (Community). The school is staffed with nine able teachers.  

Anthony is a teacher at the school and leader of this group of borrowers. The 65-year-old Anthony was born in Mile Ninety One town. He has been in the teaching profession for 35 years now. He is married and has six children. Anthony has requested this loan to buy house building materials to complete his house building project.

Staff from this institution, like many other school staff within SMT’s operational areas, comes to SMT to apply for loans. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

(Attached to this photo is a snapshots of Ansu, a borrowers who was not able to be present for the group photo).

loans.use: to buy house building materials to complete his house building project

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.es:
Primitiva tiene 41 años de edad y es madre de familia de tres niños, ella vive junto a su esposo en una comunidad pequeña y rural del distrito de Tambogrande – Piura. Primitiva es conocida por ser una mujer alegre y trabajadora, dedicada a su familia.

Primitiva se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino desde hace 5 años.  Ella cuenta con corrales apropiados y espaciosos en las afueras de su hogar. Primitiva tiene clientes fijos y vende sus animales a los pobladores de su zona, principalmente. También se dedica a la agricultura, pues ha heredado terreno agrícola en el cual tiene limón en producción y lo cosecha semanalmente.

Primitiva solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado para su ganado y hacer una adecuada fertilización de sus cultivos. Estas actividades le permitirán a Primitiva, progresar en sus negocios y tener mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Primitiva is 41 years old, and has three children. She lives with her husband in a small, rural community in the district of Tambogrande, Piura. Primitiva is known for being a happy and hardworking woman who is dedicated to her family.

Primitiva has raised sheep for 5 years. She has appropriate and spacious pens behind her house. Primitiva has fixed clients and sells her animals mostly to people in her area. She also works in agriculture, using inherited land on which she grows lemons, which she sows twice a year.

Primitiva requests a loan for 1500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy animal feed and adequate fertilization for her crops. These activities permit Primitiva to go forward in her business and to have a higher income to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and fertilizer

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda works hard to support four children. She is married and sells root crops in the Philippines.

Merlinda requested a 1,800 Philippines pesos loan through NWTF to buy an Envirofit Cookstove.

She is getting the Envirofit Cookstove because she wants to avoid future lung diseases resulting from continued toxic smoke inhalation.

Merlinda is aware that by using the Envirofit Cookstove, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase an Envirofit Cookstove.

loans.name: Salimakan's Group

texts.en:
Salimakan is the leader of this group. She is 55 years old and married to a farmer. Together, she and her husband have raised seven children: four daughters and three sons. Their youngest son is a student and the other children are married and live separately with their own families. 

In order to earn money to provide for her family, Salimakan breeds livestock. She resells her animals after fattening them and earns 5,000 KGS a month. Salimakan is requesting a loan to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future, with the money gained from her business, she wants to improve her family’s living conditions.


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Eturalde

texts.en:
Eturalde is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 1 child. He has a shop that sells vegetables like tomatoes and cabbages. He has had this business for 5 years. 

He requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy additional vegetables to sell. Eturalde has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia is 40 years old, married and has six children. Her last two children are studying while the others do different kinds of work to support the family financially.  

Her husband is a driver by trade and Safia helps him support their family by selling ready-made garments. She makes these garments by purchasing cloth pieces from clothes shops and sells to her clients at a good profit.  She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her business. With the loan, she will buy cloth pieces in bulk quantity that will allow her to make clothes according to her customers’ demand and earn better profits.  She hopes that an investment will bring positive changes to her business and increase her income.   

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Safia.

loans.use: To buy cloth pieces for making ready-made garments.

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Micheal is 32 years old and is a father of 5 children aged 12 to 4 years.  He lives in his own house in Kibaale, Uganda. His spouse is a housewife,  therefore he is the sole bread winner for his family of 7 people. 

Micheal has a shop selling bicycle spare parts and has been operating it for 3 years. He faces a challenge in inflation and defaulters.  His dream is to own a wholesale shop. Micheal needs a loan to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.use: buy bicycle spare parts to sell

loans.name: Peris

texts.en: Peris is a hardworking, 28-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with two children who go to school. For the past 6 years, she has been selling new clothes to make ends meet. Previously, she was a house wife. She wants, in the next 5 years, to have her own exhibition and her dream is to be a wholesaler dealing in new clothes. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy men's trousers and shirts and ladies' hipsters and tops. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she is now able to access credit facilities easily.

loans.use: to buy stock of clothing

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
At his age of 51, Juanito still works hard all day long in his farming business. He has been in this business for almost 20 years. He plants and harvests rice in his one-hectare plot of land. He earned P30,000 last cropping season of May. He utilized it in paying for school fees, daily meals and monthly electric bills.

He is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. Through the help of this loan he will improve his crop production and thus increase his profits.

In the future, Juanito would like to keep producing abundant harvests to sustain all the needs of his children for a better education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Central Vaquería”, ubicado en el  distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 35 años de edad, está  casada y tiene 2 hijos.  Ella estudió la secundaria. Su esposo trabaja como taxista (transporte)
La señora se dedica a la compra y venta de animales domésticos como ovinos y vacunos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles dinero que incrementó al capital de su negocio.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles comprará  cuatro animales (ovinos), para su engorde por tres meses.  Nos cuenta que los animales los compra de la localidad de Ilave.  En el negocio le ayudan sus hijos. 
La señora desea mejorar los animales y así obtener mejores ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal  es la facilidad del préstamo y el ahorro.
texts.en:
Antonia is a member of the Central Vaquería Communal Bank, located in the Ilave District of the El Collao Province in the department of Puno.  She is 35 years old, married, and has two children.  She has a secondary education.  Her husband works as a taxi driver (transportation).

Her profession is buying and selling domestic animals, such as sheep and cattle.  Her first loan was for a total of 500 nuevo soles, which increased her business capital.

With this new loan of 500 nuevos soles she will buy four animals (sheep), for three months of fattening.  She tells us that she buys the animals in the town of Ilave.  Her children help her with her business.

She wants to improve the animals and, as a result, receive better income.

What she likes about the communal bank is the ease of lending and the savings.

loans.use: to buy four animals (sheep)

loans.name: Charisma

texts.en: Charisma is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Charisma has operated a retail shop for 5 years, selling canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Charisma is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Tolibshoh

texts.ru: Толибшох проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 54 года. Он женат. У него семеро детей. Его дети находятся в России на заработках. Его старший сын помогает ему материально. Сам Толибшо занимает животноводством. Он разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности он занимается шесть лет. Кредит берет для закупа несколько голов бычков, чтобы увеличить количество скота.
texts.en: Tolibshoh lives in the Shahrituz district.  He is 54 years old, married and has seven children.  His children are working in Russia.  Tolibshoh's oldest son helps him financially.  Tolibshoh is involved in animal husbandry.  He breeds livestock for subsequent sale.  He has been in this business for six years.  Tolibshoh is requesting this loan for the purchase of several heads of bulls in order to increase livestock quantity.

loans.use: to buy several heads of bulls

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 27 years old. He is married to Auma and they have four children.

Julius operates an electronics shop dealing with electrical items and appliances. He has been dealing with this business for the last six years and makes a monthly income of KES 7,000. He is taking a second loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy more electrical items for sale. 

He will use profits to pay back his loan without default so that he qualifies for subsequent loans. His hope is to open another electronics shop.

loans.use: To buy more electronic items to sell

loans.name: Teofila Irma

texts.es: Teofila Irma tiene 46 años, su actividad es la venta de ropa interior desde hace más de 15 años que tiene este negocio. Inicio con muy poco capital de trabajo a pesar de que siempre ha tenido dificultades pues tiene un hijo de 18 años bajo su cargo. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de biquinis, trajes de baño, hilos dentales, entre otros productos. Sueña con mejorar sus ingresos cada día.
texts.en:
Teofila Irma is 46 years old.  Her job is selling underwear.  She has had this business for more than 15 years.  She began with very little working capital despite always having problems since she has an 18-year-old son in her care.

The loan she is requesting is to buy bikinis, bathing suits, and thongs, among other products.

She dreams about improving her income every day.

loans.use: to buy bikinis, bathing suits, thongs, and other products.

loans.name: Patient Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Patient” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Lunsar, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of 800,000 SLL for each in the group in order to invest in their respective businesses.  

Isata is the leader of the group. She is thirty-five years of age. Isata is married to an elections officer and the couple has three children. She sells cloth, earrings, etc. and has been doing business for many years now. Isata is going to use her share of the loan to buy cosmetics, cloth, jewelry, etc. to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, cloth, jewelry, etc. to add to her business inventory.

loans.name: Saint Emmanuel Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SAINT EMMANUEL est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même zone. C'est la troisième  fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Léocadie Victoire est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Léocadie Victoire est âgée de 44 ans et vit au Bénin. Léocadie Victoire n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Léocadie Victoire est mariée à un certain Josias. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Léocadie Victoire vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Afin d‘assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Léocadie Victoire vend depuis trois ans, du maïs dans son quartier. Léocadie Victoire s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Léocadie Victoire sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SAINT EMMANUEL, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Saint Emmanuel group is made up of three people who live in the same area. This is the third time that the group has sought financial support from ALIDé in order to boost their business. The group leader,  Léocadie Victoire has her hand raised in the photo. She is 44 years old and lives in Benin.  Léocadie Victoire did not attend school.  She lives with her husband, Josias, and children. In order to meet the family's needs, she has sold corn for a living for the past three years. She sources her goods from a market in Benin and sells them locally. In order to meet customer demand and to boost sales, she along with the other group members, are seeking a third loan from ALIDé. The two previous loans have been successfully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase bags of corn

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is 50 years old, married, and has 2 children.  She works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like canned goods, beverages, soft-drinks and school supplies to sell.

Andrea has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 20 years and also earns an income from a bakery.

Andrea aspires to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, benerages, soft-drinks and school supplies

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Leonada; La socia continua con su negocio de compra y venta de pollos, la socia sigue vendiendo en la plaza de Urcos en su carreta, la socia tambien tiene una cantina en la que vende cervezas, chicha, ella en esta ocasión desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de cervezas para incrementar sus ventas en estas fiestas navideñas.
texts.en:
Leonada continues with her business of buying and selling chickens.  She continues to sell from her cart at the Urcos plaza.  She also has a cantina where she sells beer and “chicha” (a traditional, corn-based drink).

This time she wishes to use the loan to buy beer to increase her sales during the Christmas festivities.

loans.use: to buy beer to increase her sales during the Christmas festivities.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 47 years old, married to Fransisca, and they are blessed with two children. He has been selling livestock for the past 20 years with a monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his fourth loan with KADET in the amount of Kes 49,000. He will use the loan to buy more livestock (goats, cows, sheep) for resale. With the anticipated profits from the business he will educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop for his wife.

loans.use: To buy more livestock for sale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, a 56-year-old businessman, is married to Jane, a farmer. They are blessed with two children, aged 20 and 18. Peter has been in the motorcycle transport business for the past ten years, with a monthly income of KES 9,000 which he uses to support his family.

Peter is applying for his first loan term after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Peter will use the loan to buy spare parts for his motorbike. Peter plans to use the anticipated profit from the business to educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and to build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his motorbike

loans.name: Javier Helemher

texts.es:
Javier es un hombre de 23 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos Javier no pudo estudiar la carrera de Contabilidad que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver noticieros y programas educativos en televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Pallares Verdes para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, entusiasmo y gracias al apoyo de su hermana, Javier trabaja brindando servicios de movilidad como chofer de taxi, él cuenta con un auto, el cual utiliza para trabajar, todos los días desde tempranas horas Javier sale a recorrer las calles de su ciudad en búsqueda de pasajeros, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Javier se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mantenimiento de su auto, él desea poder ponerle una parrilla, cambiar las llantas, componer la caja de cambios y mantenimiento del motor; de esta manera Javier tendrá su auto en mejores condiciones, así él espera seguir brindando sus servicios e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda tener su camión propio y así ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: Para realizar el mantenimiento de su auto.

loans.name: Gabou

texts.fr: Madame Gabou est une femme qui habite dans le département, elle est mariée et mère de famille. Son principale activité est le commerce. Elle évolue dans le commerce de tissus, bazins entre autres. Elle appuie son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille. Gabou commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 19h. Elle sollicite ce montant pour renforcer et diversifier son activité. Gabou souhaite à l'avenir augmenter ses revenus qui lui permettront d'améliorer le bien-être de sa famille

loans.use: Acheter des tissus pour les revendre après

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Gina is mainly occupied with the sale of local drinks in her community. She has no money to pay her supplers and therefore is not receiving supplies anymore. She is seeking a Kiva loan of $700.00 to enable her to pay for more drinks for sale.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy an industrial kitchen

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana is a weaver, making traditional Mayan clothes for women of her village. The special women’s top she weaves is called a huipil, the most important part of the Maya woman's outfit.  The weave, design and style of each huipil is indicative of the village it is from and is worn with great pride. Ana has no formal education and speaks only Cakchiquel, but is a master weaver with great knowledge of this ancient Guatemalan art. The women’s credit group she belongs to is called “Quetzal”, which is also the name of the currency used in Guatemala.  She has taken out 3 loans in the past year and a half, and she has successfully  repaid each loan.. With this new loan she will purchase new thread and materials to continue weaving.Ana is 40 years old and married. Her husband works as a night watchman  in a nearby town. Together they have raised 4 children, own their own home,  and are now helping raise their five grandchildren. Her goals are simple: to be able to buy more material to weave more and sell the resulting products.  The two or three huipiles she can make and sell in one year will help to support her 5 grandchildren. In her one room home, Ana weaves in the corner and is surrounded by a dozen family members who demonstrate their love for her. The children hang on to her, giving her hugs and thanks for being the special caring person she is.

loans.use: With this loan she will purchase new thread and materials to continue weaving.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachel A. is 32 years old and married with two children. She lives in Umoja estate, one of the many estates in the eastern part of Nairobi city.

Rachel operates a tailoring stall at a market known as the Umoja Market situated within the estate where she lives. Rachel started her business in the year 2002 and at this time, she operated her business from her house. She used to make tablecloths which she sold in the town of Meru, in the Eastern Province of Kenya. Rachel continued selling her tablecloths in Meru town until the year 2004 when she decided to introduce a new line into her business, by selling ladies suits after two ladies in Meru town commissioned her to make them suits. She made six additional suits to test the market and to her surprise, all the six were sold very quickly. From then on, Rachel decided to become a full time tailor specializing in ladies clothes.

Rachael has managed to employ several orphaned young women who help her with the tailoring work. Rachel now intends to expand her business by stocking tailoring materials and accessories so that her tailoring colleagues and customers do not have to travel all the way to the city center to buy these items. Rachel is therefore requesting a loan of USD750 that she intends to repay within 12 months. With this loan, Rachael will be able to boost her income by supplying tailoring materials and accessories such as lining, buttons, rings, canvas, thread biers and laces. These additions will greatly boost her income.

loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials and accessories including lining buttons, rings, thread, laces etc.

loans.name: Thek

texts.en:
Mrs. Thek K. L., aged 50, works with her husband running a battery charging business. She charges batteries such as vehicle batteries and earns about $7.30 per day. They have three children, one who is a goldsmith and two are married and live separately with their own families.

She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for her family’s transportation. Mrs Thek's husband is pictured in the photo in front of their shop as she was not available at the time the photo was being taken.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to use for the family's transportation.

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es:
Verónica has been working raising palmetto trees for some time. She currently has 20 hectars of sown palmettos. She embarked on this venture with one goal: to collaborate in the culmination of her son Richard's university career. Together with her husband, Luis, she decided to extend the growing season of this product since raising palmettos brings her excellent benefits. Since palms require extremely detailed care, the harvest of the product is carried out weekly. To improve the transfer of the product to market she needs a vehicle. With your kind support Verónica will be able to make her plans reality in a short time.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Verónica, se dedica al cultivo de palmitos desde hace mucho tiempo y actualmente cuenta con veinte hectáreas de palmitos sembrados. Ella se encaminó en este proyecto con una sola meta de colaborar con la culminación de la carrera universitaria de su hijo Ricardo; en compañía de su esposo, Luis, decidió incrementar la siembra de este producto ya que les brinda muchos beneficios; debido a que estas necesitan de un cuidado extremo, la cosecha de este productos se produce de manera semanal y con el propósito de mejorar su traslado requiere de una movilidad.Con tu gentil apoyo la señora Verónica podrá concretar su propósito en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Purchase of a vehicle to transport the fruit she produces (hearts of palm).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: she needs the loan to purchase

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en: Hajara A. is a single 24-year-old woman who has been a cosmetics trader for the past 4 years. She is requesting a loan of $275 to buy more creams and cosmetics for sale. Business has been very strong recently. The products pictured in her basket are literally the last of her available supplies. She hopes that this loan will increase her income and ensure that her product line does not become depleted as it is currently.

loans.use: To purchase additional creams and cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Ho Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ho Thi N., a 4th years member of TYM is currently living with her husband and 3 children in Hung Nguyen, Vietnam. At 47 years old, she has been doing cattle-breeding for over 10 years. During previous years, all of her loans had been to invest in breeding pigs. Always making careful decision taking into account her ability and resources, she had always been able to repay her loans on time. Her monthly earnings has always been around 150 USD. Recently, she started breeding cows to increase her income. Even though breeding cow take more time, it doesn't take as much energy as breeding pigs. Also, beef are currently in demand so she would like to take out a loan of 450 USD to buy another cow or two.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh Hoai Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Năm nay 47 tuổi, chị Hồ Thị N. đã có hơn 10 năm trong việc chăn nuôi. Các năm trước chị thường vay vốn đầu tư cho việc nuôi lợn. Luôn chọn mức vốn phù hợp với khả năng nên chị N. chưa bao giờ gặp khó khăn trong hoàn trả. Thu nhập bình quân mỗi tháng của chị là 150USD. Thời gian gần đây, chị nuôi thêm bò để tăng thu nhập. Việc chăn nuôi bò mất nhiều thời gian hơn nhưng không vất vả như nuôi lợn. Vào thời điểm này bò đang được giá, chị N. làm đơn xin vay 450USD để mua một hoặc hai con bò.
