Chị N. hiện đang sống cùng chồng và 3 con. Chị là thành viên năm thứ 4 của Quỹ Tình thương

loans.use: Buy beeves

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en: Mrs. Sinat M. is a 42-year-old woman living in the Vihea Villlage of Kandal Province. She is a grocer who sells her goods in the village. As for her family life, she is a single mother with two children, one of whom is enrolled in school while the other is working and generates approximately $1.25 of income per day. Additionally, she has cultivatable land, but she does not have money to buy rice seeds to grow on the field. In order to address this dilemma, she is seeking a loan to buy rice seeds.

loans.use: To purchase rice seeds to plant on her cultivatable land.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is thirty eight years old and the mother of two children. She has been selling washing powder for two years. She buys the product in bulk from Accra and resells them to the retail market by carrying loads on the head to sell from place to place.

She wants to use loan to buy more washing powder to increase her inventory and to avoid price hikes. She is a member of the group called “Nyame wo Tum” (meaning "God has power"). Members guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. Juliana’s photo was taken during the group’s meeting.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of washing powder

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
Maxima produces and sells cow’s milk, distributed through the company Delicia (an ice-cream factory). Maxima and her husband work as small garden agriculturalists, selling their products in the city of La Paz, Bolivia. Milk and vegetables are their principle sources of income, by which they maintain their three children. The couple lives in the community of Palomar (two and a half hours from La Paz).

Maxima requests a loan in order to purchase a cow of average quality. In this way she will increase her milk production and have a better income. This is Maxima’s first loan through Kiva’s field partner Impro. An evaluation showed that she qualifies for the requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Maxima es productora de leche de vaca, su producto es comercializado a la empresa Delicia (fábrica de helados). Máxima y su esposo trabajan como pequeños agricultores de hortalizas, las cuales son vendidas en la ciudad de La Paz, estas son sus principales fuentes de ingresos con las que cubren la manutención de sus tres hijos. El matrimonio vive en la comunidad de Palomar (a dos horas y media de la Ciudad de La Paz). Máxima solicita crédito para comprar una vaca de mediana calidad, de esa manera incrementará su producción de leche y tendrá mayores ingresos económicos. Este es su primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada nos permite aprobar su solicitud de préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for milking

loans.name: Nguyen Thi Hong

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi Hong T., 60, has six children, who are all grown-up. She joined TYM fund in 2003. Initially, Mrs. Hong only took out a small amount of loan to invest into agricultural activities such as breeding and planting in the hope of earning a stable income for her family. After obtaining some experience, Mrs. Hong felt more confident about asking for a bigger amount of loan to revamp the system, build more fish ponds and breeding facilities. Since then, her family’s income has been very stable. When her husband passed away, her determination, diligence and love for her children helped her overcome the grief and keep raising her kids. All of them have already had jobs and helped her with her business. In the next loan level, she wishes to borrow 19 millions VND to buy more fishes and pigs. Her income is 5 millions VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hồng Thái năm nay 60 tuổi Gia đình chị hiện có 6 con đã trưởng thành. Chị tham gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương từ năm 2003. Ban đầu chị vay vốn để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi và trồng trọt, dự án cho thu nhập tương đối ổn định. Sau khi đã tích luỹ được thêm kinh nghiệm trong chăn nuôi gia đình chị đã mạnh dạn vay các vòng vốn lớn hơn để chuyển đổi cơ cấu chăn nuôi, trồng trọt, đào ao thả cá, xây dựng thêm hệ thống chuồng trại để chăn nuôi. Hiện nay gia đình chị đang chăn nuôi, thả các theo mô hình trang trại cho thu nhập rất ổn định. Không có được may mắn như những người phụ nữ khác do chồng chết sớm nhưng với bản chất chăm chỉ, chịu khó và quyết tâm làm ăn nuôi con cái khôn lớn chị đã vượt qua được khó khăn. Các con của chị nhờ đó cũng được nuôi dạy trưởng thành. Hiện tại các con chị đều có công việc làm ổn định và đều có thể giúp đỡ thêm cho chị trong việc làm ăn hàng ngày. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 19.000.000đ để đầu tư mua cá giống, mua thêm lợn để chăn nuôi.

Thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Raising and growing

loans.name: Miriam Lidia

texts.en:
Miriam is a 45-year-old mother of four children. She lives in a rented house where there are other tenants. Miriam and her husband sell ceramics, glasswork, sheets, bedspreads, and other products to order and door-to-door. Furthermore, her husband buys imported products from the city of Lima and then travels to different provinces to sell their products on credit once a week or every fifteen days.

Miriam is a member of the Generosidad Village Bank. She needs a loan of 3,000 Nuevos Soles to invest in pressure pots, Pyrex products, and sheets.

Miriam's dream is to construct a house in Lima, to have a stable store, and that her children may become professionals.

loans.use: to invest in pressure pots, Pyrex products, and sheets

loans.name: Mrs. Hai Hean's Group

texts.en:
This loan group which consists of six members is located in Khsom Village in Kandal Province. All the members are married and they plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Hai H. is the group leader and is a Khmer noodle maker.

In her business, she now faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to purchase sticky rice in order to make Khmer noodles. Thus, Mrs. Hai H. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more sticky rice for her business. Mrs. Hai H. is a 31-year-old widow with a child who is too young to work or study because that child is just two.

loans.use: to buy more sticky rice to make Khmer noodles to sell

loans.name: Vali

texts.en:
A. Vali is 50 years old. He is married and has 5 children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells different kinds of food, such as sweets, soft drinks, juices, and other items in his grocery store, which is located near his house. Vali is not alone in this business. His whole family actively helps him with sales. Currently, Vali has about $1000 in inventory. His gross income is about $900 and his monthly net profit is about $300.

Vali is requesting a loan of $800 to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in awhile to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. His perseverance and clear vision are key factors for success in his small business.

loans.use: Purchasing a greater variety of food to sell

loans.name: Victorine

texts.fr: Dame D. Victorine est née vers 1968 à Cotonou au BENIN. Elle est mariée à DOMINGO Louis (mécanicien) avec qui elle vit en location à Cotonou. Dame D. Victorine a deux enfants qui vivent avec elle. Elle vend dans un marché situé dans le premier arrondissement de la ville de Cotonou des condiments à savoir tomate fraîche, légumes, piments, oignon, poivre et huile d'arachide. Elle réalise en moyenne un chiffre d'affaire journalier de 15000Fcfa. Pour s'approvisionner en quantité; elle sollicite le renouvellement de son deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
Mrs. Victorine D. was born around 1968 in Cotonou, Benin. She is married to Louis Domingo (mechanic) with whom she lives in Cotonou.

Mrs.Victorine D. has two children who live with her. She sells condiments, i.e., fresh tomatoes, vegetables, hot peppers, onions, black pepper, and peanut oil in a market situated in the first official district of the town of Cotonou. She has an average daily turnover of 15,000 F CFA. She is requesting the renewal of her second loan so that she can buy in bulk.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a half-sack of onions, a half-basket of hot peppers, 2 baskets of fresh tomatoes, 2 cases of tinned tomatoes and 2 jerricans of peanut oil

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir S. is a 37 year-old  man living in Saadnayel, in the Bekaa valley. Married with two small children, Samir repairs and sells water pumps for a living. He started his own business in 1989 after seeing a need for such services in the region. Today, Samir wishes to borrow $1200 to purchase water pumps in order to resell them within the scope of his work.

loans.use: To purchase water pumps to resell.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
“I am proud to be a vendor and I wanted to earn more money to have my own stall in our house so that I no longer have to exert effort to roam around the village just to sell my products,” Ernestina said. 

Ernestina C. is already 50 years old. She has been married to Leonardo C. for more than 30 years now.  Their marriage is blessed with two children who are now both married and they are Ma. Elana – 31 years old, college graduate and now working as a teacher; and Melvin – 29 years old who graduated with a vocational course and is now working abroad. 

Ernestina is thankful that her children were able to finish their studies because of her vending business. She earns a weekly income of PHP600 and to further increase her income and save for the improvement of her business, Ernestina is asking for a loan to add to her present revolving capital. 

She also said that she must work hard, together with her husband who is involved in farming, in order to meet their daily needs.

loans.use: Additional Capital

location.town: Old San Mariano, San Mariano Isabela

loans.name: Colleta

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 45 year old Colleta K. from Mwanza. She is a widow with one child, who is 30 years old. She is also responsible for supporting two dependants who are orphans. Colleta K. has been running a clothes business since 2007 and her business is dong well. She works at her business 8 hours a day, 6 days a week. Colleta K. currently earns about 250USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 500USD in order to purchase more clothes for resale. In the future, she plans to add more supplies of clothes. Colleta thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora D. is currently in the business of selling perfume at the market street. Flora is 37 years old and married. Her husband is a teacher. She has four children and they all go to school. She is requesting a loan to expand the business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business selling perfume.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
La Señor Victor Raúl B. de 38 años de edad, vive en el Barrio Remanso de la Ciudad de Villa Elisa, posee un automovil Chevet modelo del añoi 1981 que utiliza para la compra de mercaderías para surtir su Despensa.- 
Esta casado hace 10 años con la señora María Cristina Vera de B. su cónyuge quien también se dedica a la misma actividad y le ayuda para la economía familiar, tienen 2 hijos una niña de 8 años y un nene 7 meses. La hija concurre a una escuela pública en el tercer grado.
El negocio esta ubicado en su domicilio sito en las calles Buenos Aires Nº 138 c/ Paso Medin y Av. Von Poleski del Barrio Remanso de la Ciudad de Villa Elisa camino a San Antonio., es casi la única Despensa en los alrrededores, además recientemente tienen nuevos vecinos de un asentamiento nuevo que son todos clientes suyos. 
El Sr. Victor B., retira el préstamo para la compra de varios mercaderías como Embutidos como panchos, chorizos, Fiambre, Carnes vacunos de diferentes cortes, (carnaza de 1a, de 2a, ) pollo(alita de pollo, puchero de pollo), Suavizante para ropa, Jabón de tocador, jabón en polvo, Pañal Desechable, Yogurth, Leche, Leche en Sachet, Yerba, Azúcar, Chocolate, Jugo Ades, Gaseosas, Cervezas, Vino, verduras varias como: tomates, locotes, cebollas, papas, lechuga, y frutas: Banana, naranjas, melones, piñas, ciruelas,etc.
El Sr. Victor se levanta a las 4:00 de la mañana y se dirije con su automovil al Mercado Central de Abastos de donde se provee de sus mercaderías, llega alli aproximadamente a las 05:00 Hs A.M. A fin de comprar todo lo que necesita para su negocio. 
Una de sus aspiraciones es poder ampliar próximamente el negocio, en lo que se refiere a la venta de Bebidas como Cervezas y Gaseosas.
texts.en:
Mr. Victor Raúl B., a 38-year-old man who lives in the Remanso neighborhood of the city of Villa Elisa, has his own 1981 Chevet, which he uses to purchase goods to stock his general store.

He has been married for 10 years with Ms. María Cristina Vera de B., who helps out with the family business in order to cover the family expenses. They have 2 children—an 8-year-old daughter and a 7-month-old son. Their daughter currently attends the third grade at the local public school.

The business is located inside their own home on Buenos Aires Street in Villa Elisa. Theirs is almost the only general store in the area. Furthermore, they recently got new neighbors, who are now their customers, from a newly constructed housing development nearby.

Mr. Victor B. is seeking this loan in order to purchase provisions, such as sausages (i.e. hot dogs and chorizo—seasoned pork sausage), cold cuts, different cuts of beef, chicken, fabric softener, bars of soap, detergent, disposable diapers, yogurt, milk, milk in a bag, herbs, sugar, chocolate, juice, soft drinks, beer, wine, vegetables (tomatoes, bell peppers, onions, potatoes, lettuce), fruit (bananas, oranges, melons, pineapples, plums), etc.

Victor gets up a 4am, gets in his car, and drives down to the Central Wholesale Market, where he obtains his products. He arrives at approximately 5am so that he can get everything he needs for his business.

One of his aspirations is to expand his business soon so that he can sell more beverages, such as beer and soft drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase provisions for his business

loans.name: Sophie

texts.fr:
Née vers les années 1971, D. Sophie est mariée à ATTIGBEDJO Benoît et est mère de deux filles toutes scolarisées. D. Sophie mène comme activité la vente de vivres comme le maïs, le haricot et aussi la vente de tenues d'enfants et la restauration c'est-à-dire la vente du riz et du haricot préparés. D. Sophie s’approvisionne sur les marchés locaux du Bénin et aussi au Togo, un pays de l'Afrique de l'Ouest frontalier au Bénin. D. Sophie mène l’activité de la vente de vivres et de tenues d'enfants depuis 15 ans. C’est après son 1er prêt à ALIDé que D. Sophie a commencé par vendre de nourriture tous les matins. Toujours dans le souci de répondre à la demande de ses clients D. Sophie sollicite un troisième prêt.   

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Sophie D. was born circa 1971, she's married to Benoît ATTIGBEDJO and the mother of two girls who attend school. Her business consists in selling food products such as corn and beans, as well as children clothing and also in catering (selling cocked rice and bean dishes). She gets her supplies from local markets in Benin and also in Togo, a neighboring country in Western Africa. She's been in this business for 15 years. After obtaining her first loan from Kiva's partner, Alidé, Sophie started selling food every morning. Always anxious to meet customer demand, she's seeking a third loan.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, beans, rice and children clothing

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a soup and juice seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar. She belongs to Mwanzo Mgumu loan group (Group code 2018). She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 90. Every day she works at her business from 12:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more meat for soup and different types of fruit for juice. She aims to prepare a lot of juice to satisfy her customers' needs. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Khadija is 30 years old, married, and has a 15-year-old child.

loans.use: To buy more meat and fruit for her business

loans.name: Eliana Epifania

texts.es:
La señora Emilia es socia del Banco Comunal “Dios es Amor”, en el distrito de Mazo- Cruz, provincia del Collao, departamento de Puno; tiene 21 años de edad, ella es conviviente, tiene 01 hijo y posee estudios de segundo grado de educación secundaria; ella vive en el Barrio José Antonio.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año, su primer préstamo fue  de S/300.00 nuevos soles que los invirtió en la compra venta de DVD y otra parte para la compra de lana sintética para la elaboración de artesanía. Ella se dedica a la venta de artesanías (tejidos) y DVD's.

Este préstamo de S/ 1700.00 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de combustible.
Su mayor deseo es poner un grifo para lo cual requiere una suma mas alta, pero iniciará con la compra de combustible para la venta al por menor.
Lo que mas le gusta son los ahorros de su Banco Comunal.  Está agradecida por la capacitación que recibe del Movimiento Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eliana is part of the Banco Coumnal “Dios es Amor” society, in the Mazo-Cruz district of the Collao province of Puno. She is 21-years old and is married with one child who is studying in secondary school. She lives in the Jose Antonio borough. She has been working for the Manuela Ramos movement for the last year and her first loan was for S/300.00 nuevos soles that was invested in the sale of DVDs and other parts for crafting items from wool synthetics. She has dedicated herself to the sale of these crafts and to selling DVD’s. This loan is for S/1700.00 nuveos soles to invest in the purchase of fuel. She desires place a cap to contain the high pressure, but that starts with the purchase of fuel for retail sale. Eliana enjoys the savings she receives through her community bank. She is grateful for the training she receives from the Manuela Ramos movement.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase synthetic wool and DVDs

loans.name: Koessi

texts.fr: Koessi T. est conducteur de taxi moto à Wome. Agé de 26 ans, Koessi est célibataire sans enfants. Il souhaite avec ce crédit acheter sa propre moto étant donné que celle qu’il utilise n’est pas de sa propriété. Il compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Koessi T. is a moto-taxi driver in Wome. At the age of 26, Koessi is single and has no children. He wants to use this loan to buy his own motorbike since the one he is using is not his. He is counting on this chance to improve his living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing a motorbike

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a farmer; she and her family plant rice and vegetables twice a year. Furthermore, Rosemarie also is engaged in vegetable vending to earn additional income for the education of her children since education nowadays is very costly. She hopes to borrow additional capital from lenders to acquire more products for her to sell. She is applying for a loan amounting to PHP 9,000 as additional working capital to generate higher income to continue sending her children to school regularly.

Rosemarie or “Belen” as she is commonly called, lives in the village of Barangay Murong Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Reynaldo S. and they were blessed with three children. Their eldest is now in second year college, their second child is a college freshman, and their youngest is already in the last year of his secondary schooling. The couple has fought through the hardships of life to send their children to school, as it is a very high priority for them.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married with grown children. She lives and works in Kahovka, in the south-eastern part of Ukraine. Yelena has been in the clothing sales business for 11 years. Just as many other small entrepreneurs at that time, Yelena started her venture because she didn’t have any other way to provide for her family’s needs. Today she has 40,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital.

Yelena has been successful working in this sphere of trade. She says this venture gives her opportunity to support her famil, which makes all the hard work worth the income she is making. This time Yelena is requesting a 12,640 Grivnyas loan to increase her income and to be able to provide for her family in the future as well.

loans.use: to increase her sales.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel K. was born in 1931 in Runyenjes Embu. He is married and the father of five living children, all of whom finished school. He is also is a member of a CBD group in Runyenjes. Samuel joined KMET microfinance in 2006. He is proud of being a beneficiary of 2 previous KMET loans that he paid back.  Now he requests a loan of US 260 to help him further expand his retail shop.

loans.use: Buy stock for his store

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
42-year-old Gina P. is a rice farmer in Norala, South Cotabato. She has three children all studying in school and a loving husband who helps her manage their farm. She is tilling a 1 1/2- hectare farm that she inherited from her parents. The income that they get from the farm helps a lot in providing their children an education and other needs.

Now, she is asking for a little loan from CEVI worth Php 10,000. She will use her loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals and other farm necessities. 

She chose CEVI because they are not just there providing loans to people but education as well to help them manage their own business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and chemicals

loans.name: Aristide

texts.en:
Greetings from U. Aristide,

Aristide is 27 years old and is single. He has been in the business of shopping for the past 5 years and the monthly profit is 100,000 RWF.

He is requesting his first loan of 500,000 RWF from Vision Finance Company s.a
With this requested loan,Aristide hopes to expand his business through purchasing more goods.

Through accessing this new loan, Aristide has hope for the future by attending university and saving some money.

loans.use: expand his business

loans.name: Milton

texts.en: E. Milton is a hardworking businessman who is thirty-five years old. He is a married man blessed with three children going to school. E. Milton has been operating a shop for eight years. E. Milton is using the loan to purchase clothing items for his shop, such as trousers, skirts, shirts, t-shirts, dresses, etc., as well as suitcases, shoes, and so forth. The loan is improving his stock, whereby he hopes to expand his shop. He is working hard to obtain a plot of land, and his dream is to construct a permanent house.

loans.use: To purchase clothing items for his shop, such as trousers, skirts, shirts, t-shirts, dresses, etc., as well as suitcases, shoes, and so forth

loans.name: Ventura

texts.es:
Ventura tiene 38 años, es una amorosa madre de familia, vive en una casa alquilada junto a sus 4 hijos: Jessica de 16, Verónica de 10, Zeus de 6 y Carlos de 5 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Su puesto está ubicado en el mercado Tupac Amaru (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), se dedica a la venta de zapatillas, las cuales trae desde la ciudad de Desaguadero (distrito del departamento de Puno, frontera con el país de Bolivia). Su puesto es muy concurrido, ya que los modelos que trae son novedosos y económicos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender y es muy feliz cuando vende toda su mercadería, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar las zapatillas, ya que las cajas que trae son muy pesadas y la cansan mucho. Para el futuro espera tener una tienda de calzados donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad.
Este es el cuarto préstamo de Ventura con MFP y espera poder pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo  al igual como hizo con sus primeros pagos. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida, ya que siempre está preocupada por el bienestar del resto de sus compañeras. Con los setecientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más zapatillas en Desaguadero para incrementar el stock de su puesto.
texts.en:
Ventura is 38 years old and a loving mother. She lives in a rented house with her four children: Jessica (16), Verónica (10), Zeus (6) and Carlos (5), who are the motivation behind all her endeavours. Her stall is located in the Tupac Amaru market (an important market in the city of Juliaca), where she sells runners which she brings from the city of Desaguadero (a district of the Puno department, on the border with the country of Bolivia). Her stall is very popular as the models she brings are new, original and inexpensive. What she likes most about her work is to sell, and she is very happy when she sells all her merchandise. She has spent five years in this line of work and she considers the most difficult aspect to be transporting the runners, as the boxes she has to carry are very heavy and they tire her out a lot. In the future she hopes to have a shoe store from where she can sell in greater comfort. This is Ventura´s fourth loan with MFP and she expects to be able to pay all her installments on time just as she did with her earlier payments. She is a very loved member in her community bank as she is always concerned about the well-being of the rest of her colleagues. With the 700 nuevos soles that she is applying for she will buy more runners in Desaguadero to increase her stall's stock.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of merchandise

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen C. D. A. D. 47 años edad resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador. Carmen vive con su esposo y dos hijos menores D. edad . El esposo D. Carmen es muy responsable en los gastos D. la familia sin embargo el presupuesto aumenta a medida que hijos crecen, es por ello que Carmen ha instalado un negocio para poder generar ingresos que ayudaran a su familia, Carmen  tiene una tienda hace ocho años y por la cual ahora solicita este crédito, para compara productos para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen C. D. A. is 47 years old and resides in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her husband and two young children. Carmen's husband is very responsible about the family's expenses. However, the budget increases as their children grow older, and therefore Carmen has set up a business in order to be able to generate income to help her family. She has had a store for eight years now, and she is requesting this credit to purchase products to stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her business.

loans.name: Courage

texts.en: Courage owns a computer center where he renders computer services to his clients within his community. He is 23 years old and single without a child. He is also a part-time student in the university. He hopes for a loan in the amount of 80,000 NGN to purchase a generator to enable him to meet the requirements of his clients when there is no electricity supply. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a generator

loans.name: Ireda Agali 3 Alumu Evelyn Group

texts.en: Evelyn A. is a 26 year old business lady. She is married and the mother of four children, three of whom go to school. She has been in the charcoal business since 2008. Although the taxes are high, she doesn’t give up. Evelyn is requesting this loan to purchase 15 or more bags of charcoal. As well, she would like to expand her grocery business by acquiring produce such as beans, maize, rice, etc to sell. She is an organized, hardworking business lady whose future hope is to educate her children and obtain a somewhat easier lifestyle.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal and produce

loans.name: Sreu

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreu L. lives in Samchat village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Chhoem Seng, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. They have a child who is a guard who can make a small income to support the family. 

Although this family works hard, they still earn less income than they need to cover their expenses and they do not have enough money to buy a motorbike. Thus, Mrs. Sreu L. is requesting a loan to add to her savings with which to buy a motorbike for the family's use. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for the family's use

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy O. is from the village of Siempre Viva Sur, Mallig. She is 52 years old. Nancy is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Nancy owns & operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Nancy has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nancy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nancy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baking equipment. Nancy is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Nancy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Donald

texts.en:
Donald A. is a 32 year old man blessed with 6 children. He is a poultry and cereals farmer in Malanga, Busia District. He believes in walking the talk by setting goals and living up to them.

He ocassionaly ventures into brick making during the Christmas holidays since, he says, most town folks tend to start building houses as tradition requires in the village. 

Donald would like a loan of Kshs. 30,000 to expand his cereal business. His future plan is to venture into dairy farming.

loans.use: Expand business.

loans.name: Lily

texts.es:
La señora Lily, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Siempre Unidas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 42 años  y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. Se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su casa, a comprar porque en ella  encuentran todo los productos que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,100.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos; galletas, fideos y sales en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Lily, se siente muy bien para continuar trabajando y esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Lily is a member of the “Siempre Unidas” (“Always United”) Communal Bank in the Tarapoto district of the province of San Martin. She is 42 years old, has 2 dependent children, and lives with her partner.

Her character and her desire to achieve her dreams motivated her to begin her own business selling groceries from her home. The income from her business helps support her household. Since she began her shop she has steadily gained customers, and today she counts on many regulars who come to her daily to purchase merchandise, as she carries all the products that homemakers need and she is known for her charming service.

She will use this loan for 1,100 Peruvian nuevos soles to purchase bags of rice and sugar, crackers, pasta, salt, milk, cases of canned fish, eggs, and personal hygiene products so that she can continue providing excellent customer service.

Lily feels very good for being able to continue her business. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for providing women like her with opportunities for personal and professional development.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries to increase her stock

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca L. is from the village of Hasan Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Rebecca is married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Rebecca owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks like rice cakes called "puto" in the local community. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 700 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rebecca joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 3500 PHP, which will be used to buy additional capital for her business. This will be the first loan taken out by Rebecca from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the daily needs of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Dionisio Efraín

texts.es:
El señor Dionisio G. pertenece a una cooperativa de trasporte con su propio microbús que transporta clientes a los departamentos de Chinandega, León Y Corinto, es soltero vive en el barrio Pedro Joaquín Chamorro de Chinandega tiene cinco hijos ninguno a su cargo 
El señor Dionisio G.  tiene dos años de trabajar con Ceprodel es un señor trabajador con treinta y un año de experiencia y mucho entusiasmo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Dionisio G. belongs to a transportation cooperative. He has his own minibus, which he uses to transport customers to the Chinandega, León, and Corinto departments. He is single, and he lives in the Pedro Joaquín Chamorro neighborhood of Chinandega. He has five children; none of them are in his care. Dionisio G. has been working with Ceprodel for two years. He is a hard-working man with 31 years of experience and a lot of enthusiasm for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tires and maintenance

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam O., 33, is married and lives with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  She has two children and sells fish and vegetable at home, earning approximately $1.50 per day.  She is able to cover her family expenses and has been with this business since 2004.  Her husband is an air-conditioner repairman, earning an income of $3 per day.  Sam wants to have a loan to expand her business and is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work.  This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: Buy a motorbike

loans.name: Khann

texts.en:
Mrs. Khann N. is 25 years old and lives in Phngeas village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Chanoeun Khem (pictured left), is a duck breeder who earns a small income to support his family. The couple has two children – the eldest is a student in the local school while the youngest is four years old.
In order to support her husband's business, Mrs. Khann N. is requesting 2,000,000 KHR from Kiva partner, AMK, to buy more ducks for breeding. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family's income and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more ducks for breeding

loans.name: Isabel Del Carmen

texts.es: Isabel del Carmen S. R. de 40 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután, vive junto a su esposo José Ángel Gómez  el cual se dedica a trabajar.  Isabel se dedica a trabajar en su propia casa, vendiendo golosinas y medicinas. Ella es una señora muy emprendedora la cual trabaja arduamente por obtener más clientela y vender cada día más con el mayor de los deseos de poder vivir mejor junto a su esposo. Ella solicita un préstamo a Integral, para poder contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de medicinas y más golosinas como dulces, churros, y galletas, lo cual le permita contar con más clientela, ya que ella cuenta con 8 años de poseer este negocio, a través del cual obtiene ganancias aceptables, a pesar de contar con pocos productos. Es por eso que Isabel cuenta con el deseo de aumentar su inventario y de esta manera crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Isabel del Carmen S. R., 40 years of age, resides in the Usulután department. She lives together with her husband José Ángel Gómez, who works. Isabel works from home selling sweets and medicines. She is an empresarial woman who works very hard to obtain more clients and sell more each day, to be able to live better together with her husband. Isabel is seeking a loan from Integral to obtain the necessary capital to buy a larger quantity of medicines and other sweets such as lollies, churros and biscuits, which will allow her to have more clients. She has had this business for 8 years, during which time she has made acceptable earnings, despite having few products. It's for this reason that Isabel wants to increase her inventory and grow as a micro-businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase medicines and sweets

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.en:
Marie Claire S. is a 47-year-old woman from the village of Nianing, Senegal. She is married and the mother of 10 children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NIANING SANTHIE for two years and has paid back her previous loans on time.

Madame S. raises chickens and gains a supplementary income by selling food. With this loan, she will purchase chicks which she will raise.

loans.use: To buy chicks to raise

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas forma parte del banco comunal “Sayhua” tiene 40 años, nació en la ciudad de Abancay, es casado y tiene tres hijos. 

Su principal actividad económica confeccionar ternos. Ya son 15 años que trabajan en el negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en el trabajo.  Tomas es un padre responsable y emprendedor que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un  mejor futuro a sus hijos, el requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio desea comprar más materiales como por ejemplo telas, hilos y botones. El anhelo del socio es comprar maquinas industriales para implementar su taller.  

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente.
texts.en:
Tomas is a member of the “Sayhua” communal bank. He is 40 years old, was born in Abancay city, is married and has three children. His business is making suits. He has been in this business for 15 years and it is going very well thanks to the great effort he puts into his work. Tomas is a responsible father and businessman who always looks for opportunities to be successful and with his daily efforts provide a better future for his children. He needs a loan to increase the capital in his business as he wishes to buy more materials such as fabric, thread, and buttons. His goal is to buy industrial machines to install in his workshop. He is very grateful for the opportunity provided through this loan and he promises to make his payments according to the loan repayment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more materials such as fabric, thread, and buttons

loans.name: Juana Alicia

texts.es: La Señora Juana  está casada y tiene su pulpería ubicada en su vivienda, donde vende diversidad de productos. Hace más de 15 años con esta actividad, y le va muy bien ya que conoce muy bien acerca de este negocio. Tiene 6 hijos pero ninguno depende de ella, y solo ella se dedica a su manutención. Anteriormente solo podía ofrecer galletas y ciertas golosinas que colocaba en una mesa, pero con el paso del tiempo ha logrado mejorar. El crédito será invertido en la compra de golosinas, jugos, detergentes, sopas, galletas y pan para aumentar sus productos a la tienda, es una persona responsable y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Juana is married and sells a variety of products in a small grocery store located in her home. She has had the shop for more than 15 years and it is very successful, as she is knowledgeable in all aspects of the business. She has 6 children but none are financially dependent on her. Previously, her shop was only a table where she offered cookies and other sweets for sale, but over time she has been able to expand her merchandise. She will invest this loan in the purchase of sweets, beverages, detergent, soup, cookies, and bread to increase her stock. Juana is a responsible and hardworking woman.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Noeun

texts.en: Mrs. Noeun C. is 46 years old and a villager from Tuol Kandal village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 5.5-hectare piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Thol Yarng (pictured with her), is a construction worker who earns a small income to support his family. Her husband is a hardworking man but they still do not earn sufficient income to support their family. Therefore, Mrs. Noeun C. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. In this way, she hopes to increase their income and improve the family's standard of living. The couple has six children, three of whom are laborers while the other three are students and also help in their parent's businesses.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Fanny Cesible

texts.es:
Fanny Cesible A. M. tiene 30 años de edad. Es casada y vive con su esposo y 4 hijos, Amanda (13), Shirley (11), Jhinson (9) y Thalia (7) en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.  

Fanny es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Santiagopamba, que se encuentra en San Pablo, a media hora del pueblo de San Miguel. La ventanilla esta compuesta por personas que en su mayoría se dedica a la agricultura, como fuente de ingresos de su familia.

Fanny trabaja en la agricultura. Lo que mas siembra son maíz, papas y legumbres. Hace las compras y ventas en el mercado de Guaranda (a una hora de San Pablo). 

Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos y sembrar papas. Piensa que el préstamo le ayudará a poner más abonos en las siembras para producir más. Su sueño es comprar un pequeño terreno para aumentar la producción. Enfrenta plagas y enfermedades a los cultivos.

Le gusta salir de paseo con su familia y las costumbres del carnaval que se celebra cada año en Febrero.
texts.en:
Fanny Cesible A. M. is 30 years of age. She is married and lives with her husband and 4 children, Amanda (13), Shirley (11), Jhinson (9) and Thalia (7) in the village of San Miguel in the province of Bolívar. Fanny is a member of the Santiagopamba rural associatoin, which is found in San Pablo, half an hour from the town of San Miguel. The group is composed of people that are mostly dedicated to agriculture as the source of income of their family. Fanny works in agriculture. Her largest crops are corn, potatoes and vegetables. She does the buying and selling in the market of Guaranda (an hour from San Pablo). She requests the loan to buy supplies and to sow potatoes. She thinks that the loan will help her to put more fertilizer on her crops to produce more. Her dream is to buy a small plot of land to enlarge her production. She faces plagues and diseases in her crops. She likes to go on walks with her family and enjoy the customs of the carnival that is held each year in February.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies to sow potatoes.

loans.name: Doris Elisa

texts.es: Doris Elisa tiene la venta de mercadería en general, hace más de 3 años que inicio este negocio pues con mucho esfuerzo es que ha logrado mantenerlo activo. Ella tiene una gran variedad de clientes que le solicitan diferentes productos, pero con el paso del tiempo y los financiamientos es que ha mejorado su negocio. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, shorts y trajes. Sueña con establecer una tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Doris Elisa has been dedicating herself to the general store activity for more than 3 years, and she has succeeded in keeping it running with much effort. She has a wide variety of customers asking for different products, but in the long run and with some loans she has succeeded in improving her shop. The loans she is requesting will be used to buy trousers, shirts, skirts, shorts and suits. She dreams of opening a clothes shop.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy core products.

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina has lived all of her life in a city called Borewala in Pakistan. She lives with her husband and their three children who are attending school and getting their education. She is a housewife and stays at home carrying out her responsibilities as a housewife and a mother efficiently. 

Her husband has a clothing-selling business and has a shop in the market. He has been doing this work for over five years. He not only sells the clothes in the market but sells in the community as well. Zarina helps him in selling the clothing in the community.  In this way they generate a good profit.  

Zarina has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband who wants to purchase clothes in bulk from a city called Faisalabad (famous for its textiles) that will minimize his cost of purchasing and increase his profit. Zarina is a second year member of Asasah and she has maintained good credit behavior in her first year and never gave any problems in repaying the loans.

loans.use: Purchase clothes for selling

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn A. is from the village of Cahulugan, Gingoog City. She is 28 years old. Jovelyn is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jovelyn owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products to the local community. Jovelyn has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Jovelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jovelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Jovelyn is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to build up her working capital. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Jovelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to build working capital

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina owns a small food store in a village close to Kherson town. She has been in this business for ten years. Her average income is 9,000 UAH per month.

Valentina is a very disciplined and organized person. She keeps track of her business expenses and income to make sure her business is doing well. Her large assortment and low prices always attract many repeat customers. Valentina is a kind and generous person. She helps others in her community with their needs. Valentina lives with her husband in their own house.

Valentina would like to borrow 10,000 Gryvnas (UAH) to purchase more inventory. She hopes to increase her sales and make additional profit to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Mirian Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra. Miriam R. tiene un pequeño negocio en el barrio san Judas, ella sale a vender ambulante en los barrios a le daños del sector.
Ella esta casada tiene dos hijos a su cargo a un que estos ya son mayores de edad, su esposo le ayuda con los gastos de su casa y tiene un hijo en la universidad.
El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de mercadería como. Ropa, calzado, perfume y bolsos ya que estos son encargos que a ella le han hecho sus clientes.
Miriam dice que todos los prestamos han sido para su negocio y este ha venido creciendo ya que ahora cuneta con mas clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Miriam R. has a small business in the San Judas neighborhood. She goes out to sell door-to-door in the area's neighborhoods. She is married with two children both whom are of age. Her husband helps her with the household expenses and they have a child studying at the university. The loan is to buy merchandise like: clothing, shoes, perfume, and purses since this is what she sells to her customers. Miriam says that all the loans have been for her business and that her business has been growing since she has gotten more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing, purfume, and purses.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy essential materials

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion G. is from the village of Dalumpinas, Sapang Dalaga. She is 49 years old, married, and has nine children, five of whom are adult-aged and four who are school-aged. To make a living, she sells bananas. Consolacion has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately $150 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Consolacion joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Consolacion is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for the business. This will be her 5th loan from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for banana vending

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn  N. is a married woman who lives in Purok Punta Tundo, Brgy. Pilar, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  Fishing and Pig Fattening businesses. Her husband Reymondo N., who is 47 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are between 2 and  13 years old. 

Jocelyn  joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Jocelyn  has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 8000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000, which she intends to use to buy fishing gear  so that she can continue to save up for the future and for the education of her children.

 Jocelyn  N. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

 About NWTF:

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran (pictured with the book in her hands) resides with her family in a 2-room brick house in the industrial city of Gujranwalathe in Pakistan. She explains that she moved to this area 17 years ago. She is married to T. M., who is a rickshaw driver by profession. He provides transportation services to many passengers, including school children and school teachers. They have five children: three sons and two daughters.

Sughran, meanwhile, opened a small shop in her home, where she sells food items such as biscuits, chips, and candies. For the most part, her customers are children. She also stitches clothes for her neighbors to supplement the income of her family. Although Sughran was unable to provide educational facilities for her children, she taught her oldest daughter the art of stitching. As a result, her daughter now stitches clothes and helps Sughran complete orders.

Now, Sughran is applying for a loan from a Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband. Specifically, her husband would like to buy a CNG (compressed natural gas) kit for his rickshaw. By doing so, he feels that his costs will be reduced and his rickshaw will be able to cover more ground. She is a new client of Asasah, and this is her first loan application. She hopes that it will be a profitable experience.

loans.use: To improve her husband's transportation business by purchasing a compressed natural gas kit

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma F. is from the village of Poblacion 2 Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old and married with two adult children. To make a living, Thelma owns a business planting and harvesting lanzones, a tropical fruit, for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Thelma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC and is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Thelma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Blanca Gladys

texts.es:
La Señora. Blanca B. es socia del banco comunal Corazón de María y vive en la comunidad de Yanaturo en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza de sus calles, su centro histórico, su gastronomía y la calidez de su gente.
 
Doña Blanca tiene 45 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 27, 23 y 18 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado y vive independiente, su segundo hijo trabaja y ayuda en la economía del hogar y su ultima hija es soltera y ayuda en la casa. Su esposo tiene una cooperativa de taxis y labora en su vehiculo propio, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora. Blanca se dedica al comercio, vende todo tipo de ropa, labora 5 días a la semana y 3 de ellos viaja a la costa a vender su mercadería, los dos días restantes vende en un mercado de la ciudad en donde tiene un puesto propio, no tiene un horario fijo de trabajo.

Es el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por una sobrina a formar parte del grupo. El dinero de su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más ropa para surtir su negocio para la temporada de navidad. Su meta es  ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Blanca B. is a member of the 'Corazón de María' (Heart of Mary) community bank and lives in Yanaturo community, in the city of Cuenca.  This city is renowned for the beauty of its streets, its historic center, its food and the warmth of its people.

Blanca is 45 years old.  She is married and has 3 children aged 27, 23 and 18.  Her eldest son is married and lives independently, her second son works and helps towards the household finances.  Her youngest, a daughter, is single and helps in the house.  Her husband has a taxi cooperative and works in his own vehicle.  Through their joint work, they have managed to build their own home.

Blanca is a saleswoman.  She sells all kinds of clothes.  She works 5 days a week.  On 3 of these days she travels to the coast to sell her merchandise.  The remaining 2 days she sells her clothes in a market in the city where she has her own stall.  She does not have fixed working hours.

This is the second loan that Blanca has had with her community bank.  She was invited to join the group by one of her nieces.  The money from her new loan will be invested in buying more clothes to stock her business for the Christmas period.  Her goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 27 años de edad, es casado y no tiene hijos dependientes, reside en el distrito de Mochumí, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en la crianza y venta de aves desde hace más de tres años. El las cría en su domicilio alimentándolas de granos y pastos naturales, cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. La actividad es una de sus principales fuentes de ingreso, por lo que siempre trata de mantener su negocio del mejor modo posible. Adicionalmente trabaja como obrero en un proyecto especial de conservación e investigación de monumentos históricos de civilizaciones pre-incaicas (abundantes en la zona).

El desea adquirir más animales y alimentos, todo ello con la finalidad de mejorar su negocio y percibir mayores ganancias al momento de realizar sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Carlos, 27, is married and does not have any dependent children.  He lives in Mochumí district, a fairly active farming area located in Lambayeque province, half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

He has raised barnyard fowl to sell for the last three years.  He raises them at home feeding them grains and natural grasses.  When they reach a good level of development he sells them to merchants that tend to come by the area where he lives.  This activity is one of his main sources of income so he always strives to manage it in the best possible way.  He also works as a laborer for a special project to study and conserve historical pre-Incan monuments (which are quite abundant in the area).

He wants to acquire more animals and animal feed in order to improve his business and earn higher profits from his sales.

He has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan.

loans.use: To buy animals and animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 27-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two children. He works as a products distributor and he uses a delivery van as his mean of transport. He delivers various types of products to different places. He obtained his first Kiva loan and he was a very good client with payments on time. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to make the necessary repairs on his vehicle and replace his van’s trunk with a new one to preserve his products in a good and healthy space.

loans.use: to make the necessary repairs on his vehicle

loans.name: Narcisa De Las Mercedes

texts.es:
En el sector conocido como el Cadí de  la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Juntas Creceremos, este lugar es muy hermoso y las personas muy agradables.

La señora Narcisa es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos y por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos. Tiene  51 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 5 hijas los cuales ya son mayores de edad y están casadas,  con ella viven tres nietos de 18, 16 y 11 años los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo. Además de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Sus productos los recibe en su casa y lo que es ropa en el centro en una distribuidora. Entre lo que más vende están los cosméticos, cremas, perfumes y ropa de damas.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa de mujeres. Sus sueños son arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
In the area known as Cadi in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabi, known for many years as the city of the Tamarind royalty, the Juntas Creceremos (Together We Grow) Community Bank meets every 15 days. This place is very lovely and the people very friendly.

Narcisa is a founding member of the community bank and she likes it because the interest rates are very low and also because of the resources for going after loans. She is 51 years old. She is married, and from this marriage she has five daughters who are all grown and married. Three grandchildren live with her; they are 18, 16, and 11 years old and go to high school and elementary school. Her husband works in agriculture.

She is a housewife, and to make her own money she sells clothing by catalog as well as Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women's accessories). She works three days a week. She delivers her products on credit and collects each week or every 15 days, whichever her customers want. She receives her (Yanbal) products at home and the clothing at a distribution center. She mostly sells cosmetics, lotions, perfumes, and women's clothes.

This loan is to purchase perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and women's clothes. Her dream is to organize her home.

loans.use: Buy perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and women's clothes

loans.name: Juana Paula

texts.es: La señora Juana Paula es soltera labora como cajera, no tiene personas dependientes es el segundo préstamo que solicita, para mejorar su vivienda la obra a realizar es cambio de techo y paredes, para eso comprara cin, perlìnes, cemento, bloque.
texts.en: Juana Paula is single and she works as a cashier. She doesn't have dependents and this is the second loan she requests. She will make some home improvements, especially the upgrading of the roof and walls. For this she will purchase zinc, steel beams, cement, and construction blocks.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Sankeita Enole

texts.en: Sankeita Enole S. is 34 years old, married to Sayianka S., and is the mother of four school-going children. For the last five years, Sankeita has been farming in Narok getting good returns. She learned about KADET through an awareness campaign done by KADET staff in her area. This will be her first loan, which she intend to use to prepare the land for wheat. She will plough the profits she hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan back into the business. Her future dream is to buy a bigger piece of land where she will practice commercial farming. Sankeita is hardworking and only needs the resources to attain her goals.

loans.use: To prepare the land for planting wheat

loans.name: Deymi Group

texts.es:
El grupo Deymi lo conforman tres féminas trabajadoras, joviales y emprendedoras una de ellas es Kennys  Ocarina Norori de 23 años hace tres años inicio vendiendo tortas de papa y poco a poco fue aumentando y diversificando su negocio en la actualidad tiene una comideria, vende fresco y una pequeña venta.
Ella tiene tres hijos de 7, 4 y 3 años quienes son su inspiración y sueña en tener una gran pulpería.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Demi B. de 22 años vende frijoles cocidos hace 5 años y tiene una pequeña venta la cual sueña en tener una micelania, Ana Pavón Norori vende ropa y plata su meta a corto plazo es tener una vitrina en su casa surtida y Aracely N. B. vende verduras y frutas negocio que espera ver crecer.
texts.en:
The Deymi group is comprised of three hard-working, jovial, and enterprising women.  Kennys Ocarina Norori, age 23, is one of them.  Three years ago she started selling potato cakes.  Little by little she was expanding and diversifying her business.  Now she has an eatery, sells soft drinks, and has a small sales business.

She has three children; ages 7, 4, and 3; and they are her inspiration.  She dreams of having a big grocery store.

Another member of the group, 22 year old Demi B., has been selling cooked beans for five years.  She has a small sales business, and she dreams of having a general store.  Ana Pavón Norori, also a member, sells clothes and silver.  Her short term goal is to have a display case in her stocked house.  The other member, Aracely N. B., sells fruits and vegetables.  She hopes to see her business grow.

loans.use: Basic grains

loans.name: Amilcar Anibal

texts.es: Amílcar O. T. es un joven de 25 años que  vive con su cónyuge y su único hijo recién nacido en el municipio de Soledad, departamento del Atlántico; allí tiene un negocio de confecciones,  que nació cuando un familiar lo impulsó a hacerlo   para lograr el sostenimiento de su  hogar, cuando no conseguía trabajo como empleado. Amílcar tiene muchos sueños como el de terminar de adecuar su casa y su local, para ofrecerle un mejor servicio a sus clientes como estrategia de incremento de estos en  número y en calidad. Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con este su credikiva, comprará materias primas e insumos como telas, hilos,  botones, correderas, broches entre otros, para fabricar vestidos que estan de moda. Su principal desafío es tener el capital suficiente para poder responder  siempre y oportunamente con lo que sus clientes necesitan. Este es justamente su meta cuando reciba su credikiva, porque con él logrará fabricar productos modernos con mayor rotación, lo cual generará que el retorno de su inversión sea mas rápido.
texts.en:
Amilcar O. T., 25, lives with his wife and their only son, a newborn, in the town of Soledad, department of Atlántico. He owns a clothing business, which he started when a family member encouraged him to do so in order to support his household, when he wasn't able to find a job.  Amilcar has many dreams, such as finishing his home and business premises in order to provide his customers with better service and as a strategy to increase their numbers and quality. 

This is his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With his Kiva loan he will buy raw materials and inputs such as fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, clasps and more to make fashionable dresses with. His main challenge is having enough capital to respond promptly to the demands coming from his customers. This is precisely his goal when he obtains his Kiva loan, because it will enable him to manufacture trendy products with a higher rotation, which will increase his return on investment.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, clasps and more.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie E., from the village of Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, is 34 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Virgie owns and operates a business venture raising pigs for sale. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

Virgie joined GDMPC In 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC, she is now requesting her fourth loan for 5000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Virgie plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership consists mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Ana Candelaria

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo encontramos un lugar conocido como los arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Generación. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lindo lugar conocimos a la señora Ana. Ella tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y  tienen dos hijos ya mayores de edad pero que aún viven en su casa. Su marido es pescador.

Es un ama de casa que para ayudarse y ayudar a su marido se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, tiene un pequeño local en su casa aunque a veces también sale a recorrer ciudad. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 16h00, sus hijos a veces le ayudan cuando  están desocupados. Su mercadería la comprar cada fin de mes en Guayaquil. Lleva 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad, nos cuenta que lo que ella más vende es ropa de mujer.

Con este crédito va a comprar pantalones, vestidos, blusas y camisetas. Este es el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta los créditos ya que son de gran ayuda.

Su sueño tener una boutique.
texts.en:
In the Crucita parish of the Portoviejo Canton we find a place known as "Los Arenales". Here, every two weeks, the members of the "Nueva Generación" communal bank conduct their meeting. This location is known for its beautiful beaches, gastronomy and warmth of its people.

Here we meet Mrs. Ana who is 56 years old, married and has two adult children still living at home.  Her husband is a fisherman.

She is a homemaker who, in order to earn an income and help her husband, sells all kinds of clothing out of a small stall in her home.  Sometimes whe also sells door-to-door.  She works every day from 8:30 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. and receives the help of her children when they are not busy.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil at the end of each month and has been in business for 20 years.  Her best-selling merchandise is women's clothing.

She plans to use the loan to buy trousers, dresses, blouses and t-shirts.  This is her second loan through the communal bank which she feels is a great support.

Her dream is to have a boutique one day.

loans.use: To buy trousers, dresses, blouses and t-shirts

loans.name: Duval Enrique

texts.es: Duval Enrique se dedica al destace de cerdos. Tiene más 11 años que se dedica a este negocio. El tiempo que ha adquirido con este negocio ha sido muy importantes, ya que la permitido obtener experiencia con sus clientes y el negocio. Duval tiene un hijo a su cargo tiene que brindarle estudios, alimentos y vestimenta ya que él es un padre responsable y quiere otorgarle a su hijo lo necesario. El motivo de este crédito es para la compra de mas cerdos, alimentos para ellos mismos y poder invertir en su negocio.
texts.en: Duval Enrique's business is slaughtering pigs.  He has been in this business for more than 11 years.  The length of time he has been in this business is very important as it has allowed him to gain experience with his customers and his business.  Duval has one child in his care who he has to provide with an education, food and clothes.  He is a responsible father and would like to provide for his son's needs.  Duval is requesting this loan to buy more pigs, feed for the pigs, and to invest in his business.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and feed for them

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 36 years old and is married with 3 children. With 2 children in school, Flora works very hard to provide for them.

Flora runs a sari-sari(variety) store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to to buy additional items to sell like candies and sardines in her sari-sari store.

Flora has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, cream and sugar. 

In the future Flora would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine, who was born in 1975, is married to Mr. Napoleon and has six children, four of whom are younger than 15. They all live in a three-room apartment in the Tumuku Belo subdivision. Irine was having difficulties in life so a friend took her to GHAPE in 2009, and she received a loan of 50,000 XAF which she used to buy and sell Irish potatoes and beans, leading her to success in life.
 
Since Irine had a lot of success, she needs to expand. Therefore, she is applying for a second loan to buy more beans and potatoes and to add goats. She knows that she will succeed since she succeeded with the first loan and more people are demanding her goods. Irine is really helping the community since she has reduced people's distance to the market and the goods are in constant supply. Deaths have been the only challenge Irine has faced in life. The profit from this loan will help her expand her business and keep up her family's welfare. The training, the gradual repayment of loans and the low interest rates are the reasons that Irine prefers loans from GHAPE.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.
