Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients

loans.use: to buy potatoes and beans for resale.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Sem, age 29, has been working in the crop-planting business in Prey Chor district for many years. She owns a plot of farmland that her parents provided to her. In order to make additional income, she also breeds a few piglets in a cage behind her house. From this, she can make an average of US$2.50 per day to cover her family's financial expenses. For additional income, her husband has been employed as a domestic construction worker and earns a profit of about US$5 per day. Sem will use this loan to buy additional small pigs for feeding. With the rest of the loan, she will mend her old house. The photo shows Sem with her youngest child in front of her house.

loans.use: to buy additional small pigs for feeding as well as mending her old house.

loans.name: Kimya Plus Group

texts.en:
Chantal is the leader of the community bank named “Kimya Plus.” It is composed of 13 members united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their individual businesses.

Chantal is 41 years old and the married mother of six children between the ages of five and 5 and 19. Two of her children go to school. Chantal sells second-hand clothing west of Kinshasa and has been active in her business since 2006. She began her business selling peanuts. Chantal joined one of Hope’s groups (a DRCongo microfinance program) in 2010 to expand her business, and has previously received four loans that she has successfully repaid. Thanks to Hope’s loans, Chantal’s business has prospered and generates a weekly profit of 60 USD. 

Chantal is requesting a loan to buy a bundle of second-hand clothing to resell at a profit to increase her capital. Her ambition is to someday open a drugstore due to the high demand for medicine in her community.

loans.use: to purchase a bundle of second-hand clothing to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. She has a retail shop that sells canned goods, beverages and snacks. She has had this business for two years. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods and detergents. Judith is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and detergents.

loans.name: Otgontsetseg

texts.en: Otgontsetseg is 32 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in Gobisumber province of Mongolia. Her husband works as a fireman. She manages a souvenir trading business at her store. She started her business four years ago and is planning to continue her business in the future. She purchases her products once every two weeks either from China or Ulaanbaatar city. She would like to receive loans with low interest rate. She is a responsible businesswoman who says, "My store locates near secondary school and because of it I had been able to build strong customer base." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventories in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory to sell

loans.name: Lino

texts.es: Lino tiene 47 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de ganado y cerdo. hace mas de 14 años que tiene este negocio, Lino tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. el financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de vacas, toros y chivos. esta no es la primera experiencia que ha obtenido con financiamientos pues ha sido muy elemental para que su negocio siga adelante. el sueño de Lino es de darles a sus hijos una mejor edudacion.
texts.en:
Lino is 47 years old and engages in buying and selling cattle and pigs. He has been in this business for more than 14 years. Lino has two dependent children who are under his responsibility.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy cows, bulls, and goats. This is not the first time he has obtained financing, since it has been essential in keeping his business in operation. Lino dreams of providing his children a better education.

loans.use: to buy cows, bulls, and goats.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is a farmer working in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. He is 41 years old and single. Francisco has been in the business of rice farming for 15 years. He earns about 10000 PHP per month.

Francisco plans to use his loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Francisco hopes to have a stable business and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar is a widow and she is 62 years old. Gohar lives in Vanadzor city with her daughter and two under-aged grandchildren. 

More than 6 years ago Gohar established her own business, which allows her to provide her family. Gohar sells men’s and women’s clothes, outerwear and handbags as well. She buys merchandise from a neighbor country and sells it at her shop.  Her daughter takes care of her children and helps Gohar as far as possible. 

Gohar is seeking a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy some outwear and autumn clothes for her business.  This is Gohar’s 4th loan from Nor Horizon and she has never delayed her repayments.

loans.use: To buy some outwear and autumn clothes for her business.

loans.name: Eleuteria   Amalia

texts.es: La señora Eleuteria es cliente  antigua   que esta en la segunda secuencia de  su crédito,  la señora es separada tiene tres hijos   a quienes les sustenta económicamente  y a parte de sus hijos  le ayuda  a su Mamá con los gastos del hogar, ella es muy trabajadora siempre esta viendo a que actividad dedicarse ya que sus ingresos no le alcanzan ahora esta incursionando en la venta de frazadas y edredones por esta época de fin de año,   vive en la ciudad de La Paz  su actividad principal es  una tienda de barrio en el mismo lugar de su domicilio,  El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de  frazadas para su segundo negocio. La Sra. Eleuteria  se siente  contenta  por el apoyo que la institución le brindo.
texts.en:
Eleuteria is an old client. She is in the second cycle of her loans. She is separated and has three children who depend on her financially, and besides helping her children she also helps her mother with household expenses.

She is hardworking and always looking for an opportunity to earn income because her earnings are not enough. Now she is venturing into the sale of blankets and quilts for the cold season at the end of the year. She lives in the city of La Paz and her main activity is a neighborhood store near her home. She will invest the money from the loan into purchasing blankets for her second business. Eleuteria is happy for the support the communal bank offers.

loans.use: to buy blankets and casual shirts for her second business

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred, 43 years old, is married and has two children. She has operated a store for almost 5 years, selling chemicals and fertilizers to farmers to treat pests and insects. Since the primary source of income in her neighborhood comes from rice and corn farming, she established a store selling chemicals and fertilizers. 

Mildred wants to increase her sales but has insufficient funds. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy insecticides, herbicides, pesticides, seeds and fertilizers to sell in her store. Mildred aims for a progressive life for her family. She keeps making better sales and increasing her earnings to save for her children's college education.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, herbicides, pesticides, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 29 years old and lives in Misom, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has one child.
Fely sells assorted grocery items to earn a living and has had this business for 4 years. Each month, she earns PHP 4500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14900 to purchase 10 boxes of assorted groceries.
Fely has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: To purchase  10 boxes of assorted groceries

loans.name: Ma. Clarence

texts.en: Ma. Clarence is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Ma. Clarence has a shop that sells hot dogs, homemade sausage or longganisa and peanut butter. She has had this business for nine years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos to buy raw ingredients needed for making homemade sausage. Ma. Clarence has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Ma. Clarence hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making homemade sausage.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es: La socia tambien tiene su negocio D. venta D. materiales D. construccion, ela a ampliado su negocio y en esta ocasion desea invertir en la compra D. cemento, fierros, arena; La socia tambien venD. materiales D. ferreteria como clavos, pinturas entre otors. La socia requiere el prestamo para invertir en la compra D. materiales para la implementacion D. su negocio D. venta D. materiales y ferreteria. La socia comprara arena, cemento, clavos, pinturas entre otros materiales.
texts.en: The member also has her building materials and supplies business.  She has expanded the business and on this occasion wants to invest in the purchase of cement, rebar and sand.  She also sells hardware supplies like nails and paint, among others.  She needs the loan to invest in materials to stock her building materials and hardware supplies business.  She will buy cement, sand, nails and paint, among other materials.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, nails, paint and other materials.

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es: Dionisio de 41 años de edad, casado con delfina 39 años de edad, que fruto de este amor que se tienen, el resultado son 5 hermosos hijos. Junto habitan en el distrito de Pichari. Dionisio desde muy joven empezó ayudando a sus padres en su actividad agrícola, pero el tenía la meta de tener su propio negocio, que es el tener una tienda. Sin embargo necesita de capital para montar una, así que siguio la actividad tradicional de la familia. Desde entocnes cultiva y produce cacao y estebia, por lo cual está obteniendo buenos resultandos económicos, sin embargo, necesita trabajar más para obtener más dinero y así tener su tienda de abarrotes para que sea su esposa quien lo administre. Por lo general Dionicio trabaja con la ayuda de sus peones quienes le facilitan en la extracción de sus productos, para luego comercializarlos en el distrito de Pichari. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que Dionicio se compromete una vez más en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles comprará fertilizantes para sus plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en:
41-year-old Dionisio is married to 39-year-old Delfina.  As the fruit of their love, they have five beautiful children and they live together in Pichari district.  When he was very young, Dionisio started helping his parents with their farming.  He had a goal of owning his own business (a store) but needed capital to set one up.  For this reason, he continued working in the family's traditional business.  He grows and produces cacao and stevia which give him good financial results.  However, he needs to work more in order to make more money so that he can set up a grocery store for his wife to run.  In general, Dionisio works with the help of farm laborers who help him to pick his crops so that he can sell them in Pichari district.

This will be Dionisio's second loan from MFP.  He pledges once more to make his repayments punctually.  He will use his 1,500 soles to buy fertilizers for his cacao fields.

loans.use: to buy sacks of natural fertilizer

loans.name: Genzell Mauricio

texts.es: El señor Genzell a sus 43 años de edad, es padre de un hijo de 6 años, trabaja como ayudante de construcción y de manera independiente tiene un cultivo de papa y una chiva en la finca donde vive. El señor Genzell tiene amplia experiencia en el oficio puesto que ha trabajado durante 20 años en una finca. El señor Genzell desea comprar una vaca lechera que le permita generar otros ingresos para el sustento familiar en especial para su único hijo, puesto que su esposa murió al momento del parto de su hijo. El sueño del señor Genzell es ver a su hijo realizado como persona y como profesional, puesto que el señor Genzell tiene la responsabilidad de ser padre y madre a la vez.
texts.en: Genzell, at age 43, is the father of a six-year-old son.  He works as a construction helper and he has an independent potato crop and a goat on the farm where he lives.  Genzell has plenty of experience in the job since he has worked for 20 years on a farm.  Genzell wants to buy a dairy cow that will permit him to generate more income for the support of his family, especially for his only son, since his wife died in childbirth.  Genzell's dream is to see his son mature as an individual and as a professional.  This is because he has the responsibility of being a father and a mother at the same time.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is from the village of San Juan. She is 47 years old, married, and has two adult-aged children. Amelita owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Amelita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately P4,000 a month from it.

Amelita is asking for a loan to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and engage in business activities. Amelita is requesting a new loan of P25,000 which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods, spices, drinks, and snack foods.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, spices, drinks, and snack foods for her store.

loans.name: Jumaa

texts.en:
Jumaa is a 36-year-old married man who lives with his wife and two children in the Mafraq district. His job as a member of the civil defence helps to support his household and cover his daily expenses, but it hasn’t dampened his ambitions to do better and finish his education to obtain a B.A. degree. All the obstacles in front of him, including his age and work, did not prevent him from registering with a university and taking political sciences as a major to improve his lifestyle and provide more for his family.
Therefore, Jumaa would like a loan to pay his university fees and continue with his dream of attaining a better life for him and his family.

loans.use: to  pay a semester's fees.

loans.name: Roderic

texts.en:
Roderic is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 3 children. 
Roderic is providing motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.
Roderic has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Roderic hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.

loans.name: Nicolas' Group

texts.en:
Nicolas and Marciano live in Oaxaca, México in a small community called El Paraíso in Santa María Tiltepec. In el Paraíso, they just got access to the electric grid in early 2012, however the service is extremely unreliable. They continue to rely on candles when the lights go out.They mention that due to their geographical conditions, sometimes rains can last up to 8 days and there are black-outs during the rains. They believe a solar system will have great value through savings on their energy costs and will eliminate the need for the use of candles in their homes. Additionally, it can prevent them from running out of battery on their cell-phones and have no way of communicating with the nearby centers. 

Marciano works weaving hammocks which he then sells in the nearby touristic centers. During May-October, the rainy season, it is difficult for him to work the extra hours needed to fit the demand in the summer because of the intermittent energy access. With your loan they will have the security of having everyday light and energy for their mobile phones, ensuring an adequate place to work, study and spend quality time with their family.

loans.use: Nicolas and Marciano each purchase a solar home system to have reliable energy access.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has a stand where she sells fresh fruit and juice. Maria used to sell vegetables from her stand, but because profits were not sufficient she and her husband decided to try something different. After being forced to move from their old location because they did not have government permits, they moved the stand to a location closer to their home. Maria and her husband prepare the juice and fruit salad in the mornings. While Maria stays at the stand, her husband travels around the community in his tricycle cart selling the fresh juice and fruit salad.

Maria is seeking a loan because she wants to make significant improvements to her business. Along with buying a new juicer, Maria wants to purchase a new tricycle cart for her brother to use. This way, her business will have three points of sale and they can increase their production and revenue.

Maria is 35 years old, she is married, and she has 3 children. They live in her husband’s family house where they pay rent. Maria’s goal is to save up enough money to buy herself and her children a home.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Maria wants to buy a new cart for her brother to use to sell fruit. She also wants to purchase a juicer.

loans.name: Karoline

texts.en: The smile on Karoline’s face easily tells you the kind of person she is. She is a 65-year-old married woman with four children. They live together in the village of Salamumu Tai. Karoline was a primary school teacher before she retired in 2005. She joined the SPBD Program because she would like to make use of some talents that she has other than teaching. This will also generate extra income to help support her family. Her belief is that her two children who are attending school are still her responsibility. Although the other two are working, their weekly wages are not enough to cover family responsibilities. Karoline's fifth loan of $1250.00 was used to buy other stuff for her business and for home improvement.

loans.use: To purchase fabric paints.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Milicent A. is a 31-year-old entrepreneur. She lives in the Manyatta slum in Kisumu, Kenya with her husband and three school-age children. She used the funds from her first two loans to invest in this small shop (pictured) adjacent to her home, where she sells the daily necessities like bread, flour, cooking oil and soap.

Over the past two years she has increased her daily income by 100% and managed to save a bit of her profits. She plans to supplement her business with the sale of cereals, especially beans and rice, which are in high demand. With loan of US $600, she will purchase additional stock and obtain supplies that are in high demand within her community.

loans.use: To purchase cereals to boost her business

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara A. S. is a Mayan woman who lives high above the beautiful Lake Atitlan in Guatemala. Such a beautiful place hides the reality of her poverty. She is 49, married and has ten children, the youngest being 6 years old. Her daily struggles to feed her family and to be able to send all the children to school are immense. Though her husband works as a driver, that does not provide enough to sustain them so they must both work hard to provide for their large family.

Ever since her first loan 6 years ago, she has been making cheese and selling milk. She started her business using her first loan to buy a cow. That cow grew to an enormous size and had a calf. With sadness, she explained that the mother cow died suddenly, leaving her with a 21-day-old calf, which she bottle-fed until it could make it on its own. This calf is now fully grown and has produced a calf of its own.

Besides making cheese and selling milk, she has bought 10 baby chicks. In three months, when they are grown, she will sell them for about US$13.

Though she never went to school or learned to read or write, she is able to speak two languages: Her native language is Quiche and she also speaks Spanish, which she learned as a young girl when she started working as a housekeeper at the age of 7.

With this next loan she will buy a male baby calf, raise it and sell it for meat when it is mature. With this increase in capital she rests assured that the business will prosper and expand, which will result in her being able to send all her kids to school and provide proper nutrition for her family.

loans.use: Buy a calf to raise

loans.name: Nazile

texts.en:
Nazile G. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict zone, Lachin district. She settled with her family in Sumgait city in 1993. She is 43 years old, married and has two children. Nazile works with her husband and she began her business with $300 own capital in 1999. She used to have difficulty in covering her family's consumption needs for medication, clothes, school etc. 

Nazile first borrowed $300 from Normicro and with it she began to sell meat. The second time she borrowed $500 and she used it to rent a trade place to sell the meat. The loans were paid back timely. The third time she applied for a loan of $800 from Normicro and bought a work place. She expanded her business and increased the income of her business and improved her family's livelihood. 

Now, Nazile would like to receive a $1,000 loan in order to acquire 3 small calves and food for them. She thinks that this will further improve the living condition of her family.

loans.use: Nazile would like to increase business in her butcher's shop.

loans.name: Mussarat

texts.en: I am Mussarat B. .I am married and I live in a small rented house with my husband and eight children. My husband works at a local steel factory for a meager income. We were making very hard to manage our living in such a scanty pay.  In order to increase the household income my son started a used clothing business, a couple of years ago with the loan we took from Asasah, a microfinance institution. The business is flourishing slowly since then and has enabled us to uplift our financial status substantially. With the increased income   I was also able to get my daughter a medical treatment for a chronic disease of intestines. My son now requires a loan of US$500 to buy used clothes in bulk which will be cheaper and will enable to earn more profits. We plan to save the extra profits and buy a house of our own.

loans.use: Buy used clothing in bulk

loans.name: Arzuman

texts.en: Arzuman (his son is pictured) is 38 years old and lives in Salyan region, in the Yenikand village. He has 3 children. Ten years ago he started a farming business. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides for improving his business.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in Natural Medicines

loans.name: Yan

texts.en: Yan T., 46, is married to Anton and has four children. She runs a beauty salon from her home and could earn $25 a week. But the income is not regular, fluctuating according to how many clients she has. She is a member of MBK and would like a loan of $125 to buy salon equipment, add to her business capital, and make her client base more stable. She agrees to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To buy salon equipment

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is a living example of a dedicated, passionate, hard-working and successful businesswoman in the area of Alcaviejo, Los Alcarrizos in the city of Santo Domingo. She owns a clothing shop and she sells toasted bread with cheese or ham. She also sells natural juices and white and black coffee.

Damaris explains that she started her business a few years ago, and she was operating it in a pretty small locale in a very isolated place. After a period of efforts and sacrifices, she managed to move her business forward and get a better place close to the most of the community’s residents.

Damaris also thanks her lucky stars that she could finally have a son last year. “I’d been praying to God a lot to give me that precious a gift,” she says.

With her loan, the entrepreneur will buy clothing in bulk and raw materials to continue her businesses.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and bulk to restock her promising business.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Mrs. Sem P. is a 45-year-old farmer. She lives in Dai Boun Village, Kampong Cham Province, earning about $5.00 per day. Her husband, Mr. Phan Chep, is also a farmer and earns about $5.00 per day. Together they have five children, one of whom is married. They request a loan of $1,200 to purchase tools and hard stone to create and sell mills. This loan will expand the capital for their business and get increase their income. P., Chep and their children appear in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase tools and hard stone to create and sell mills

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Charcoal is one of the main sources of fire in most Ghanaian homes. This has created large market and demand for it.

Diana, a thirty-year-old mother with three children, has been selling charcoal for eight years. Her charcoal business has been supporting her family. She wants to use her loan to buy more charcoal, because, as she reports, she is running out of stock.

Diana is a member of the Commitment group. Members of the group agree in social principle to guarantee for each other to re pay the loan.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa started her business in order to help her husband with the household expenses, especially since her mother lives with them and she is an elderly woman that requires special care and medications.

After getting married, she wanted to have her own source of income to help her husband with the household expenses as well as being able to help her mother who depends on Teresa, since she is the only woman of the house and her brothers live outside the city. They also want to provide a good education for their son.

She got started in February 2006, after a neighbor told her that the sale of used clothing was a good business. She put the clothing on a small table right outside her home and also on the gate of her home. She purchased the clothes from the neighbor, who receives large shipments of clothes she buys in bulk in border towns near the United States.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $300, which she will pay in 3 months. She will use it to purchase more seasonal clothes since during this time of the year more people buy summer clothing such as shorts, bermuda sorts, capri pants, blouses, skirts, etc. In this manner she will be able to offer more variety to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Teresa inició el negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa ya que vive con ellos su mamá que es una persona my avanzada de edad que necesita de cuidados especiales y medicinas.

Después de que se caso quería tener una ingreso propio para ayudar a suesposo con los gastos de la casa y ayudar también a su mamá ya que ella depende de Tere, pues es la única mujer de la casa y sus hermanos viven fuera de la ciudad, además de que quieren darle una buena educación a su hijo. Comenzo en Febrero de 2006, cuando una vecina le comentó que la venta de ropa usada era un buen negocio,entonces afuera de su casa en la entrada puso una mesita en donde coloco ropa y también en el portón, ropa que la misma vecina le vendió ya que a ella le llegan grandes bultos que compra en ciudades fronterizas con los Estados Unidos.

Solicita un prestamo por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar más ropa de temporada, ya que en esta época del año la gente compra mucha ropa fresca como shorts, bermudas, pescadores, blusas, faldas, etc y de esta forma tendré un mejor surtido que ofrecer a mis clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Dan Thi Nghiem's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dan Thi N. (SEDA ID: 020012) is 23 year old. She borrows 2,242,000 Vietnamese Dong to buy inventory wood, producing table and chair sets. She is also raising pigs to have some extra income. Her 2 sons are still at school age. Her family incomes are about 110,000 Vietnamese Dong, approximately $6.93, per day. She has participated in one loan term and repaid the loan on time.

Mrs. Hoa Thi Nguyen (SEDA ID: 020014) is 24 year old. She borrows 2,242,000 Vietnamese Dong to raise pigs.

These two individuals sign a group loan contract.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nghiêm Thị Dân (MS: 020012), năm nay 23 tuổi. Chị vay 2.242.000 VND về bổ sung vốn mua gỗ để làm bàn ghế. Chị đang chăn nuôi lợn để phụ giúp gia đình có thêm thu nhập. Chị có 2 con nhỏ vẫn đang đi học. Mức thu nhập của gia đình chị khoảng 110.000 VND/ ngày. Chị đã tham gia được một chu kỳ vốn và hoàn trả rất tốt. Chị Nguyễn Thị Hoa (MS: 020014), năm nay 24 tuổi. Chị vay 2.242.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn.

loans.use: Producing table and chair sets, and raising pigs

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is married with an 18-year-old son. He has a taxi business in Ivano-Frankivsk. Ivan decided to start this business 11 years ago. His venture has seen considerable growth ever since. Ivan managed to purchase a second vehicle and hired an employee to work as a taxi driver. Currently, Ivan has about $40-60 of income daily.

Ivan is requesting a loan of 5000 Grivnas to install a new type of running gear in his vehicle to reduce his running costs. He believes better quality equipment will help him have fewer repairs, glitches and less down time. Ivan has repaid 3 previous loans to Nadiya Ukraine without any delinquencies. We believe his thorough planning and perfect credit history will secure prompt repayment of the current loan, too.

loans.use: Ivan would like to install liquefied gas running gear into his vehicle for his taxi business.

loans.name: Atokhon

texts.en:
Atokhon M. is 36 years old. He lives in Isfara town; he is married and has three children. His wife is a housekeeper. Atokhon processes and sells dried apricots in the local central market. He is experienced in the business of making dried apricots. As a rule he purchases dried apricots in the market and processes them himself.

Because he buys dried apricots wholesale, his prices are lower than regular market prices. He offers a wide assortment of goods for customers of different means. All this allows Atokhon to make his business quite successful and it brings in stable income for the family.

Today Atokhon is requesting 1500 Somoni (450 USD) for a term of 8 months. He is going to spend the loan to purchase more dried fruit to process and sell. He would like to increase his income and give his children a good education. Atokhon expresses his gratitude to everyone supporting him.

loans.use: Increasing of the range of goods to expand his business

loans.name: Fe En Marcha Group

texts.en: "Fe en Marcha" is a group of 20 very excited people. All 20 members of this group are ready to start their own businesses, and begin the process of bettering their lives. "Elena" is the group representative, and hopes to start her own cosmetics business. She is a hard worK. mother of one, and feels that this loan could be the start of a new life for her and her son. Her dream is to one day have her own thriving salon, and be able to provide a comfortable life for her family. This whole group is ready for this loan, and eager to start bettering their lives! On behalf of Elena, the group, and Esperanza International---we thank you for your support!!

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha has been selling clothes in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for seven years. She has previously taken two microloans from BRAC Tanzania, both of which she repaid successfully and on time. With this third loan she hopes to further grow her inventory and increase her profit beyond her current approximate monthly profit of $50.

Asha is 46 years old, married, and has six children, aged 7, 14, 18, 20, 21, and 25. She works for twelve hours every day.

loans.use: To buy more clothing as inventory for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Improve mechanical workshop and purchase iron supplies

loans.name: Munavvarkul

texts.en:
Munavvarkul U. is 50 years old. He is married with 3 children. Munavvarkul lives in Istaravshan, Tajikistan and has two hectares of land on which he cultivates cereals and vegetables. His wife and elder son help him on the plantation.

He now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to buy seeds to plant onions and wheat. Therefore, he has decided to ask for a loan. He will also buy fertilizers and hire some workers to cultivate his field. You could become an important part of his family's life. Munavvarkul deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history. History of note includes: it was once a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki; and the birthplace of the most famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina (Avicenna). The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have a viable business proposition when they request a loan. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and IMON will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Kanguma B South Group

texts.en:
A. Grace (back:right) is 47 years old. She is married with 8  children. She has 2 years experience selling unshelled groundnuts in Kumi and other regional  markets. She  purchases her stock from village farmers at fair rates, and resells, yielding a profit margin of 40%.

A. is using the loan proceeds to purchase a large quantity of unshelled groundnuts as she anticipates a scarcity and an increase in demand. She dreams of exporting all types of cereals to neighboring countries like Kenya and Sudan. She would like her children to finish school successfully.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of groudnuts.

loans.name: Maty

texts.fr: Maty S. est une femme mariée, mère de 08 enfants plus 02 autres dont elle a la charge. Elle souhaite avec ce prêt renforcer son activité qui consiste au commerce en détail de mil, maïs, pâte d’arachide, huile de palme. Cette activité va lui permettra de beaucoup améliorer les revenus de son ménage.
texts.en:
Maty S. is a married woman and the mother of eight children, plus two others to support. She would like to use this loan to bolster her business, which consists of retail commerce in millet, corn, peanut butter, and palm oil. This business will enable her to improve her household income a lot.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods wholesale, such as millet, corn, and peanuts for resale

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es: la Sra. Rosa Elena F. se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace 20 años, ella se levanta muy temprano para moler el maiz y luego para la produccion  de tortillas, ella vende su producto en su casa todo el dia, compra cada 8 dias lo necesario para la produccion de la semana, ella viaja al mercado de la ciudad donde compra todos los materiales necesarios para la elaboracion de las tortillas.  Tiene 3 hijas las que le ayudan en su pequeño negocio, ella es viuda su esposo murio hace 10 años, por lo que le ha tocado salir adelante sola con sus 3 hijas, todo esto gracias a su negocio. ella esta muy agradecida por haber encontrado un lugar en el cual le otorguen un credito para poder salir adelante con su negocio y con su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Elena F. has worked selling tortillas for more than 20 years. She gets up very early to grind the corn to then produce the tortillas. She sells her product in her house all day long. Each week she buys what is necessary for the week’s production. She travels to the city market where she buys all of the materials neccesary for making the tortillas. She has three daughters who help her in her small business. She is a widow as her husband died 10 years ago, which is why she has had get ahead alone with her 3 daughters, all of this thanks to her business. She is very thankful for having found a place in which they will grant her a loan to be able to advance with her business and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn, lime, firewood and water

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tools and to build a garage

loans.name: Hidaya Njema Group

texts.en:
Rehema S. is a charcoal and firewood seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 50. Every day she works at her business.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal and firewood for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Rehema S. is married, and has three children: ages 17, 13, and 9. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Mwanambashi and Rehema S.. Each woman has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business

loans.name: Mirelia Margarita

texts.es: La  Sra. Mirelia tiene su pequeño negocio de productos de consumo diario, como ser queso, mantequilla, jugos,huevos, manteca, refrescos, su negocio esta ubicado en la Colonia Jose Angel Ulloa, ya cuenta con clientes fijos, inicio hace dos años y de a poco ha ido surtiendo su negocio con la ayuda de sus esposo el cual trabaja como Agente de Seguridad, tiene dos hijos, ella va dos veces por semana al mercado para poder obtener precios mas bajos, necesita el el credito para comprar mas productos y con esto incrementar sus ingresos y poder ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, su sueño es poder hacer mas grande su negocio y ofrecer mas variedad de productos. Ella es una persona joven con mucho dinamismo, amable y responsable.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mirelia has a small business in products for daily consumption such as cheese, butter, juices, eggs, shortening, and soft drinks. Her business is located in the Colonia Jose Angel Ulloa, and right now she counts on steady customers. She started the business two years ago and little by little her business has become secure with the help of her husband who works as a security guard. They have two children. She goes twice a week to the market to buy merchandise at a much lower price. She needs this loan to buy more products and with it will increase her profits and will be able to offer a better quality of life to her children. Her dream is to be able to make her business much bigger and offer a greater variety of products. She is a friendly and responsible young person with a lot of dive.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food products for resale

loans.name: Maria Esmeralda

texts.es:
La señora Maria Esmeralda Q. A. tiene 31 años, vive en el distrito de Casa Grande, provincia de Ascope, departamento de La Libertad; Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria Completa, tiene 1 hijo que depende económicamente de ella.
Maria tiene como negocio la venta de abarrotes y de jugo en una bodega, cuando inicio tenia una bodega con pocos productos, ahora administra una bodega surtida y lo ha complementado con la venta de jugos, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Recién se ha iniciado como socia en Manuela Ramos y es miembro del Banco Comunal Romanas Luchadoras II
Con el crédito de 300 soles, lo invirtirá en la compra prendas de vestir en diferentes modelos y tallas..
Maria tiene como objetivo ampliar su bodega y poner una tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Maria Esmeralda Q. A. is 31 years old and lives in the district of Casa Grande in the province of Ascope, department of La Libertad, in Peru. She completed high school and has one son who depends on her financially. Maria has a grocery store and sells juice. When she started, she had a store with few products, now she manages a well-stocked store to which she has added juice sales. Her business is located in her home. She recently joined Manuela Ramos and is a member of the "Romanas Luchadoras II" community bank. She will use the 300 soles' loan to buy clothing in a variety of styles and sizes. Maria's goal is to expand her store and open a clothing business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухаббат – женщина , которая целыми днями торгует при входе в городскую больницу. Она продаёт фруктами и овощами. Полученный кредит она хочет использовать на закуп помидоров и различных фруктов. Она очень вежливая и доброжелательная продавщица, у которой много постоянных клиентов. На снимке Мухаббат на месте бизнеса.
texts.en:
Muhabbat is a woman who sells all day at the entrance to the city hospital. She sells fruit and vegetables. She wants to take out a loan to buy tomatoes and fruit. She is a very polite and good-natured saleswoman who has many regular customers. The picture is of Muhabbat in her place of business.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali M. sells radio sets and footwear at Abotoase, near Hohoe. Ali has received no formal education.  He is married and has 6 dependants. Ali has been selling radio and footwear for a while now. He is responsible for paying school fees for his children and other household expenses. His loan will be used to buy more radios and footwear for resale. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to invest in expanding his business and to increase his capital profits.

loans.use: To buy more radios and footwear for resale.

loans.name: Savur

texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following its development, MLF “MicroInvest” transformed into a Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. In October 2008, MLF “MicroInvest,” together with LLC “Frontiers,” founded a Limited Liability Company, Microloan Deposit-taking Organization called “Arvand.”

“Arvand” continues to carry out its mission, which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

M. Savur lives in the Zafarabad region of Tajikistan. He is married and has three daughters and a son. One of his daughters works in Arvand as the credit expert. He works in local bazaar as a clothing trader. He first applied to MicroInvest for a business-support loan in 2005 and since that time, he has been a repeat client of our loan program. After the MicroInvest transformation, Savur works with Arvand and he is glad for its co-operation.

Savur applies to Kiva for a business-development loan of 4100 STJ for 8 months to import new seasonal goods straight from suppliers to increase the business turnover.

Savur thanks Kiva for its support and small business development assistance.

loans.use: Importing new seasonal goods straight from suppliers

loans.name: Otavina

texts.en:
Otavina is a member of the Bondeni borrower group in Ilala, Iringa. She is 20 years old, married and the mother of one child. Her child is 1 year old.

Otavina started her own clothing business  clothes two years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 300,000 Tanzania Shillings (about $225).

This is Otavina’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Otavina hopes to get more food for her family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Adwenpa Group

texts.en: Akosua is 40 years old. She is a married woman with five children. Two are currently in school.  She is very dedicated to her family and business. She is a food vendor and sells rice with gravy stew at the community school where she lives. She started her operation about 20 years ago in taking care of her home. She sells on a road side in the community where she lives. Her food production is on a low scale because of inadequate funds to support her business. She wants to use the loan to buy more meat, vegetables, and bags of rice to increase her efficiency to produce in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business to raise more income to support her business growth and the children's education.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, vegetables, meat and firewood etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase cassava flour and silver fish for sale.

loans.name: Julia Violeta

texts.en:
Julia is a member of The Wheatfield village bank. She is 36 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children who are 15 and 6. Both of her children are studying in public schools.

Julia has been practicing her profession as a primary school teacher for three years as well as working in the evenings selling food with the help of her sister. She sells chicken soup and fried liver out of her home. Her husband is a taxi driver and works during the day.

Julia needs a loan of 800 soles to buy supplies such as rice and noodles in order to make the food she sells. Her dream is to have a restaurant of her own.

loans.use: To buy supplies to make the food she sells

loans.name: Elmer Antonio

texts.es: El Joven Elmer Antonio C., tiene la edad de 24 años, habita en el barrio, San Caralampio, junto a sus padres los cuales le apoyan,  le brindaron un terreno para que lo trabaje y salga hacia delante por si mismo, sus planes son poder establecerlo de plátano y piña, le agradece a Afodenic por su aprobación y la confianza de su crédito ya que con este financiamiento logrará sus planes y con una buena asistencia agrícola podrá obtener una buena producción. Antes de que se dedicara a la agricultura el Joven C. se dedica a la construcción y es sus tiempos libres le apoyaba a sus padre en el campo. Con este crédito comprara abonos y venenos para  aplicar a la producción y poder mejorar el cultivo. Agradece a la institución por hacer las mejoras a sus cultivos, el cual espera vender a buen precio sus futos.

loans.use: Comprar insumos y fertilizantes para aplicar al cultivo

loans.name: Mohamed Boi

texts.en:
Mohamed is 36 years old and is married with three kids. He is engaged in the rental of DVDs and also operates a phone centre.

For the past seven years, Mohamed has been selling and renting DVDs.  Prior to his current location, Mohamed sold and rented DVDs from his backpack, traveling to his customers. He was constantly moving around to meet his customers until he rented a shop with money he saved over the years. He is very hardworking and works from 8:00 am to 11:00 p.m. daily. His wife usually assists him in the shop.

Mohamed is seeking a loan to buy more DVDs to stock his shop and to buy more call cards to better operate his phone centre. He hopes that the profits from the loan will be used to pay for his children’s schooling.  This is Mohamed’s first loan.

loans.use: To purchase call cards and DVDs

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred S. M. is single and has four children. He has received technical education. Alfred sells premix fuel for fishermen at Elmina near Bantama, which he has been doing since 2002. Alfred uses his income to pay school fees, utility bills and general upkeep of the home.  

Alfred will use the loan to purchase more premix fuel for resale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Alfred plans to save and reinvest.

loans.use: To purchase more feul for resale

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen T. lives in the village of Misom, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old, married and has four school-aged children. She makes a living as the owner and operator of an "okay-okay" shop where she sells clothes. Helen has been in this business for more than two years.

Earlier this year, Helen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living conditions and ability to engage in business. She is applying for her first loan from GDMPC, for 5,000 PHP, to buy additional clothing to sell. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to pay her children's tuition. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional clothing to sell

loans.name: Amelia Salomao Chambrando

texts.pt:
Amélia Salomão Chambrando N. nasceu na Província de Inhambane, tem 30 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 2 filhos gémeos de 7 anos de idade a estudar. Fez somente 7ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições. Vive na casa própria com seus filhos, não sustenta mais ninguém. 

Saiu de Inhambane com os pais ainda criança para cidade de Maputo devido a guerra de destabilização. Tem um negocio próprio há mais de 2 anos sem empregada e trabalha cerca de 10 horas por dia. Vende peixe e recargas de telemóveis e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 1.500.00mt por dia que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa cerca de 400.00mt através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma vizinha e este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 8.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (peixe, recargas para telemóveis, batata e outros) para aumentar o volume de negocio e ganhar dinheiro razoável para garantir toda assistência e educação aos seus filhos.
 
No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para construir uma mini mercearia na sua própria casa.
texts.en:
Amélia Salomão Chambrando was born in the Inhambane province. She is 30 years old, and a single mother of twins, who are 7 years old and going to school. She did only up to the 7th grade and stopped studying for a lack of conditions to do so. She lives in her own house with her children and does not support anyone else. She left Inhambane with her parents when she was still a child to the city of Maputo, due to the destabilization war. She has her own business for more than 2 years, with no employees, and works about 10 hours a day. She sells fish and mobile phone credit recharges, being able to earn around MZN 1,500.00 a day. She applies her earnings on the house expenses and saves about MZN 400.00 through Xitique (traditional rotational savings system). She has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through a neighbor. This is her first loan, of MZN 8,000.00, with which she intends to buy products (fish, mobile recharge cards, potatoes and others) in order to increase her business and earn enough money to guarantee support and education to her children. In the future, she intends to request more loans to build a small grocery market in her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and Selling of products (fish and others)

loans.name: Umar

texts.en:
For the past 13 years, Umar has worked in agriculture and the raising of sheep. He raises sheep which he cares for greatly since thanks to them, he can cover his household expenses through the milk which he sells in the mornings. Umar showed us his animals with great happiness as his sheep were about to be vaccinated against the various sicknesses that affect that type of animal. For Umar, it is very important to work his land and raise his animals which is why he is currently seeking a loan in order to expand his business. This will help his family generate additional income. We appreciate your support for Umar’s projects.   
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing additional sheep

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es: Sandra Elizabeth H. de 43 años de edad, reside en Cuscatancingo, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador, Su grupo familiar esta conformado por su esposo y sus dos hijos de 8 y 4 años de edad. Ella posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos, la cual le deja muy buenas ganancias, debido a que es una de las tiendas más fuertes del sector. Sandra solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más productos para surtir la tienda, así mismo desea comprar frutas y verduras al por mayor para poder vender otro tipo de productos en su tienda y de esta manera mejorar sus ganancias, las cuales serán de gran beneficio para su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra Elizabeth H., 43 years old, lives in Cuscatancingo, located in the San Salvador department. Her family is composed of her husband and her two sons, aged 8 and 4. She owns a store in which she markets perishable goods, which gives her a good profit, since it's one of the most solid shops in the area. Sandra asks for a loan with which she can buy more products to stock up the store. Likewise, she wants to purchase fruits and vegetables wholesale so she can sell different kinds of products in her store and this way increase her profit, which will be very helpful to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of perishable products

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn B. is from the village of Gango, in the city of Ozamiz. She is 33 years old, married, and has three school-age children. To earn a living, Roselyn owns and operates a "sari-sari" store and a vegetable-selling business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different vegetables to her local community members. Roselyn has been engaged in this line of business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month on account of these activities.

In 2004, Roselyn joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) to gain access to financial services. As a result, she was able to engage in business activities and to improve her family's standard of living. Notably, Roselyn recently repaid a prior loan in the amount of 25,000 PHP from PMPC. Roselyn is now requesting another loan, this time in the amount of 50,000 PHP ($1,100), which will be used to buy housing materials for some much-needed home improvement work. This loan would be the sixth loan taken out by Roselyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor by using the Grameen micro-finance model.

loans.use: To purchase materials for much-needed home improvement work

loans.name: Gerardo Marcelino

texts.es:
El señor Gerardo M. L. es trabajador del Minsa Posoltega desde hace 21 años donde se desempeña como Técnico ETV para sector rural. Es casado y con un hijo bajo su cargo el cual esta en la universidad. 
Marcelino trabaja con Ceprodel desde hace 4 años y con 5 créditos otorgados hasta la fecha, los cuales ha solicitado para mejoramiento de vivienda
texts.en:
Mr. Gerardo M. L. has worked at Minsa Posoltega for 21 years. He is an ETV technician for the rural sector. He is married with one son under his charge, currently a student at the university. Marcelino has worked with CEPRODEL for 4 years with 5 loans granted to the present, all solicited for the improvement of his house.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MATERIALS FOR HOME IMPROVEMENT (CEMENT, SAND) PLUS LABOR

loans.name: Manilyn

texts.en:
Manilyn A. is from the village of Pugaro Balungao, Pangasinan. She is 23 years old and single. To make a living, Manilyn owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Manilyn is just starting this business.

In 2010, Manilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Manilyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Manilyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Oeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Oeurn V., a 49-year-old resident of Rung village in Takeo Province, owns a plot of land upon which she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Mao Sem, makes a small income to support his family by renting out wedding decorations and speakers to villagers during wedding ceremonies, parties, etc. To improve sound quality, he wants to buy equalizer for his speakers, and so Mrs. Oeurn V. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. This couple does not have any children.

loans.use: To buy an equalizer for her husband's business

loans.name: Eleazar

texts.en:
Eleazar O. is from the village of Estrella, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 63 years old. Eleazar is widowed and has five adult children. To make a living, Eleazar owns & operates a business planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Eleazar has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Eleazar joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eleazar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Eleazar is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Eleazar from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Doña Adela de edad de 34 años, madre de familia de cinco hijos, desde hace varios años, logro poner su negocio, una tienda de abarrote en donde vende una variedad de productos como: granos básicos, frutas, verduras, golosinas, gaseosas y cosmético. Producto de sus ahorros que logro con venta de fritanga y apoyo económico de su esposo el cual se dedica a la venta de cd de música y películas. Este negocio lo tiene en un mercado en donde hizo un pequeño local y se paga a la alcaldía diario una cantidad de dinero. Pero lo que mas desea es poder trasladar su venta a su casa y ahorrar más y con la finalidad de hacerlo mas grande. Con este préstamo lograra la inversión de comprar: arroz, frijoles, azúcar aceite, frutas, verduras, golosinas, gaseosa para reforzar sus venta ya que la demanda es mucha contra los otros comerciante.
texts.en:
Adela is 34 years old. She is the mother of five children. Several years ago, Adela started her own business, a grocery shop where she sells a variety of products such as staple grains, fruit, vegetables, sweets, soft drinks, and cosmetics. She was able to start this business with the money she had saved from the sale of fritanga (fried snacks) as well as thanks to the economic support from her husband, who sells music and video cds. Adela has a small vending post in a market, an arrangement that requires her to pay a daily municipal fee. She would really like to move her vending location to her home so that she could save more, with the goal of further growing her business. This loan would allow her to invest in the purchase of the following items: rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, fruit, vegetables, sweets, and soft drinks. This will allow her to increase her sales and meet the increased demand from other merchants.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grocery store supplies such as staple grains, fruit, vegetables, sweets, soft drinks, and cosmetics

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana R. is from the village of Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 59 years old and married. To earn a living, Luciana owns and operates a business venture in the agricultural sector raising crops. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Luciana has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Luciana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luciana is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Luciana from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure and pesticides.

location.town: Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mrs. Sophal Part Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eight people make up this village bank loan group and they live Kampeaeng Tboung village in TaK. province. Mrs. Sophal P. is the village bank president, selected by all the members who will each use their loan for different purposes. 

She and her husband, Mr. Chan Nung, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate rice on to support their family. Aside from farming, her husband is a cow middleman too. Since her husband’s business is going well, she wants to expand it. So to improve her husband’s business, Mrs. Sophal P. is asking for a loan to buy a cow for resale. She is a mother of five children, two of whom are farmers, while the others are attending local public school.

loans.use: To buy a cow for resale

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene H. is from the village of Little Tadian. She is 25 years old. Arlene is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Arlene owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Arlene is just starting this business.

In 2010, Arlene joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Arlene from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Electrical repairs

loans.name: Mosoc Killa Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Mosoc Killa” actualmente se encuentra en el VII ciclo y está conformado por personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la oficina central de la Asociación Arariwa. 

Las actividades económicas de los algunos de los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo, elaboración de proyectos, preparación de torta, venta de productos de belleza, venta de ropa, venta de artesanía y venta de muebles. Otros socios son por ejemplo son mecánicos y  empleado del viejo bar. 
 
Florentina, tiene 46 años, es casada  y es natural del Cusco.

Florentina nos cuenta. - En mi banco comunal “Mosoc Killa”  somos 16 integrantes y me eligieron a mí como representante del banco comunal para dar mi testimonio de mi actividad económica. Todos mis compañeros del banco comunal son personas, amigables, responsables y sobre todo puntuales al momento de pagar sus cuotas. Yo tengo mi restaurante donde vendo comida, y mis clientes les gusta lo que cocino, el préstamo que requiero es para comprar un saco de arroz pues me está haciendo falta para poder expender mis ricos platos de comida.  Ya son varios años que trabajo con la asociación Arariwa y me ha ido muy bien. Con los préstamos que me dieron y las utilidades que conseguí pude pagar los estudios de mis hijos e hice mantenimiento de mi casa. 

(Los socios Julia, Marco y Elena no están en la foto por que llegaron tarde a la reunión).
texts.en:
The communal bank “Mosoc Killa” is currently in the VII cycle and is shaped by hard working and entrepreneurial people who are looking for opportunities at every moment to get ahead and with their daily efforts they are delivering a better future for their children. The communal bank's meetings are monthly in the central office of the Arariwa Association. The business activities of some of the members are for example, project development, cake making, sale of beauty products, sale of clothing, sale of craftwork and sale of furniture. Other members are for example mechanics and an employee from the old bar. Florentina, is 46, married and is a native of Cusco. Florentina tells us - In my communal bank “Mosoc Killa” there are 16 members and they chose me as the representative of the communal bank to give my testimony of my business activity. All my fellow members of the communal bank are friendly, responsible people and above all are punctual in paying their instalments. I have my restaurant where I sell food, and my customers like what I cook, the loan that I require is to buy a sack of rice as I need it to be able to sell my rich plates of food. It has already been several years that I have worked with the Arariwa Association and it has gone very well for me. With the loans that they have given me and the profits that I obtained I could pay for my children's studies and do maintenance around my house. (The members Julia, Marco and Elena are not in the photo because they arrived late to the meeting).

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sack of rice.

loans.name: Eak

texts.en: Eak S., 32, lives in the Takeo province with her husband and one young child. She makes about USD 5 a day, selling groceries, while her husband makes USD 1.50, selling coffee. She is asking for a loan in the amount of USD 800 to purchase more groceries to expand her current shop. She is also hoping to purchase a pig to raise and sell with the money from the loan. She sees this loan as a great opportunity to expand her business and is confident that she will see her income increase as a result.

loans.use: To increase her grocery inventory.

loans.name: Saginbubu

texts.en:
Saginbubu M. is a 53-year-old widow who is engaged in breeding cattle. She has seven children who help her carry out this activity, which has become an important source of support for the family. Saginbubu has wide experience in animal breeding because she worked as a dairymaid and a stock keeper for a long time. She began her business using her starting capital of 20,000 Kyrgyz Soms to purchase two cows. She milks cows and sells milk to the local dairy factory.  Also, Saginbubu and her children cultivate potatoes on their own plot of land. They fertilize the land to get a rich harvest of high-quality products.
   
Saginbubu is a very responsible and persistent person and works hard in order to improve the family's living conditions. Saginbubu plans to use the loan of 50,000 Kyrgyz Soms to expand her business by purchasing cattle. With the revenues from the loan, Saginbubu plans to purchase a small field engine for tillage. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Alfonso es un pequeño comerciante, que ha logrado tener su propio estudio fotográfico desde hace veinte años, iniciando como trabajador de un canal local del país.
Luego decide independizarse para lograr mejores condiciones personales. Cuando inicio lo hizo con dinero de su liquidación, luego para comprar más equipos necesarios para realizar su labor, hizo un financiamiento el cual fue aprobado.
Ahora es su segundo ciclo en Afodenic lograra invertir en comprar dos sensores de luz flash para vender calidad de servicios.
Gracias al apoyo de la institución y el esfuerzo ha logrado dar mantenimiento, comprar tecnología de punta. Así como tener su propio local de estudio.
texts.en:
Alfonso is a small businessman who established his own photography studio twenty years ago. He started working at a local station in the country. Alfonso later decided to become independent so that he could improve his personal conditions. When he started his business, he used the money from his severance pay to buy the necessary equipment for his work.

Alfonso is in his second loan cycle with AFODENIC. He will invest the proceeds in the purchase of two flashlight sensors so that he can improve the quality of his services. Thanks to the support from AFODENIC and his own efforts, Alfonso has been able to purchase and maintain the latest technology needed to establish his own studio.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two flashlight sensors

loans.name: Meris

texts.es:
La Sra. Meris C. E. vive en el municipio del Viejo.
Ella va a utilizar el credito en la compra de mercadería para ser utilizada en su pulpería, ya que necesita surtirla  para satisfacer a todos sus clientes.

Este es el credito No. 31 que lleva con la Institución de los cuales todos los anteriores los ha cancelado muy bien en tiempo y forma, ya que es una persona muy Responsable y Honesta con todas sus obligaciones.

La Sra. C. E. tiene una edad de 63 años de edad y 15 años de experiencia en el rubro comercial y habita  solamente con su esposo ya que hijos nunca tuvo, pero ella nos ha manifestado que es una persona muy feliz con el y que espera seguir viviendo muchos años mas para manejar su negocio y seguir trabajando con CEPRODEL.
texts.en:
Mrs. Meris C. E. lives in El Viejo. She will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock her store because she needs to stock it better in order to meet customer demand. This is her 31st loan with the Institution and she repaid all the previous ones on time because she’s a very responsible and honest person with respect to her commitments. Mrs. C. E. is 63 years old and has 15 years experience in commerce. She lives only with her husband since she never had children. She tells us that she’s very happy with him and hopes to continue living for many more years to run her business and continue collaborating with CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo sont toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 33 ans et 2 enfants et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Djinina, sous préfecture de Fana, région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage et font le commerce du bois de chauffe, de charbon de bois, de l’arachide et du riz.                                                                                                             
Ces femmes du groupe Djekafo sont à leur premier prêt solidaire.                                                                                        
SITAN S., qui est un des membres du groupe Djekafo compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de l’arachide.
Elle s’approvisionne le plus généralement auprès des producteurs du village et effectue sa vente au village et au marché de Fana, aux transformation en pâte d’arachide, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 75 000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the group named Djekafo are all married and on average they are 33 years old and have 2 chidlren. They live in large traditional families in the village of Djinina in the Fana and Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are known through their family and through neighbours. They sell firewood, wood coal, peanuts and rice. This is a first time loan for the Djekafo group. Sitan S. is one of the members of the Djekafo group and she will use her loan to purchase peanuts. She usually purchases from the producers in the village and she resells in the village and in the market in Fana, after she makes peanut butter from the product. She completes her sales in cash and credit and she sells to a clientele made up of women and men. She foresees a monthly income of 75 FCFA which will be used to cover the family's daily expesnes and the rest will be reinvsted back in the business.

Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase peanuts.

loans.name: Odongerel
