texts.en: Odongerel B. is 41 years old single mother who lives with her two children in the Baganuur, one of the remote district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city. She and her two children live together in an apartment. Her son, Tsolmongerel, is a studies at the Mongolian Science and Technology University while her daughter, Hulan, attends a local high school. Odongerel lets her own garage to others as a renting space where individuals rent and operate a car washing center and wheel repairing center. She has been providing rent service to others for past 6 years and has built s stable and successful operation. In the future, she plans to provide a service of lubricated oil replacement and to sell an accumulator. Her main goal is to provide for her children's education and to help them become a good and responsible person. For the future, she hopes to start her auto repair related business, and is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to increase her working capital by 2,000,000 MNT and to pay her son's accomodation fees at 1,000,000 MNT.

loans.use: To increase working capital and to pay her son's university fees

loans.name: Nighat Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Nighat Perveen is a resident of Gujranwala which is located in Punjab, Pakistan, and is known for its dairy industry. She is a 44-year-old widow who lost her husband as a result of a heart attack a few years ago. It was a very difficult time for her because all responsibilities were now shifted on her shoulders. But she never loses hope and decided to start an embroidery business using skills she learned from her mother as a teenager.

Nighat Perveen couldn’t educate both her sons due to poor financial circumstances, but she taught the art of embroidery to her younger son who now rents a shop in the nearby market and runs an embroidery business. Her eldest son works in a factory for a low income. She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her son’s embroidery business. With the loan, her son will buy an embroidery machine which will enable him to work better and fulfill larger orders on time. Nighat Perveen is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan experience. She hopes that this will be a long-term relationship and she will continue getting Asasah support in the future.

In the photo, the lady who holds a book (an Asasah passbook) in her hands is Nighat Perveen.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Sughran Bashir Ahmad's Group

texts.en:
Sughran lives in a two-roomed brick house in Gujranwala, an industrial city located in Punjab, Pakistan. She is a widow who had great difficulties after the death of her husband. She brought up her four sons and one daughter by doing labor in order to help them be successful in their professions. Her first three sons are cobblers by profession and make shoes by receiving orders from shoe factories and shops. Her youngest son is enrolled in school and is getting an education.
Sughran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her sons' cobbler business. With this loan, they will buy raw materials such as leather, nails and shoe polish in large quantities, which will help them to finish larger orders on time and make more income.
Sughran is hopeful that this loan investment will help her sons in growing their business and increasing their earnings. She is a regular loan user of Kiva partner, Asasah, and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and attended every meeting.
Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called the Asasah passbook) in her hands is Sughran.

loans.use: To buy raw material for shoe making business

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is a forty-six-year-old married man with six children and charged with the responsibility of looking after the family, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has an ambitious goal of ensuring that his family gets all their basic needs and have an income-generating activity for each child.

Elias owns a shop and has a retailing experience of ten years from which he has been able to educate some of his children and also buy land. His intention for this loan is to enable him to purchase sugar, salt, cooking oil, and soap to sell.

loans.use: Purchasing sugar, salt, cooking oil, and soap to sell for a profit

loans.name: Juan María

texts.es:
Juan tiene 35 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a sus cuatro hijos en una zona rural de la localidad de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola que se encuentra situado en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

El cuenta con un buen número de ovejas, cerdos y pavos, los cuales cría en algunos ambientes dentro de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Adicionalmente cuenta con un terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar mango y limón. Con los ingresos que el percibe de estas actividades se encarga de solventar la economía de su familia.

Juan desea ampliar su negocio comprando más animales y alimento balanceado de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas durante esta temporada navideña, que es cuando la demanda por sus animales aumenta, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Juan is 35 years old, is married and lives with his wife and their four children in a rural area of Tambogrande, a farming district in Piura region, which is more than four hours from Chiclayo, the capital city of the Lambayeque region.

He has a number of sheep, pigs and turkeys which he raises in enclosures at home.  When they have reached a good size, he offers them for sale to the general public and to the businessmen who visit the area regularly.  Juan also has a field where he grows mangoes and lemons.  With his income from these activities, he takes it on himself to support his family.

Juan wants to expand his business by buying more animals and balanced feed so he can increase his sales during this Christmas season, when demand for his animals increases.  For this reason he thought it a good idea to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 new soles.

loans.use: Purchase animals to expand his animal growth and sales business

loans.name: Jose Arosman

texts.es:
osé Arosmán de 44 años de edad, habitante de Barrio Linda Vista en Nueva Guinea,  trabaja para el MAGFOR desde hace dos años, su esposa trabaja como administradora de ENACAL,  los dos luchan por el bienestar de su humilde Familia ya que con dedicacion y esfuerzo han podido salir adelante, son personas muy queridas por sus vecinos y amigos. 

Solicita el apoyo de kiva en su tercer crédito para invertirlo en construccion de una habitación y de esta manera tener mejores condiciones en su vivienda,  

Su mayor sueño en la vida tener estabilidad laboral, que su hijo goce de mejores condiciones y que su familia permanezca bien con Dios
texts.en:
José Arosmán is 44 years old and lives in Linda Vista neighborhood in New Guinea. He has worked for MAGFOR for two years. His wife works as an administrator for ENACAL. The two of them fight for the well-being of their humble family since with dedication and effort they have been able to get ahead. They are well loved by their neighbors and friends.

He is requesting the support of Kiva in his third loan, which will be invested in the construction of a room and, in this manner, have better conditions in his home.

His greatest dream in life is to have job stability, that his son enjoys better conditions and that his family remains right with God.

loans.use: House construction.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is a 40-year-old Palestinian housewife and the mother of three daughters and four sons. Most of them are school students. Laila's husband is an employee. To have a second source of income, Laila took out a loan from FATEN to help her husband purchase a larger variety of goods to sell in the grocery store.

Laila's husband, Yahia, appears in the picture above as she is a religious woman and doesn't want her picture on the web.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of goods to sell in the store

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 37 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su esposo y a sus tres menores hijos en el distrito agrícola D. Las Lomas, una localidad situada en la región Piura y ubicada a más D. tres horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta D. bebidas como cerveza y chicha (bebida típica del país hecha a base D. un tipo especial D. harina D. maíz llamada jora). Ella ofrece estas bebidas en su domicilio durante los fines D. semana. Su negocio cuenta con bastante acogida ya que ambas bebidas son bastante populares en la zona. Los ingresos que ella percibe D. estas actividades le sirven para ayudar a su esposo, que es agricultor, con el sostenimiento D. la economía D. su familia.

Rosa desea adquirir más insumos que le permitan ampliar su producción y sus ventas, D., modo que pueda percibir mayores ganancias que le permitan ayudar a su familia a salir adelante. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 500 nuevos soles
texts.en:
Rosa, age 37, is married and lives with her husband and three young children in the Las Lomas agricultural district, located in the Piura region over three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. She sells drinks such as beer and chicha (a typical drink from this country, maD. from a special type of cornflour called jora). She sells these drinks in her home on the weekends. Her business is quite well-received, as both drinks are very popular in the area. She uses the income from this work to help her husband, who is a farmer, with the household costs.

Rosa would like to acquire more supplies that will allow her to expand her production and sales, in order to make a better income, allowing her to help get her family ahead. In order to achieve this goal, she has found it necessary to request a loan of 500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to acquire supplies to increase her production.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa B. is from the village of Bacnor West.  She is 44 years old.  Marissa is married and has 1 school-aged child.  To make a living, Marissa owns and operates a specialized retail store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products such as vegetables in the local community.  Marissa has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marissa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Marissa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  Marissa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Marissa from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her child. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Pentecostes Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Pentecostés se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Tlalnepantla, en el estado de Morelos, México. está conformado por 6 integrantes que son vecinos y conocidos ellos son la señora Antonia A. T. va a comprar con su crédito abono orgánico, fertilizantes químicos para abonar su nopal, la señora Lilia O. F. va a comprar mercancía para surtir su negocio azúcar, huevo por kilo, refrescos, galletas, queso, la señora Aurelia F. Z. va a comprar abono orgánico para fertilizar su nopal, el señor Alberto M. P. va a comprar abono para fertilizar su nopal y tener más producción, la señora Brizaida F. Rodríguez va a comprar abono orgánico para fertilizar su nopal y tener más producción, la señora Irma L. C. va a comprar fertilizantes y abono orgánico para producir su nopal. La señora Lilia O. F. es la representante del grupo, ella tiene 39 años de edad estudio hasta el 3er. año de secundaria tiene su certificado, ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos Ernesto David tiene 8 años de edad y estudia el 3er. año de primaria, Deiry Mariana tiene 9 años de edad y estudia el 4º. Año de primaria, la señora Lilia tiene su tienda de abarrotes y solicito su crédito para surtir su tienda de abarrotes va a comprar café, dulces, huevo, azúcar, refrescos, jugos, galletas, queso, yogurt, crema, papel higiénico, etc. Su negocio lo inicio hace 4 años, como su hermano tiene una tiendita él le prestó y la llevo a la central a comprar mercancía lo más básico, poco a poco fue creciendo a base de préstamos. Su negocio es importante porque de allí va saliendo para los alimentos de sus niños y para ir progresando, la parte favorita de este negocio es atender a sus clientes amablemente y se siente orgullosa de haber logrado este negocio. Al principio pensó que no iba a poder pero si lo consiguió, ella recuerda cuando repellaron el negocio y le pusieron loseta al piso porque se ve más bonito el negocio, sus clientes son las señoras y los niños, su negocio es popular por el buen trato a los clientes, los desafíos que enfrenta el negocio son los costos elevados, pues el negocio está arriba de un cerro y como suben las cosas traen menos mercancía. Las ganancias del negocio las vuelve a invertir, otra parte para la alimentación y para pequeños gastos. La señora Lilia quiere ampliar su negocio le gustaría vender otras cosas como: artículos de papelería, focos, sockets, accesorios de electricidad y lo piensa lograr con otros prestamos que le proporcionen Kiva y Fundación Realidad, le ayudan en la tienda su hija atiende a los clientes despacha, su hijo mete refrescos al refrigerador. Tlalnepantla es un lugar bonito, tranquilo, el paisaje hay montes, muchos árboles, los cerros, se ve el volcán Popocatepec e Iztlacihuath. Su negocio ha ayudado a su familia en la alimentación, su esposo ha hecho más amplia la casa y a tener su carro, las mejorías que desea hacer a su vivienda son echarle colado a la salita y repellarla y construir una cisterna, sus sueños y esperanzas son hacer crecer más su tiendita, vivir mejor que no suframos y que haya para la vejez, ella está feliz con este préstamo porque en base a esto va a aumentar su negocio lo va a surtir, las mejoras que desea lograr par el futuro se sus hijos son que sigan estudiando y que alcancen una carrera para el futuro y vivan bien contentos en armonía y lo piensa lograr aumentando las ganancias y seguirles dando estudio. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “muchas gracias por los prestamos que nos hacen gracias a ustedes podemos salir adelante”.
texts.en:
This community bank is called Pentecostés and is located in the community of Tlalnepantla, in Morelos state in Mexico. It is made up of six members who are neighbors and acquaintances: Señora Antonia A. T. who is going to buy organic and chemical fertilizers to fertilize her nopal (prickly pear cactus); Señora Lilia O. F. who is going to buy goods for her business, including sugar, eggs by the kilo, sodas, cookies and cheese; Señora Aurelia F. Z. who is going to buy organic fertilizer to fertilize her nopal; Señor Alberto M. P. who is going to buy compost to fertilize his nopal so that it produces more; Señora Brizaida F. Rodríguez who is going to buy organic fertilizer to fertilize her nopal in order to increase its produce; and Señora Irma L. C. who will buy fertilizer and organic compost for her nopal. 

Señora Lilia O. F. is the group's representative. She is 39 years old and she graduated third year of secondary school. She is married and has two children: Ernesto David who is eight years old and is in the third year of primary school, and Deiry Mariana who is nine years old and in the fourth year. 

Señora Lilia has a grocery store and is requesting a loan to stock up her store. She is going to buy coffee, candy, eggs, sugar, soft drinks, juices, cookies, cheese, yogurt, cream, toilet paper, etc. She started her business four years ago. Her brother had a small store, so he lent it to her and took her to the market to buy basic goods. Bit by bit, the business has grown through loans. 

Her business is important to her because it provides food for her children and allows them to get on in life. Her favorite part of the business is providing pleasant service to her customers and she is proud to have made this business successful. At first she didn't think she would be able to do it, but she did it. She remembers when they plastered the walls and tiled the floor to make the store look better. Her clientele consists of women and children, and her business is popular due to the good treatment received by customers. The challenges facing the business are high costs, and when costs are high she has less stock. She uses any profit to reinvest in the business and to buy food and pay other small expenses. 

Señora Lilia wants to expand her business to sell other goods such as stationery, light bulbs and electrical accessories, and she intends to achieve this with loans from Kiva  and Fundación Realidadand (Kiva Field Partner). Her children help out in the store: her daughter serves customers and her puts the soft drinks in the refrigerator. Tlalnepantla is a nice quiet place. The landscape has many trees and hills, and you can see the Popocatepetl and Iztlaccihuatl volcanos. 

Her business has helped feed her family. Her husband has extended the house and they have a car. She would like to make improvements to the house such as plastering the living room and building a well. Her hopes and dreams are to grow her store, improve her standard of living and save for her old age. She is happy with this loan because it will allow her to increase her business and buy more stock. For her children's future, she hopes that they continue their studies and have a career, and that they live happily and in harmony. She intends to achieve this by increasing her profits and continuing to pay for their studies. 

Members of the group would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad, "Thank you very much for the loans you provide us with. Thanks to you, we can move forward."

loans.use: To buy eggs, sugar, soft drinks, coffee, candies, juices, cookies, cheese, yogurt, cream and toilet paper

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La señora Bertha Abarca G. Machado es una mujer luchadora, emprendedora y trabajadora quien inicio en el comercio de bisutería etc. luego cuando empezó a trabajar en la zona franca para poder sostener a su familia como ingreso extra se dedicó a vender ropa junto con su hermana. 
Su mayor sueño es superarse tener una pequeña tienda.
texts.en: Mrs. Bertha G. Abarca Machado is a hard working, enterprising, tenacious woman who started out in the costume jewelry, etc. business.  Later, when she started working in the tax-free zone to earn extra income to support her family she started selling clothes with her sister.  Her greatest dream is to improve herself and have a small store.

loans.use: For clothes.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
El comité "Mujeres Valientes" se originó a través de promociones que se hizo en el barrio.
Todas las integrantes son de la misma zona, conocidas y vecinas en San Ignacio.
El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es trabajar en equipo, fomentar el espíritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo D. programa.
La sra. Feliza C. fue la primera interesada en participar D. programa, ella está trabajando como empleada  doméstica y su deseo es trabajar por cuenta propia, ser independiente, para que pueda quedarse a trabajar desde su casa.
Ella pondrá el mayor esfuerzo para que su comité surja y salga adelante, así podrá ejecutar su idea y plan de trabajo: montar una "Chipería (lugar donde fabrican y venden chipas, panificado tradicional D. Paraguay) con sus compañeras D. grupo".
texts.en:
The committee “Mujeres Valientes” (Valiant Women) started as a result of promotional events that were conducted in the neighborhood. All of the members know one another and are neighbors from the same area of San Ignacio. The goal of each member is to work as a team and form a spirit of solidarity so that they can reach the highest level within the program.

Sra. Feliza C. was the first member who was interested in participating in the program. She works as a domestic employee, but wants to work on her own and be independent so that she can stay at home while she works. Feliza will put forth her best effort to see that her committee succeeds and moves forward. The idea she would like to carry out is to establish a “chiperia”, a bakery that produces and sells traditional Paraguayan cheese bread, with her fellow group members.

loans.use: To purchase starch, milk, cheese, flour, and other ingredients for making cheese bread.

loans.name: Sitheavy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sitheavy R., age 39, earns a living by selling grocery items from her home. She and her husband, Mr. Nem Yem, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh with their son and daughter. Both of the children attend school. Mrs. Sitheavy R.'s husband has attained the status of village leader. 

She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for the family to use for commuting.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for the family to use for commuting

loans.name: José Alfredo

texts.es: José Alfredo A. S. de 37 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida Rosa y su pequeño hijo en Tacachico en el departamento de La Libertad. El posee un negocio de joyería en oro, plata y fantasia, ofrece diferentes estilos de cadenas, relojes, pulseras para damas y caballeros, ya tiene mucha clientela pues su carisma y buen servicio atrae a las personas del lugar, José esta orgulloso de su trabajo, pues con el lleva el pan de cada día a su hogar, quiere que su negocio prospere y se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le dé la oportunidad de comprar mayor cantidad de anillos, cadenas, pulseras, entre otros y así tener a la disposición de sus clientes lo que necesiten. Tiene fe que esta fuente de ingreso le permitirá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José Alfredo A. S. is 37 years old.  He lives with his life partner Rosa and his young son in Tacachico, in La Libertad department.  José has a business selling gold and silver jewelry and also costume jewelry.  He offers different styles of chains, watches, and bracelets for men and women.  José has a lot of customers because his charisma and good customer service attract people to his business.  He is proud of his work since it supports his household.  

José would like his business to prosper and so he decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL which would give him the opportunity to buy a larger quantity of rings, chains and bracelets in order to have available the products that his customers need.  He believes that this source of income will allow him to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy rings, chains and bracelets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase extra fresh fish to smoke and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy drinks, cereals, candies, basic grains and bread

loans.name: Sixto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de URUBAMBA, perteneciente a la provincia de URUBAMBA y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Sixto; el tiene 38 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de carpintería, el hace trabajos como mesas, sillas y puertas, el trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m y luego lo vende en forma independiente, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de carpintería. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar madera, pegamento y pintura para hacer las mesas, sillas y puertas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Señor Sixto is a member of the communal bank "Perolniyoc" located in the district and province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco. 

Señor Sixto is 38 years old, lives with his partner and has one child.  He alternates his daily activities with his carpentry business.  He makes things like tables, chairs and doors.  He works from 7:00 am until 5:00 pm and then he sells his products independently.  He wants to expand and improve his carpentry business.  He is requesting a loan to buy wood, glue and paint to make tables, chairs and doors.  

He is happy about the loan and is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: buy wood, glue and paint to make tables, chairs and doors for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Suyapa Concepcion

texts.en: Suyapa lives with her husband in the Valle region of Honduras. For the past 20 years, Suyapa has made a living by preparing and selling freshly made tortillas from her home. She has received a number of loans in the past and has a sound payment history. Suyapa is requesting a loan of Lps. 15,000 with which she will purchase corn, firewood, and a tortilla-making machine.

loans.use: This loan will be used to purchase corn, firewood, and a tortilla-making machine.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a seamstress by profession. She operates her sewing business at her home.  She sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very skillful and receives regular orders every month. Besides her sewing work, she also manages her household responsibilities very efficiently. She is married with three children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. Her husband is a rickshaw driver and provides transport services to the passengers. 
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who will use the loan to repair his rickshaw. His engine is creating problems and needs repair work. Otherwise, it will be seized. He has been providing transport services to his passengers for over many years and Nasreen is confident that after repairing his rickshaw, he will be able to provide better transport services to his passengers and will make a positive impact on his business.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es:
Eulogia nació en la ciudad del Calca (Cusco, Perú) y tiene 47 años de edad. Actualmente, Eulogia vive en la misma hermosa ciudad donde nació junto con su único hijo. Eulogia tiene un pequeña bazar de venta de ropa en el mercado modelo de Calca, ella vende ropa para niños, damas y caballeros. Ya son nueve años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Eulogia requiere el préstamo para comprar zapatos de bebes, ropa de bebe, vestidos  y otra cosas más.

La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Virgen del Carmen” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Eulogia was born in the city of Calca (Cusco, Perú), and she is 47 years old.  Eulogia currently lives with her only child in the same beautiful city where she was born.  

Eulogia has a small bazaar where she sells clothing at the Modelo Mercado (Market) in Calca.  She sells clothes for children, women, and men.  She has had this business for nine years.  It is going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business.

On this occasion Eulogia needs the loan to buy baby shoes, baby clothes, general clothing, and other things.

She is a very responsible and hard-working woman.  These qualities are the reason her colleagues invited her to participate the the Virgen del Carmen Communal Bank with the Asoscicación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy baby shoes, baby clothes, general clothing, and other things.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
This is Lida, 47, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She’s married to Jimmy, a factory worker. She’s a mother of three children who are still students. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for everyday expenses and save for the future of her grandchildren.

Lida operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She is also a rice dealer. Lida earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece or by the kilo. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 240 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, rice and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Lida hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products she needs for her business.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an abaca (fibrous plant) making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 via Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy materials for her abaca business.

Luisa has been in this business for five years. Luisa earns additional income from clothing sales.

Luisa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save sufficient money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for her abaca business.

loans.name: Nemecio

texts.es: El señor Nemesio tiene un puesto de Internet donde realiza transcripciones, investigaciones para estudiantes y universitarios. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de servicio de Internet con mayor rapidez y calidad para ofrecer una versión mejorada a sus clientes. Vive en casa propia  la misma queda ubicada en la zona Pasankeri en la ciudad de La Paz; es divorciado y tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO, y por su espíritu emprendedor recurrimos a los financiadores de Kiva para ayudar a Nemesio.
texts.en:
Sr. Nemesio has an Internet café where high school and college students can come to type up reports and perform research. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy Internet service that is faster and of better quality than what he currently offers to his customers. Nemesio lives in his own home in the District of Pasankeri in the city of La Paz. He is divorced and has two children.

This is the first time he has obtained a loan through IMPRO. Nemesio is being presented to Kiva lenders for assistance because of his enterprising spirit.

loans.use: to buy faster and more reliable Internet service for his customers.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a hardworking and visionary 37-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with two children of whom one is in school. For the past 10 years, he has been selling cereals to make a living. He makes an extra shilling by rearing poultry. Previously he was a hawker. He wants, in the next 5 years, to be a wholesaler. His dream is to own a home in Nairobi. He is requesting a loan of 70000 Kenya shillings to buy beans, maize and rice. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he is now able to save.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and rice

loans.name: 3.9.80 Thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Mrs Quyền works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future.

Quyền is 54 years old and she is married with four children. Quyền is the group leader of the 3.9.80 Thiệu D. solidarity group, which consists of five members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

In 2010, Quyền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Quyền has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Quyền has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Quyền faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Quyền hopes to buy a motorbike. She hopes for her children to find a good job and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es: Nilda tiene 36 años, se destaca por ser una mujer trabajadora. Vive en su propia casa junto a su pareja y dos hijos, Edson de 13 años y Maribel de 08 años, por quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo al que se dedica es la agricultura, pues es una actividad que por trandición su familia lo ha ejercido. Hoy se encarga de labrar la tierra para que sean productivas, en ella cultiva, cacao, café y plátano, productos que son comercializados al por mayor en los centros de acopio de la ciudad de San Francisco. De las ganancias obtenidas lo ha derivado para los gastos de su hogar y para la educación de sus hijos. Por tal razón le pone todo su esfuerzo para continuar con esta labor. Tiene 15 años de experiencia y hasta el momento le resulta difícil tener que transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta su comunidad, ya que es una hora de caminata. En adelante desea comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar la siembra. Este será su 15avo crédito con MFP y espera beneficiarse una vez mas con el apoyo de ustedes para seguir progresando y por tanto se compromete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Con los 2,000 soles, comprará estiércol de animales para luego fertilizar sus tierras.
texts.en: Nilda is 36 years old, and she stands out as a hard-working woman. She lives in her own house together with her partner and her two children, Edson, age 13, and Maribel, age 8, for whom she would like to provide a better quality of life. The work to which she dedicates herself is farming, an activity which her family has traditionally carried out. Today, her focus is working the land to make it productive. She grows cacao, coffee and plantains, products which are sold wholesale at the agricultural warehouses of the city of San Francisco. She has used the earnings she obtains to pay the expenses of her household and to pay for her children's education. For this reason, she is putting all of her efforts into continuing with this work. She has 15 years of experience, and up to this moment it has been difficult for her to transport her products from the farm to her community, since the distance is one hour's walk. In the future, she wants to buy more land to expand her farm. This will be her 15th loan with MFP, and she hopes to benefit once again with the help of all of you to continue making progress. Accordingly, she is committed to making her payments on time. With the 2,000 Peruvian soles, she will buy animal manure which she will use to fertilize her fields.

loans.use: to buy animal manure to fertilize her fields.

loans.name: Baatar

texts.en: Baatar is again requesting a loan to purchase some building materials, especially for a wooden floor and a roof with iron sheets, to make additional adjustments to his house. It is important to finish the house before this winter.

loans.use: To purchase some building materials to make additional adjustments to his house.

loans.name: Yeng

texts.en:
Yeng (in the photo) is a weaver, while her husband, Kung, is a fisherman and drives a motor taxi when he is free. They have been married since 1995 and have one daughter. They live on an island located fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Yeng is asking for another loan of $200 to purchase fishing nets for her husband’s fishing business and buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets for her husband’s fishing business and buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase products for resale (flour, oil, beverages, stock, rice and others)

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es: La socia actualmente ha crecido en su negocio y sin cambiar D. rubro sigue dedicada a la elaboracion D. ricas tortas y bocaditos entre salados y dulces, la socia tambien sigue tejiendo chompas D. lana, con finos acabados y aunque los realiza en sus ratos libres ella siempre tiene su tejido entre manos, la socia es muy cotizada por sus clientes para la elaboracion D. tortas y bocaditos para todo tipo D. reuniones; La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra D. ingredientes, fuentes, productos D. decoracion D. tortas y comprar lanas, botones y tejidos nuevos. La socia desea seguir creciendo y a futuro cercano poner un stand para exhibir sus productos.
texts.en: This member has grown her business and without changing paths. She continues to earn her living making delicious cakes and appetizers, both salty and sweet.  She also has continued knitting wool sweaters with smooth finishing.  Although she makes the sweaters in her free moments, she's always got her knitting in hand.  Guillermina is quite sought-after by her customers to make cakes and appetizers for all kinds of gatherings.  She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients, serving dishes and decorative products for her cakes and to purchase wool, buttons and new fabric.  Guillermina wants to keep growing her business and in the near future have a stand to display her products.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of ingredients, serving dishes and decorative products for her cakes and to purchase wool, buttons and new fabric.

loans.name: Maria Eliberta

texts.es:
La señora Maria Eliberta tiene 53 años de edad,  esta soltera y vive con dos nietos, mismos que le ayudan con los que haceres de la casa, cuando Maria sale sus nietos le atienden el negocio, Maria es una mujer muy trabajadora  y se dedica a varias actividades como ser a la venta de hamacas, ropa usada, cuajada, plásticos y tiene pulpería en su casa, ahi vende abarrotería y refrescos, tambien durante los tiempos libres hace pan y rosquillas. 
Maria es cliente de PRISMA desde hace ya varios ciclos,  a trabajado en forma grupal y actualmente en forma individual, el credito lo utilizara para compra abarroteria y ropa interior.
texts.en:
Maria Eliberta is 53 years old. She is single and lives with two grandchildren, who help her with the household chores. When Maria goes out, her grandchildren cover for her in the business. Maria is a very hard-working woman, and she works at various activities, including selling hammocks, used clothes, cheese and plastic items. She also has a neighborhood store in her home. There, she sells grocery items and soft drinks. During her free time, she also makes bread and doughnuts. 

Maria has been a client with PRISMA for several loan cycles. She has worked on a group basis and is currently taking out an individual loan. She will use the funds from the loan to buy grocery items and undergarments.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and underwear.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es: El señor Teófilo vive en la comunidad de Huaytu perteneciente al municipio de Buena vista desde hace 25 años, no es casado pero convive con la señora Juana tienen 4 hijos y uno de ellos se encuentra estudiando y los otros son pequeños, el señor Teófilo y su señora se dedican a la agricultura, tienen cultivos de café, así como también tienen cultivado el maní para lo cual quieren el préstamo el invertirlo en la compra de fumigadora y el mantenimiento de la  cosecha de su maní, toda la cosecha lo comercializa en el mercado de la localidad,  el Sr. Teófilo es una persona joven y trabajadora se encuentra  agradecido con el préstamo que la institución le otorga.
texts.en: Señor Teófilo has lived for 25 years in Huaytu which belongs to the municipality oif Buena Vista. He isn't married but lives with his partner Señora Juana with whom he has 4 children. One of the children studies whilst the others are young. Señor Teófilo and his partner are farmers and have coffee as well as peanut crops. They want the loan in order to buy a crop-spraying machine and maintain the peanut crop. The entire crop is sold at the local market. Señor Teófilo is a young, hardworking person and is grateful for the loan granted by the institution.

loans.use: to buy a crop-spraying machine and maintain his peanut crop.

loans.name: Sok Heng

texts.en:
Sok Heng is 32-year-old widower. He lives with his mother in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.  

Sok Heng is a Tuk Tuk taxi driver. His old motorbike breaks down often, and he spends a lot of money repairing it. He is asking for his first loan in the amount of $1,000 USD to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy new motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothes for trading purposes.

loans.name: Mandakh

texts.en:
Borrower Mandakh is a 50-year-old woman who lives with her husband in a local ger district without basic infrastructure located in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. She has operated a shoe selling business but now she supports her family by operating a candy selling business at the second largest outdoor market in Mongolia. 

She wants to increase her working capital and improve her business. She is requesting a 2.000.000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase more sweets to sell. 

Furthermore, she wants to increase her business profit and make some changes in her current living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more sweets to sell

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean  is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Mary Jean  has a food shop (sari-sari store) that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Mary Jean  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mary Jean  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is a fishmonger at Kwahinkrom. She buys fresh fish which she smokes and fries for sale. She is married to a farmer and has seven dependents.  Aba has been selling fish for 20 years now. She uses her income to supplement her husband in feeding and clothing their children. Aba will use her loan to buy fresh fish to smoke and fry for sale. She will expand her business with the profit she makes.

loans.use: buy fresh fish to smoke and fry for sale.
